39313949.review:
Положительное или отрицательное воприятие игры зачастую напрямую зависит от того, сколько за эту игру просят денег. Так, даже самая распрекрасная игра за которую попросят 10 000 рублей наверняка получит отрицательный отзыв, ибо за такие деньги и спрос соотвествующий. И наоборот - игре за 50 рубелй простят многое и ждать много не будут.
Я подвожу к тому, что Epistory идеальная игра.. если бы стоила 300 рублей без скидки и 100 рублей на распродаже. За такую цену в ней всё хорошо - зельдообразная бродилка с небычной механикой тайпсима, стиль оригами, музыка - всё хорошо. Времени и денег не жалко.
Но за игру просят 799 рублей. За 799 рубелй мы можем купить Divinity Original Sin 2. И для 799 у Epistory куча проблем и незаслуженно высокий рейтинг, вводящий в заблуждение многих:

-на всю игру всего 5(!) типов мобов, которые только могут быть больше или меньше размером в зависимости от сложности. Такой архаичный прием сейчас даже не всякая мобильная игра себе позволяет. Ни одного босса в игре тоже нет.

-к самому симулятору печатания тоже есть вопросы: бесконечно потярются одни и теже слова - аул, аяз, вал, баул, убой, падеж и так далее, кто играл - тот поймет. Соотвественно практическая ценность игры в обучении набору текста падает сильно.

-в игре за 799р, в её мире должны быть монеты, инвентарь, пара нпс, торговец, пара побочных квестов. Ну как минимум. А мы имеем Epistory, мир которой абсолюнто пустой, в нем нет ни одного персонажа, ни одного квеста, ни одного диалога. В нём нечего делать и потому скучно и одиноко.

-концовка игры настолько тривиальная и избитая, что даже не верится, что её ещё кто-то всерьез может вставлять в игры в наше время, но это уже субъективно.

Итого: ценой до 100 рублей - игра без недостатков, на каждый рубль. За 799 рублей - это игра из лиги на три уровня ниже во всех отношениях, чем другие игры из той же ценовой категории и время на неё тратить я ни в коем случае не советую.

39306071.review:
If the idea interests you, then you WILL enjoy this game. 

There are 4 different styles of typing attack to acquire, and it WILL keep you on your toes, typing insane amounts of words really fast to kill off enemies. The game itself is very satisfying, picking up little clues about why you're there in this world reading the story that is LITERALLY unfolding in front of you, but you can also go back in afterward to complete any nests or pieces you may have missed. On top of that, there is an "Arena" area with four different levels, that is set up for you to go back in and challenge your typing skills through the bug distroying at ever increasing difficulty -as in the game, but this goes on for as long as you want to keep trying to score big. 

Again, PLAY THIS if you even think you'd like it. You wont be dissapointed.

*note, the game says to use EF and JI to move, which is advisable, but it will allow you to use the common WASD controlls as well

curioso, non avevo mai giocato un typing game. Si devono solo digitare sulla tastiera le parole che compaiono sullo schermo per combattere. Se si è scarsini, come me che faccio 30 parole, basta fare uso sapiente delle combo ed è pure più soddisfacente che digitare supervelocemente. 
E' indispensabile comunque sapersi muovere con confidenza sulla tastiera, non è adatto a chi ha bisogno di guardarla per trovare le lettere, quindi non è per imparare da zero, però va bene per migliorarsi giocando.
Carino lo stile grafico "a origami".

At the beginning you have to get used to the mechanics because this game is designed to be played with the keyboard only, but after a while you'll don't even notice this anymore. Epistory is a short and aesthetically pleasing typing game. The world is built from paper and the creators have used a variety  of methods to showcase their artistic style. 
Unfortunately I found the game's narrative a little - simple, and after a while it just became poetic drivel. Though each chapter (new area) brings a great new game mechanic and visual style, the enemy encounters become quite repetitive and a little uninspired compared to the world they're in. 
I'd recommend this for a short and visually pleasing experience and think the 3-4 hours length is pretty much spot on.

39231154.review:
原本是被设定吸引对的，还以为是小时候的打字游戏那种。

然后，进去被纸张构成对的世界吸引住了。
太美了，无论是森林，岩洞，冰川，矿洞，沙漠，空中之城等等，处处都透漏出唯美的气息。

说一下里面的内容，是的，全靠你打字。只要你打字，世界都是你的。

一开始我挺想吐槽下为什么四大能力的拼写是英文而不是相对的中文，后面才觉得这样才不容易和怪物的拼音相冲突（大概吧），虽然我是希望还是变成各个国家语言的版本的好一点。

然后，电的能力最好用，大家可以优先升级这个，还有就是探查宝箱和狐狸移速的。

最后总结的是，画面唯美，剧情穿插满分，温馨，打字打到手抽筋，不会盲打的朋友玩一个小时也学会盲打的好游戏（打字训练器）。(◍´ಲ`◍)

39186345.review:
It is often said that it is harder to convey emotion through gameplay than words or visuals, but Epistory disprove that.

By using the typing as a core mechanic to progress within the game, and carefully choosing the words to type, as a player, we literally "play" the story threads, and can sometimes foreshadow the ending.

Progressing in the game "feels" like reading a book, almost with the tactile sensation of turning the pages. The art style is just perfect, and on top of that, overcoming the waves of enemies by typing fast and switching powers is really rewarding. It is almost as if you can feel the power of the words coming from your tip of your fingers.

Congratulations to the team!

39176120.review:
四小时的流程，大半的成就，对于一个小的独立游戏来说算中规中矩吧。
游戏本身的结构挺简单的，就全程打字，对，打字。战斗，互动全靠打字。
非常厉害的是，中文翻译在翻译文本的同时，把需要输入的字也从英文原文改成了拼音。有些非常拗口的矿物和天气名称我确实没有拼音可能都读不出来。顺带有一个扣分项就是，骰子（touzi）要求输入的却是“saizi”这算是常见的读音错误了然而翻译过程中明显没有注意。

关于章节设定，每个小地图的特点都很强，其中也有很多的暗示性的意向，但我想提的是，这确实是西方产的游戏，那些象征性的物品更加如此。某种意义上来说感触也就少了那么一些。作为一个非西方国家的人来说，要去理解里面的一些物品的含义可能真的会有点困难。特别是冰封的陵墓，以及水晶矿洞和画的关系（西方古代油画的颜料大多都是矿物和生物产物而中国并不如此）还有那个暴风眼。

严格的来说的话，这个游戏的乐趣在于其故事和解密。每个地方都会有碎片一样的信息，稍微拼凑一下就可以凑出大概发生了什么，解密是真的很舒服，虽然对于我这种玩过解密游戏的人来说难度不算非常高，但足够有趣。
此外就是，箱子的设定，密码箱就真的要输入数字密码，而普通的箱子有一些是需要打字，有一些是反复的敲击两个重复的字母，我最喜欢的还是最后一个。输入时反复响起的咔嗒声很好听。

关于故事本身我就不多做讨论了。套路有点明显。而且我还是尽量不要去剧透为妙。
游戏的战斗难度我可能要说一下，这一点把控的算一般，前期还很多有挑战的地方，甚至不注意还会翻车。但到了后期能力强了之后反而没有之前的那么难了。难度递增的曲线有问题可以这么说吧。
还有就是，ice的使用次数远远低于其余的三个（除非强制），可能也是技能设计方面的问题吧，毕竟spark可以大范围的清理所以使用频率很高，fire对于一些有很长一串字但只有两串的怪物有奇效，wind的群体高击退也很好用而且很必要（偶尔会有刷在离你很近的地方的怪）。
那么ice的冰冻效果就很鸡肋了，还不如wind一下子推回去老远。

最后是音乐。怎么说呢，剧情道中音乐的制作都没问题，但战斗音乐却只有一个。而且还很短，还是无限重复。全程大概有近1小时的战斗流程。也就意味着你要听一个BGM重复这么长时间，很腻。

39170237.review:
Ooookay, my high school typing teacher would be so disappointed in me. Actually, that's not true, since I learned on an electric typewriter, rather than a computer keyboard, so 45 wpm was pretty damn good back in the day (that day being 1986). And we guys thought we'd NEVER use typing skills in our lives, ever. Pfft.

What sucks is that this game forces me to go back to school, as it were, and relearn the proper way to type, rather than the insane way I normally do things. Having to do the basics all over again is helpful, though, and at least the game makes typing fun.

Well, when I say "fun", I mean the kind if you like juggling machetes and playing chicken with bullet trains. This game will stress out most folks, but it's still a blast if you keep at it. Plus, the story isn't half-bad. I have to mute the music, since it annoys me quickly, and the voiceover sounds like a friend of mine who used to stay up for 48 hours straight during finals week. Laconic much? Otherwise, I like it.

E2A--Anybody ever play an old typing game called Typing (or Typer, can't recall exactly) Shark? Same concept, different enemies, less forgiving. In harder levels, my name was Chum.

39152456.review:
This game is really different to anything else I've ever played or even seen in passing. Typing is made into a weapon as well as a method for discovery, it's a really great concept! The story is not overly obvious, you have to explore and find the story for yourself and it's great to see that what the narrator says in passing in this eery, calming voiceover has some substance in the life you are exploring.
Levelling up abilities is nice and easy with enough points gathered to make it possible but you do have to decide what you want and plan ahead, no spend thrifts allowed!
Overall, really enjoyable, challenging in a good way and loving the story!
P.S If you think you're a slow typer this will help you improve by miles!

39109880.review:
Epistory is a typing game that lives up to it's name, with an intriguing story telling mechanic that draws you in even with the simple gameplay system. The music helps build on the atmosphere that is well set by the art style, and soon you find your typing skills improving as an added benefit. The voiceover narration fits perfectly along with the explorative motif set by the game. 

Completely recommend the game as a fun tool to improve your typing skills

39107017.review:
[h1]Epistory was most fun I've ever had typing.[/h1]

Fun to play. Beautiful visually! Watching the world literally unfold was a wonderful experience. Typing wasn't as hard as I imagined, but I still suck at it. Difficulty can be made adaptive though. The story isn't polished, but it was enjoyable enough to keep you interested in playing. I appreciated that there was more to the gameplay than just typing. There is some strategy involved as far as which enemies to focus on. I got used to the movement controls very quickly. I beat it in about 6 hours.

There's not much more to say. Soundtrack was lovely as well. No jump scares!

39101413.review:
Enjoyed the game, not sure I would pay more then $10 (that’s what I got it on sale for). It’s a cool concept, type words to kill enemies. I did think the word choice would be cleverer; but that's likely because I haven't played a typing game since I was a kid...if ever. I should have watched the video more closely, because I think my brain came up with cooler concepts, if perhaps harder to execute. 

I believed it would be attack and defense words. For example having a set of words I memorized, and could look up if needed, that summoned a shield. Or words more than just 'Fire' and 'Ice' to switch attack styles, but words like 'cut' and 'slash' to attack or maybe change the power of attack. It should be noted that I greatly enjoyed that I could switch how I attacked and utilize different strategies. They simply aren't the ones I thought I would be using.

The story didn't make any sense until the end. And some of the specific wording was hard to remember because nothing that was said really ticks with you until you're in the last chapter. The story may flow better playing through a 2nd time. I definitely thought I was writing a book, and I believe that's what I'm supposed to think. But you aren't. Not really, though it is a story.

I do recomend this game, even if it's not what I thought I was getting.

39100975.review: I really enjoy playing this game.

39099035.review:
Its a good but not great puzzle game that you can sit down and play for a few hours pretty comfortably to chill out without straining yourself too hard. Pretty graphics even on a low end laptop, and some nice ideas come out of the typing mechanic. Nest fights are fun. 
Few downsides: the story/dialogue is pretty w*nky. I had to turn off the voice acting n account of the cringe but the text is the same and thats pretty bad too. Advice: either use it to tell a story instead of just vague sentences about what our unnamed, personality free protagonist is feeling about the mountains being sad or whatever, or dont bother with it at all. I would have gone with option #2, which would have left some air of mystery. 
Nitpicking - could have done with having a good soundtrack, and sometimes insects seem to ppear out of nowhere.
6.5/10

39094089.review:
[h1]Это было лучшее из всех времён, это было худшее из всех времён.[/h1]

Именно с такими словами нас встречает [b]Epistory - Typing Cronicles[/b], именно такими словами её и следует описать. Во всех возможных значениях. Потому что игра - не для всех.

Будучи "Typing Cronicles", Epistory является игрой-представителем достаточно редкого в настоящие дни жанра [b]Typing[/b]. Это значит, что в игре предстоит набирать текст, а точнее слова, отдельные символы, цифры. Но вы, должно быть, спросите: «А что в этом интересного?». Пожалуй, то, что это [b]всё-таки игра[/b]. Она достаточно проста, не заставляет особо напрягать мозг, но, в то же время, увлекательна и не кажется сколь-нибудь утомительной и надоедливой. В отличие от программ-клавиатурных тренажёров, основная задача которых - увеличить вашу скорость печати, - Epistory создавалась с намерением рассказать историю девочки, покоряющей мир верхом на верном лисе. Клавиатура и скоропечатание - всего лишь способ донести эту историю. 

Несмотря на взыскания некоторых, в игре [b]есть сюжетная линия[/b]. Это не что-то, что раскрывает смысл бытия или способно перевернуть мир, нет. Это короткая и ненавязчивая история о человеческих чувствах, воспоминаниях, жизни. Впрочем, для целостного её понимания нужно взаимодействовать с миром (не только из необходимости убирать камушек с дороги), понимать некоторые символы и, собственно, играть до конца. 

Основное техническое достоинство данной игры - самобытный [b]визуальный стиль[/b], самим разработчиком описываемый как [i]«красивый мир в стиле оригами»[/i]. Оригами тут или нет - вопрос сложный, потому как больше похоже на паперкрафтинг, но суть одна - мир действительно выглядит как бумажный. Дело не только в слегка угловатых модельках - куда большее значение имеет приятная анимация «разворота» каждого нового участка земли: вся поверхность, изначально выглядящая как лист бумаги, буквально на глазах «собирается» в различные объекты окружения. Даже эффекты огня, воды и ветра воспроизведены с помощью «бумаги». 

Несмотря на жанр, игра достаточно милая и обходительная по отношению к игроку. [b]В игру может играть даже «новичок»[/b]. Epistory по ходу игры «наращивает» сложность врагов (вводимых слов) и их количество, но, приправленная магией и простенькой механикой её прокачки, всё равно остаётся посильной почти каждому. В случае же провала (касание врага) игра возвращает вас за мгновение до, без потери прогресса как такового (правда, в случае зачистки ключевых точек, именуемых «гнёздами», придётся начинать сначала). При этом для жаждущих особых ощущений есть функции, усложняющие игру.

К слову, будучи Typing-игрой, Epistory радует [b]обилием языковых режимов[/b] (что также может являться функцией усложнения игры). То есть, серьёзно - тут вам и русский, и китайский, и итальянский! С таким запасом Epistory становится отличным вариантом для тренировки своих навыков скоропечатания на каком-нибудь забугурном языке и подпитки/отработки словарного запаса.

Главный недостаток игры состоит, пожалуй, в том, что, услышав эту историю однажды, вам едва ли захочется услышать её снова. Каких-то дополнительных факторов, подбивающих к повторному прохождению, кроме ачивок или личных намерений потренироваться, попросту нет. Есть аренка, но это всё-таки другое.
Возможно, именно из-за этого отторгает родная цена игры - целых 800 рублей без хвостика!
 - но с относительно часто мелькающей скидкой игра всё-таки достойна приобритения. 

[b]Продолжительность:[/b] 6 часов.

[b]Вердикт:[/b] 
Рекомендуется всем ценителям уникального игрового опыта, сказочной атмосферы и красивой истории о человеческой жизни (супергероев и демонических сил здесь нет).

This is a good game and I think worth the price, at least the "on sale" price for sure.

The game looks nice, the typing works pretty well, there's good variation between areas.

The story seemed boring, but I didn't really pay much attention to it since it comes at you in tiny bits and pieces. 

The level designs don't flow very well in my opinion.  Some of them are straightforward, some are maze-like.  Sometimes I wasn't sure if I was in a puzzle or a maze.  The spark area was particularly bad.  Still not sure if I did it right, but I made it out of there.

There are some annoyances, like if you blast an enemy off the screen using knockback, you can't type the next word.  Same if the camera angle changes and the enemy goes off screen.  I haven't figured out how to exit Arena mode without dying, and the scoreboards don't work for me.

Review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles has a unique art style that sends out a calming vibe at times. The idea is pretty simple, when an enemy appears on your screen, type a word to make it disappear. To many, this might seem like a repetitive child's game. In reality, it is a beautifully designed world where there are multiple different levels (could be compared to dungeon games)  and many upgrades to change up the gameplay or assist you. (Such as the map showing where the chests are)

Reccomendation:
I would not play this game if you are a slow typer, but if you can easily type 4-8 letter words in a second or two, then this should be the right mix of challenging and fun. You don't want to have to constantly look down at your keyboard for too long and end up failing to defeat an enemy.

Note:
This is not just one of those children's learning games where words come up on the screen and the child has to type them correctly. There is a real challenge to this game that some may not be able to work with.

38995035.review:
Finished [b]Epistory[/b] on the 03.Jan.2018 :steamhappy:


[b]Who are the game developers?[/b]
Fishing Cactus ([url=http://www.fishingcactus.com/]Fishing Cactus[/url])


[b]What's the game about?[/b]
Lonely origamy girl rides giant fox through peril and somehow manages to get by using only keyboard to kill enemies while using mouse (??) to navigate game menus.


[b]General feeling after finishing?[/b]
Let's try and finish the arenas...


[b]Story?[/b]
Interesting, narrated by a human (which always makes me happy, that humans actually do stuff!): kind of reminded me of Grant Morrison's Joe the Barbarian (if you've read the book, then this sentence is a spoiler; if you haven't go read it). The ending is unexpected but ties well into the whole narrative.


[b]Gameplay?[/b]
You move from a central hub world to several different smaller worlds, in an origami-like almost-open-kinda-world using only your keyboard. Kill enemies by typing whatever letters are floating above their heads (I played the English version, but the game is moddable, and there are number-only variants), use your powers Ice Wind Spark Fire and upgrade your "character", by also typing the upgrade names. :D If it weren't for the story, I'm sure gameplay-wise I'd be bored about 10 minutes into it.


[b]Graphics?[/b]
The world unfolds as an origami :P. Visually it is stunning!


[b]Sound & Music?[/b]
Ties well into the game, especially the narration, and the whole "boss" scenes (you type you're way out of difficult situations). Overall it's not exaggerated, and this is always a plus.


[b]Replayability?[/b]
Sure, I want to type better. And the arenas are also part of this, which makes for an interesting continuation. Let's see if these guys can pull off a sequel (I'm not saying I'm waiting or hoping for one, but it sure would be interesting, especially if all you had to do was move your mouse wheel, for example).


[b]Time played?[/b]
Around 7 hours.

38988138.review:
First of all, you'll need to be a decent typist to really appreciate this game, so, unfortunately, if that description doesn't fit you, you might want to look elsewhere. If that does fit you, prepare for an emotional story read to you by a talented female voice actor, a rich and expansive world that unfurls before you like pages of a book, music that draws you into each situation, puzzles that are just the right amount of difficult as to be fun, and difficulty that increases to challenge even the most seasoned typists. When you're done with the story mode, there's an arena mode waiting for you so you can compete on leaderboards.

I'm glad I bought it. Time well spent.

38975516.review:
Bought this game as a holiday companion yesterday. Now i am addicted, played a continuous 6h session.

This game offer a unique approach as its mechanic - typing - instead of usual clicks or keys combo. Each action performed done by typing certain words. For example planting flowers, cracking down rocks and trunk, setting enemy on fire, etc. This can be a very satisfying experience for mechanical keyboard lover. Listen and feel our lovely keyboard as adventuring through this game's beautifully drawn world is really something. 

Graphics wise, a fantastically done art fits game's world. Basically they put some artistic texture models and use them to create entire world (that's why this game only take up 1 GB space despite how big the world is) - not a bad thing btw, just say they did it in a very correct way. 
Story is made insteresting because not only it's told out loud, but also its transcript is engraved in world's terrains as we progressed through the game. To complete the package i should say that the soundtracks were simply amazing. done.

I actually very recommend this to mechanical keyboard lovers. :D

10/10

38966664.review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]推薦程度[/th]
        [th]★★★★[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]有無中文[/th]
        [th]官方簡體[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1]陪同小女孩與她的狐狸伙伴，進入故事書般的世界，透過「打字」展開一場奇幻冒險。[/h1] 

紙境奇緣是一款以打字（英打、中文羅馬拼音）為主要玩法的冒險遊戲，其中還包含了一些簡單的解謎元素；在遊戲中伴隨著優美的畫面與配樂，前往岩洞、森林、城市、雪地、沙漠...等地方探索，藉由生動的旁白，一步步解開故事的真相。

[b]柔和的畫面與溫和的旁白，夢幻般的冒險！[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1243215270


[h1]遊戲特色[/h1]
獨特、摺紙般的美術風格，讓畫面更生動，更像是在一本故事書裡面冒險！在打字玩法的基礎上，加入了一點RPG要素。小女孩將隨劇情掌握不同元素的打字能力，操作火、冰、雷與風等四種元素，擊敗不同種類的敵人；在打字過程中累積經驗、升級，獲得新的技能點數，用來強化元素、打字與狐狸的能力。

戰鬥相似塔防的玩法，小女孩與狐狸站定一個點，周圍會不斷出怪，透過打字擊殺怪物，要守住一定的波次後，即可通過這關。整體來說戰鬥有一點難度與挑戰，尤其是學習多種元素能力後，會需要適時的切換不同屬性，來對應不同屬性的敵人，使得打字過程不會太過枯燥。

[b]戰鬥不是只有單純打字，要觀四方，隨時切換能力應對[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1244328305


[h1]優點：[/h1]
[olist]
    [*] 摺紙美術精緻、漂亮！
    [*] 戰鬥、解謎過程有趣。
    [*] 可以練習英文打字，或（中文）羅馬拼音。
    [*] 故事清新，呈現方式很特別。
[/olist]

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
[olist]
    [*] 定點戰鬥中不能暫停，一場可能5～10分鐘，手會很酸...囧
    [*] 有小BUG，有時候敵人頭上不會出現文字（無法擊殺）
[/olist]

[b]難度隨你的打字速度決定，如果覺得太難，一直死就會降低難度了（誤）[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1248465517


[h1]結論：如果想練習英打，這是一款不錯的選擇。[/h1]

遊戲選簡體語言時，預設是以看中文，然後輸入羅馬拼音的方式進行，如果不習慣的人，可以進入設定中調成英文，然後如果你想練習法文、德文、義大利文，也有相對應的選項！XD

38923152.review:
Wow! The atmosphere of this game is just beautiful. It really is a work of art. The audio and visuals alone fill you with a range of emotions. It really feels magical. The world literally unfolds before you as you play. It appears to be made out of paper like the pages of a book coming to life. Trust me- you'll feel like you're actually in the story and won't want to leave the pages.

You play as a girl riding her fox companion. As you adventure, you'll discover new lands and new abilities. You learn magic skills (fire, ice, wind, spark) to unlock new areas and defeat new creatures. You battle these creatures by typing words. Unique, right? The words relate to what you're targeting- they can be literal or emotional- and the process of battling and defeating those negative words is actually a bit therapeutic. It starts out slow so you get the hang of it. It then becomes more difficult at just the right pace to keep it fun and challenging as the game progresses. Even if you're quite skilled at typing, you will still find some of the battles challenging. The controls of the game are smooth, easy to learn and not frustrating at all.

The story is somewhat of a mystery. It keeps you guessing as you play, giving you only glimpses of the girl's story on the pages as they unfold. It's poetic. The narrative is done beautifully- the woman's voice is soothing, emotional and fits the character and atmosphere. Honestly though, I don't believe the story is the main focus of the game. I still don't know what the story was precisely about. I feel like it may be open to interpretation but still leaves you content with the ending. The only issue you'll have is that it will be over and you'll want to play more!

Also, the song during the credits is one you'll want to sit back and listen to at the end of your journey. I would definitely recommend this game.

38908614.review:
Un gioco carino con una bella grafica; è tutto incentrato nell'esplorazione dei vari ambienti, negli scontri con i mostri e nella scoperta della storia, che rimane quasi interamente un mistero fino alla fine.
Il gameplay è piuttosto semplice: bisogna esplorare i vari ambienti e farsi avanti scrivendo le parole necessarie per sbloccare ingressi, sconfiggere mostri e attivare meccanismi. Più parole si scrivono, più potenziamenti si possono ottenere; man mano che si va avanti nel gioco diventa tutto sempre più difficile, perciò consiglio l'acquisto soltanto a chi riesce a scrivere al computer senza aver bisogno di guardare la tastiera. La difficoltà si regola in automatico a seconda dell'abilità del giocatore rilevata dal programma, ma si possono sempre modificare le opzioni e regolare la difficoltà di gioco come si preferisce, su una scala da "molto facile" a "folle".
Vorrei parlare un po' anche della storia, ma è esattamente quella la cosa da scoprire durante il gioco: all'inizio la mappa è letteralmente vuota e non si ha nessun indizio su come la protagonista sia finita a cavalcare una volpe a tre code gigante in mezzo al nulla assoluto.
Anche se il tempo di gioco è stato piuttosto breve, mi sono molto divertita a giocare. Decisamente consigliato.

38898698.review: It's not only your typing speed that is tested but also your perception, quick decision making, and  ability to stay calm in a tough situation. As you get further in the game prioritizing the right target becomes extremely important and the different elements you can add to your attacks make the game really tactical. Fire gradually burns the next word, ice freezes the opponent, etc. If you thought that you could beat this game with high kpm alone then I'm sad to inform you, that is not the case. High kpm is still very important though and I would not recommend this game to anyone who can't touch-type fast.

38896235.review:
Just to let you know, I like to type and have a pretty descent wpm typing rate. That being said, there were moments in this game--particularly during and after dealing with corrupted nests--that I cursed the speed in which I had to type. So those of you out there who aren't very good with typing fast and under pressure, you may not have a good time with this.

That aside, I loved playing this game and watching as the story unfolded.

One thing I'd like to point out is that I finished the game without completing all the dungeons. I unintentionally skipped the Crystalline Mine while I was going around revealing the world map and accidentally triggered the Lost Desert. I didn't even realize that the Lost Desert led to the ending of the game. Had I known, I would have avoided that area like the plague. Knowing that I didn't complete Crystalline Mine before the game's end made me feel like I had missed a chapter in the story--like I finished the game without finishing the game, if that makes any sense.

Considering how the history of the main character was revealed in segments that could be unveiled in almost any order, it was a bit disjointed, though that makes sense as the [spoiler]main character is dreaming while in a coma[/spoiler]. To be honest, I'm able to recall more of the gameplay than the story, which I really hate saying.

Seriously though, I did enjoy this game. I love the artwork and how the whole world is made up of paper--the level design is pretty cool. I really liked the narration, too. Despite my complaining about how hard it is, the gameplay is fun and the keyboard controls are rarely the reason for my frustrations [strike]they're mostly just my flustered typing errors[/strike]. The perks of each magic type are all really cool in their execution and very handy during mob fights--lightning by far is my favorite with ice being second.

I have since finished all the dungeons and am planning to complete all the corrupted nests on the world map. I'm glad I get to experience more of this game even though I've beat it. I'm kinda sad that I won't have anything else to do once I'm done [strike]maybe I'll restart and pay more attention to the story next time[/strike].

If you like a typing challenge, you're gonna like this game. [strike]I don't now if it's worth full-price, though.[/strike]

主线剧情长度适中，通关后可以去竞技场练手速。是说我看到一个头顶着“适度游戏益脑过度游戏伤身合理安排时间享受健康生活”的虫子施施然向我爬来的时候真的，目瞪口呆……

38879345.review:
[h1]Grandiosa gema oculta![/h1]

[u]Sinopsis:[/u]
Encarnamos a una chica que viaja sobre un gran zorro... nuestra misión consiste en limpiar los bosques de insectos

[u]Jugabilidad:[/u]
los únicos botones necesarios son la dirección (puedes jugar con WASD o las flechas) y la barra espaciadora (entrar o salir de modo escritura) ... absolutamente todo el combate se controla tipeando palabras (ojo, debes tipear rápido y con pocos o ningún error)

[u]Performance:[/u]
los requisitos de sistema son relativamente bajos... el juego corre perfecto a 60+ fps constantes, sin tirones, sin crashes


[u]Positivos:[/u]
+ Hermosos gráficos estilo origami (vista en 3ra persona, isométrico)
+ Muy buen apartado sonoro
+ No es un juego difícil... claro, para mí, que tecleo bastante rápido
+ Tiene algunos puzzles pero son bastante sencillos
+ El mapa diseñado al estilo origami se va abriendo a medida que lo exploras. El texto se va dibujando sobre el mapa para contarte la historia de la protagonista
+ Muchos nidos de insectos (peleas contra jefes) y muchos items coleccionables dispersos por todo el mundo
+ En el transcurso de la historia desbloqueas 4 tipos de magia: Fuego, aire, rayo, y hielo
+ Experiencia y puntos de habilidades para mejorar tu personaje y su montura
+ Historia (o campaña, como gustes llamarle) y modo Arena (donde combates hordas infinitas hasta morir)
+ Se puede cambiar independientemente el idioma de voz, textos en pantalla, y del diccionario de palabras
+ 55 logros que te harán sudar tipeando
+ Cromos y soporte de Steam Workshop


[u]Negativos:[/u]
- Cuando el zorro se desliza sobre hielo, es incontrolable... algunos puzzles requieren un timing especial, y ese zorro loquillo me saca de mis casillas

[u]Neutral:[/u]
* En lugar de asignar un botón para cada tipo de magia, debes tipear por ejemplo "fuego"... eso te hará perder tiempo valioso... al menos yo no he visto que se pueda asignar una tecla a cada magia
* Si juegas en español, las palabras pueden contener acentos... eso te puede dificultar un poco las cosas.. recomiendo jugarlo al menos con el diccionario en inglés

38863799.review: I am a sucker for typing games, and this is a really good one. This is sort of Typing of the Bastion/Zelda. I was impressed by how many clever ways they managed to make typing interesting. It's a sort of Zelda-like beat-the-dungeon-with-puzzles setup that is challenging but never too difficult or too much backtracking. The powers are interesting, though you'll definitely use one or two of them more than the others. The only real con was the story - the final scene made me yell at my monitor in anger. Such shitty, lazy story telling to cap off what could have been a really interesting finale. The story was such a small part of the really fun game that I didn't care too much. The achievements were really fun to track down too. To sum it up, this is a remarkably fun and clever game and I highly recommend it.

I have no words, playing this game with a mechanical keyboard is an insane comfort and enjoyment.

Beautiful. This is ART, they morphed a game into aethestics.

Level design is interesting, the only thing you do is typing. Nothing else, and by typing, you defeat monsters in the way and prevent them from hurting you. Although I have not once gotten bitten by lurkers of darkness... but the intensity is real. When you enter boss fights--basically stand still, type and hit off monsters coming from all angles, you need to understand the mechanism in the game so that you can beat them all at once and not get overwhlemed.

The combination of art and music makes this game one of a kind. The birdsight camera and the marvellous formation of landscapes wow whomever entered the game. 

The story is very "poetic", I have not finished the game yet, somehow I suspect that the whole fantasy world in this game is a novel that the woman on the fox is writing. And it possibly consists of her life and stories revolved.

And the localization in this game is insane. Any language you selected is fit strictly into the language vocabulary. For example, in English you type English words. In Chinese you type Chinese words with pinyin. Japanese you type Japanese roman characters. Japanese and Chinese would display actual characters. Languages like French and German would let you simply type French or German words.

Another big thing I wanna talk about is the actual vocabulary in this game you need to type. When it comes to frosty rivers you need to freeze, all words would be ice-related. Such as blizzard, hyperthermia, cold...... And when it is woods that you need to burn, it would be lava, heat etc. Also the written language in this game is very beautiful, at least for English. [i]Some proper English.[/i]

This is a game specifically designed for PC, only keyboard and mouse can enjoy such typing feast. 

If you are bored in a Sunday afternoon, this is the perfect game for you to sit back, relax and type a little on your Mac or Windows laptop.

38838645.review:
I really wanted to love this game, but sadly finished it with a lukewarm feeling. I didn't hate it, and I would still recommend playing it, but I feel like some aspects are lacking.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list][*] Beautiful visual design concept that is also well executed.
[*] Sound effects on point that really fit in with the visual concept.
[*] Eerie music that really sets in the mood.
[*] Ingenious gameplay that helps one tune in their touch type skills.
[*] Nice visual effects in line with the narration.
[*] Adjustable gameplay difficulty and the option to set a different language to type than the one used in the game itself.[/list]
[h1]The Neutral[/h1]
[list][*] It's a fairly short game for the price (6.5 hours for a slow, thorough play), I'd recommend waiting for a sale to buy.
[*] The game alternates between being fairly hard and fairly easy, the difficulty isn't very uniform.
[*] There is an order of progression between the levels, but the game doesn't really guide you through it, and you might find yourself unlocking zones before you have the necessary power type to go through them.
[*] Don't get this game if you don't know how to touch type or are a relative beginner. I am a fairly fast typer, just a shy bit under 90 words per minute, and I found this game difficult on some occasions even on the lowest difficulty setting.[/list]
[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list][*] For a game called Epi[b]story[/b], there isn't much story to it at all. All you know is you've lost your memories until the very end.
[*] About the end: [spoiler]I found the "it was only a dream" end to be extremely disappointing. It felt like they only needed an excuse to get the game to make sense, because it didn't make much sense until then. It would've been much richer had they decided to make the fictional universe the "reality" of the game instead of making it a dream.[/spoiler]
[*] I found the narration to be very bland and disappointing. It felt very artificial and didn't bring much to the "story".[/list]

Long story short, it's a very beautiful game but I found it severely lacking in the story and character building department, the only character being devoid of any actual depth. It's a 3/5 for me.

What a beautiful and challenging surprise! I teach 5th and 6th grade business/tech courses, and initially purchased this to see if it would be a good fit for my students after they finish their assignments. 38801591.review:
Epistory is a charming typing game. I really enjoyed the visual style; the game world is made of paper and the world unfolds beautifully like pages on a book. The soundtrack is lovely and the game is easy to play, yet the boss battles felt pretty intense. You don't just get to mash buttons; as the game progresses you unlock elemental powers that you can use to your advantage, so it's basically typing with a twist.

I thougt this would be one of those cute but really short indie games, but there was actually a decent amount of content! Definitely worth a thumbs up!

The only thing I didn't enjoy that much was the narration. I quickly grew tired of how pointless it was: Oh, the protagonist has to go on, but they can't, but they must, but they really feel like they can't, yet they try, and everything's messed up, and the trees are sad, and the sun is high, and it's hot. It was so sweet and whimsical it gave me a rash!

38783060.review:
Naprawdę ciekawa gra. W Epistory rozgrywka znacznie rożni się od tej znanej nam z innych gier. Przede wszystkim jest to bardzo dobry nauczyciel szybkiego (i bezbłędnego) pisania na klawiaturze, gdyż walka odbywa się tutaj na zasadzie wpisywania na klawiaturze odpowiednich wyrazów, aby pokonać przeciwników, im potężniejszy przeciwnik tym wyraz pokonujący go jest dłuższy i bardziej skomplikowany. Może nie wydaje się to jakieś specjalnie trudne, ale jeśli jest się atakowanym z kilku stron jednocześnie i trzeba eliminować po kolei (gdyż trzeba wykończyć przeciwnika aby móc zabrać się za następnego, nie można go zignorować gdy już zaczęło się wpisywać jego "hasło") to dla wielu może to okazać się wyzwaniem, szczególnie jak chce się jeszcze to zrobić bezbłędnie. 

Występują tu elementy RPG, ale to to raczej głównie gra przygodowa w której zwiedzamy świat i poznajemy historię. RPG to tutaj zdobywanie doświadczenia i jako takie rozwijanie swojej postać, które polega na wybieraniu nowych umiejętności jak np: szybsza prędkość poruszania się czy dłuższy czas na wykonania "kombo" pisanymi wyrazami. 

Warto wspomnieć jeszcze o oprawie audiowizualnej, które jest tutaj jednym z najmocniejszych elementów gry. Grafika jest raczej prosta, ale jednocześnie przepiękna, bardzo fajnie się patrzy na otaczający świat i zachodzące w nim zmiany. Natomiast muzyka jest bardzo relaksująca co umila rozgrywkę.

Jest to bardzo dobry tytuł i myślę że warto spróbować bo jest zawsze coś nowego!

This game is story rich, aesthetically pleasing, challenging and most importantly, worth a playthrough. 
I spent about an afternoon or so playing through the story and clearing most of the nests before coming to the ending. 
Have to say, I really didn't see the ending coming. This game progressively told a story through the words you have to type, and the places you discover. The music was great, the vocabulary is pretty large, and the leveling system feels balanced. There were some times that the puzzles wouldn't unlock, even though I was doing everything right. If this happens to you, just wait a few seconds, do it again, and it'll work. 
My only gripe with this game is that when you're clearing a nest (or doing one that forces the progression of the story) the time between enemies can be pretty annoying. Oh and, theres a nest near the middle (?) of the map that has this one snake thing come at you towards the end of the barage. I SHIT YOU NOT THEY MAKE YOU TYPE A 30 SOMETHING LETTER LONG WORD. I actually yelled when I saw the 'word', then died shortly thereafter. If that piece of shit was an actual dictionary word, then I'm Gabe Newell.

Overall: Quick, immersive, fun game that challenges your typing skill and attention to detail.
8/10 would totally play again! Except for that snake, FUCK YOU SNAKE

38702158.review:
A good game, with a beautiful story and simple yet beautiful graphics.


[Before you read the whole review, I can simply say: Explore it for yourself - it's a beautiful game, if - of course - you like some simple graphics]



But first the element, which makes this game special in my eyes:
Prepare to set your fingers aflame as you have to type words to defeat your enemies. Larger the creatures, the longer and more complex get the words you have to type in (e.g. Hypnophobia). A little spoiler: [spoiler]I noticed that 90% of the words on the foes are mostly things which could stress a human or influence a human in a negative way (e.g. homework, lack of sleep, phobias, doubts, etc.) - but don't worry about that. The story - as far as I played it - isn't dark or gruesome[/spoiler].

The graphic lets the game look like paperworks – the ground you're moving on is supported by books and gets "unfolded" when you explore around – and this is quite beautiful and unique (to me, atleast).

The story is told by a narrator and some texts appear in specific areas of the game world – dungeons, caves, etc. – and tells about a girl riding a fox [spoiler]and struggling against various things - as far as I've got it.[/spoiler].

You can explore the world of this game, open up secret paths or even shortcuts to various locations by simply removing the obstruction items by – you could've guessed it – typing.

BUT that's not everything yet – but I won't list everything here as you have to explore it for yourself.

38694424.review:
[i]Beautiful game!
Not only in its papery presentation and nice graphics, but also mechanics and storytelling wise.[/i]

The game is all about typing, you do everything with it, even controlling the menus. What might sound boring at first, turns out to be a nice change of pace, as it was perfectly balanced into mechanics and overall gameplay.
You still travel through a beautiful world, fight off enemies (insects/bugs mostly) with different elemental magic and solve (easy) puzzles.

But everything you do is by typing:
* Instead of WASD you use EFJI -> To keep your fingers on 10-finger-system main keys
* To attack a foe, you type a word that appears above him
* You solve puzzles by walking over things or typing the words above levers, icy planes, flamable bushes etc.
* To use different kind of elemental magic, you type the one you want to use (fire), all following words use that element now
* To open treasure chests, you type the words above them
* .... you get it :)

Storytelling is also pretty atmopsheric:
Beside audio narration, the story gets written onto the ground.
Also the story turns out to be somewhat deeper as one might expect in the beginning (took me a while to figure out where it is going).


[b]PROS:[/b]
* Papery Graphics
* Good learning curve
* Skilltree, combos etc
* Nice story
* You learn to type better
* Feels cool to burn enemies by writing

[b]CONS:[/b]
* You should at least be somewhat able to type without looking at your keyboard. Doesn't have to be fast, as the game self adjusts and gets easier if you die often, but I guess a 2-finger-writer will need some patience and willingness to learn at the beginning

[b]NOTE:[/b]
* About 8hours playing time. Not that much, but fair for the asked price in my opinion


Can really recommend this one as I did enjoy every hour of playing.

38585674.review:
엔딩까지 클리어

1. 그래픽
 굳이 말하자면 투박한 그래픽.
 하지만 그런 그래픽이 게임의 분위기에 잘 녹아들어 매우 어울린다고 생각된다.
 요즘에 꽤나 눈에 보이는 형식의 그래픽이라 이 게임만의 특성이라긴 힘들듯.

2. 플레이 타임
 영타에 자신있는 사람이라면 5시간내 엔딩보는게 가능할듯 하다.
 도전과제 역시 단순 반복 노가다를 제외하고 맵에있는 모든것을 보는게 엔딩후 한시간내 가능.

3. 스토리
 요즘 다른 rpg들에서 공들인 스토리에 비교하면 사실 좀 단순.
 정교하게 짜여진 복선과 스토리를 원하는 사람들은 싫어할법한 눈에 보이는 스토리.

4. 사운드
 전체적인 음악은 게임 분위기에 매우 잘 맞게 느껴짐.
 책 펼쳐지는 소리가 꽤나 듣기 좋다.

5. 게임성
 타이핑 rpg의 한계를 명확히 보여줌.
 rpg게임의 즐길 요소중 하나인 캐릭터의 성장이 거의 눈에 뜨지 않는다.
 게임내에서 아무리 노가다를 하고 스킬을 다 찍어도 결국 본인의 영타실력이 더 중요.

6. 난이도
 영타를 아예 안쳐본게 아닌 이상 클리어 가능(물론 상당히 버거운 부분도 있지만).
 부족한 타자속도를 속성조절을 통해 조금 메꿀수 있다.
 게임내 퍼즐 요소는 난이도 있는 장애물이라기 보단 일종의 장식품같은 느낌으로 등장.
 따라서 퍼즐에 막힐 이유는 사실상 없다.

Una aventura muy original. Todos los aspectos del juego está muy cuidados y responden a una misma idea que los desarrolladores quieren transmitir. Es el ejemplo perfecto de cómo narrativa, arte, diseño y gameplay responden a una misma idea formando un entramado complejo y correcto.

Además añade logros y desafíos a la historia que aumentan cosiderablemente el tiempo de juego.

Quizás el único punto en contra sea la traducción de algunas palabras a otros idiomas. En el caso de idiomas con más tipos de tildes y/o carácteres especiales en el teclado, el nivel de dificultad podría aumentar. 38563880.review: 首先画风加分，我个人是很喜欢这种简约的铅绘风格，而且显的精致而不是粗糙。打字游戏在steam可算是一股清流，对于享受疯狂打字的人来说应该算不错，可惜游戏指引做的不太满意。按下空格的指引触发的条件不知道是什么，想找剧情的时候不触发，结果我先开了第四章节，才找到第三章节。还有就是这自适应，刚开始我简直怀疑人生。满脑子：现在的人打字都这么快的？？？键盘按的手指酸感觉都要飞起，满屏幕的怪，后来发现原来有个自适应，我果断调成[spoiler]困难（不是故意装，谁让你看了呢emmm）	[/spoiler]终于能过了。剧情并没怎么看，纯粹享受极限打字的操作过程罢了，原价感觉略贵，打折31入还算可以。BUG还是有，比如这个恩，上面显示是N，但是按上去没反应，还碰到过一只头上是西，但是没有拼音，你就打不到他，他也不打你，卡死只能强退。突然还发现这个多音字也是难搞，地这个字发音永远是di。明明de的啊，我刷JJC就被这个字卡死

38461666.review:
[h1]Balade onirique au pays du typing[/h1]

[i]Pour jouer à un jeu il est nécessaire le plus souvent de posséder le combo clavier souris ou a défaut une manette de jeu. Et bien ce n'est pas le cas pour les jeux de typing, eux ne nécessitent qu'un clavier pour écrire des mots. Epistory se base entièrement sur cette mécanique de jeu mais contrairement à beaucoup d'autres de son genre il tente aussi de développer un univers.[/i]   

[b][u]Mécaniques de jeu[/u][/b] 

La souris n'est jamais nécessaire en jeu. En effet, la navigation dans les menus, les déplacements et les combats s'effectuent à l'aide de mots qu'il faudra écrire. Les déplacements se déroulent de façon classique avec ZQSD mais il est aussi possible de se mouvoir avec les touches EFIJ pour avoir un accès plus rapide aux autres lettres si un ennemi surgit. Les ennemis ont des mots au dessus d'eux qu'il faudra taper pour les tuer, le plus souvent ce sont des mots courts mais parfois, lors des fins de donjons par exemple il est possible de tomber sur des mots longs comme "Occidentalisation" à écrire en quelques secondes. Créant des moments de tension forts où il faudra se concentrer pour être le plus rapide possible. 

Heureusement, la difficulté du jeu est adaptative. Les ennemis iront à une vitesse qui vous permettra d'avoir le temps de les tuer quelle que soit votre dextérité avec un clavier. De plus, on possède des sorts que l'on débloque au fil de l'aventure. Ces derniers rendent les combats plus simples et demandent parfois de réfléchir rapidement à une stratégie pour tuer le plus efficacement possible les nombreux ennemis qui nous foncent dessus. Il y a en tout 4 sorts que je ne vous donnerai pas ici pour garder un peu de surprise. Mais ils fonctionnent tous très différemment et s'utiliseront dans des cas tout aussi différents. Parfois les ennemis seront de la couleur d'un sort, il faudra alors le tuer avec le sort correspondant sachant que changer de sort demande d'écrire son nom ce qui ajoute encore des lettres à taper. Même si des efforts ont été fait pour que le gameplay ne soit pas redondant (comme des puzzles et des collectables dans les donjons) ce n'est pas suffisant. Il faut donc mieux jouer à Epistory en courte session pour ne pas avoir le temps de s'ennuyer. 

Ecrire un mot que ce soit en détruisant un objet, en tuant un ennemi ou en ouvrant un coffre donne de l'expérience qui permet ensuite d'améliorer les caractéristiques de notre avatar et d'agrandir la carte et ainsi d'avancer dans l'histoire. 

[u][b]Univers [/b][/u]

Nous incarnons une jeune fille qui avec l'aide d'un renard à trois queues essaie de chasser la corruption qui détruit le monde. Qui est-elle ? Pourquoi est-elle avec ce renard ? Pourquoi le monde est-il corrompu ? Sont des questions que l'on se posse tout le long de l'aventure mais qu'elle se pose aussi. Elle semble perdue. Une voix nous guide, elle nous raconte l'histoire et décrit ce qui nous entoure à la manière d'un conte.  Des phrases apparaissent le long de notre chemin sur le décor de papier qui se dévoile en se dépliant.  

La forêt, la montagne, le désert, les villages que l'on traverse sont remplis de vie. De nombreux animaux les peuplent mais aucun humain n'est présent. Il ne reste que des ruines comme s'ils avaient été chassé par la nature qui se déchaine. Les catastrophes naturelles amènent la corruption et nous devons chasser tous les insectes en parcourant le donjon qui y est lié afin de ramener la paix. La BO accompagne parfaitement tous les moments importants du jeu mais par moments elle se fait trop discrète. On aimerait l'entendre plus tant elle est plaisante à écouter.  

La fin est assez surprenante et peut paraître assez cliché au premier abord pourtant lorsque l'on prend le temps d'y penser elle fait sens avec toute l'histoire. 

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]

[b]Une mécanique de jeu bien exploité et un univers très plaisant à parcourir font de Epistory: Typing Chronicles un bon jeu. Je vous recommande si vous voulez vous détendre quelques heures dans un cadre onirique. Il plaira autant aux habitués du clavier qu'a un enfant apprenant à s'en servir.[/b]


[quote]Envie de plus d'évaluations de ce genre ? Suivez la page curateur >> [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28282773/] Sacrez'Art [/url][/quote]

38441329.review:
Fantastic little gem of a game. 

It's a typing game, meaning almost everything you do is done by typing; attacking, opening chests, interacting with the world. It's a really neat concept, and it's very well implemented. The game is easy or hard depending on your speed at typing, and the skills you have prior. I breezed through the game for the most part but I could see some people having a harder time, although the game does have some kind of adaptive difficulty - so maybe it can lower things on its own.

The world is beautifully crafted and the artstyle is great. The story is sweet, only delivered to the player via exploration, narration and still images from time to time. It comes together in the end, even though the atmosphere leading up through the game to the ending is a lot better crafted than the actual ending itself. The music is great and fitting - though it can get a bit repetitive from time to time (I figure most people won't notice anyway).

All in all, this is a really good game. Absolutely a recommendation if anything about it strikes your interest.

38401069.review:
小时候，我在森林里认识了一只小狐狸。小狐狸很可爱，它和我一样有着活泼的性子。我们一起蹦蹦跳跳，在后山的整片树林中，留下了我和小狐狸的脚印。
好景不长，狐狸生病了，它倒在我怀里，用最后一丝力气睁开眼睛看着我，毛茸茸的嘴角轻开轻合，然后永远闭上了眼睛。
逐渐长大的我，在美术上展示出了异于常人的天赋——我也很喜欢美术，因为它可以把记忆中美的地方重新描叙在眼前。
初中，我恋爱了，像书上，在树上亲密地相互拥抱。春风、绿叶，不快的记忆就像是已经掉落的叶子。叶子逐渐被肥美的“爱情”土壤给吸收。
毕业照后，我和朋友用力甩掉头上的帽子。飞舞和呐喊，就是对解放和自由的赞美。
但……为何选择了在此时离开？不，大概不是真的吧？但是刻在石碑上的名字，是你……
大雨磅礴，敲打了即将盛开的花骨。
天空，依旧是那么的灰暗。
告别家人，我来到了新的城市——记得你说过要一起来这里读书的。
大学，一个充满追求的地方。我一如既往，打开画本，开启了新的旅途。
记忆中的那场雨呀，不小心就在我的笔下逐渐成形。最后一笔画完，让我陷入沉思，端着杯子静静地看着眼前的画。
回忆不断增加，苦痛、快乐、迷茫等等，就像茶叶一样沉淀在回忆的底层。人不能说改变了什么，只能说变得比以前更加“丰满”了。
匆忙的生活，让我逐渐迷失了自我，到最后，我只能在黑夜或者梦里去寻找那个真正的自己。
连夜的操劳，和不节制的生活，终于在一天——爆发！病痛面前，人就像是纸糊的一样，没有任何意外，我倒在了黑暗里面。
迷迷糊糊，我醒了，我看见了一只大狐狸，它的眼神让我莫名的有一种亲切感，但我什么都想不起来。
我骑着大狐狸，遇见了天火。我就像原始人一样，用食物去尝试了天火的威力，结果造出了美味的食品。
我骑着大狐狸，见识了洪水。天威面前，人真的是非常脆弱呀，但是我不能就这样选择淹没，所以我骑着大狐狸拼命地逃。
终于，我逃出了洪水范围，也来到一个陌生的地方——眼前是一座座残破的楼房。
也许无意，或是有意，我找到了用电的方法，随后开启了整座城市的电力，一瞬间，被黑暗笼罩的城市，一下变得五彩起来。
在光的指引下，我来到了新的地方，这里有悬空的阁楼、美丽的风车和童话般的场景。真是美丽呀，但是风是自由的，它不应该作为劳力被禁锢起来。
经过千辛万苦，我毁掉了这座美丽的童话城堡，解放了风，并乘着它来到了世界的边缘。
世界的边缘只有不断肆虐的风沙和炽热的太阳。
心中有一种执念，我要离开这里，没错，沉淀在底层种种的回忆松动，逐渐变成了追逐生的祈望。
只要向前一步，就可以回家了！
只要向前一步！
只要向前……
只要……
在漫天黄沙的面前，希望到底在哪？站在高处的我，看着无尽头的沙漠，不禁感到一丝绝望。
一天、一天……我倒在荒漠里了。
不知道过了多久，迷迷糊糊，醒转的我看到了让我回忆宣泄的一幕。
大狐狸倒在我身旁，微微睁开的眼睛看到我醒来，不禁感到雀跃。
“不！”
我低声说着，大颗大颗的眼泪垂下。
大狐狸用毛茸茸的头推了推跪在地上的我，嘴角轻开轻合——够了？前面？
我明白，但是我们要一起走呀！（我）
因为有我，你才不能走出这里。（大狐狸）
为什么？（我）
病痛不能摧残一个人的意志，放开自己，向前看！（大狐狸）
我……（我）
闭上眼睛的狐狸，也许是去了更远的地方，也许是不再想睁开双眼。
我已经想起了以前的记忆，它就是那只小狐狸……没错吧？我抱着它的头静默地想着它也许下一秒就会睁开眼睛。
一起走吧？（我）
我想回去，不只是在这里！看着头上炽热的太阳，我轻轻放下大狐狸，坚定地向着大狐狸推的方向跑去。
我相信你！（我）
回头看了眼大狐狸，我转头，不再迟疑。
眼前逐渐明亮，逐渐刺眼的阳光让我不禁闭上了双眼，再次睁开时，眼前不再是荒漠，而是白白的墙壁和各式各样的医疗设配。
我回来了！
直坐起来的我回想着梦中与大狐狸的相识再到相认，不禁感到有趣。也许结局不是那么的圆满，但是活着就是有希望，不是嘛？
我伸手拿起一旁的纸张，驾轻熟路地折出了一只纸狐狸，放在一旁，想着：那个由纸构建的梦中世界，就叫它纸镜奇缘好了。

38400050.review:
If you went to high school in the times of the current computer age, you have probably attended mandatory IT classes, in which one of the tasks may have been engaging with a program in order to learn how to type faster. Well, these programs provide certain tips how to achieve that but are pretty dull - if they introduced this game instead, the students may actually enjoy improving themselves. 

+ Practicing useful typing skills in a game? HELL YEAH!
+ Extra value added thanks to some cool puzzles
+ Nice artstyle with the world unfolding infront of you
+ Quite interesting story that makes you wonder what is this about and then comes the twist
+ Thanks to being a typing simulator, it has quite some replayability potential (arena ftw) - especially if you want to get all the achievements

- Some of the achivements are just an unnecessary grind (looking at you Insect's bane aka Keyboard's bane) 
- No other real negatives but while playing I came up with some minor QoL changes that could be easily made:
a) when playing arena the music stops after a the first death and never comes back until restart (not when retrying the level from the next screen, not when going from the menu);
b) it feels a bit annoying that after switching or creating profiles you are thrown right into the story mode - it would seem much better to put the player in the menu instead

VERDICT: Worth a try even for those who think typing random words does not seem like a lot of fun since the story, the puzzles and the artsy unfolding of the world will prevent you from getting bored.

38398955.review:
Very nice and polished typing-based game, good difficulty balancement, pleasant graphics and soutrack. You can finish the main story in 5-6 hours, and it takes two more hours to get to 100%. Recommended for some hours of fun and relaxing gameplay.

38383704.review:
[h1][i]"Diede all'uomo la parola,
e la parola generò il pensiero,
che è la misura dell'Universo."[/i]
- Percy Bysshe Shelley, Prometeo Liberato[/h1]

Immaginate di sedervi davanti al computer oppure, perché no, davanti a un blocco di carta. E dovete scrivere una storia. Magari quella storia che avete in testa da tanto tempo ma non riuscite mai a scrivere. Troppe idee, troppi fili ingarbugliati e scrivere anche un semplice incipit non è mai stato così difficile. 

Per certi versi, l'inizio di Epistory è qualcosa di simile.

Siamo una giovane ragazza bionda a cavallo di una volpe a tre code, che si ritrova in un mondo vuoto. E come ogni storia che si rispetti, il mondo si forma man mano che scriviamo, man mano che parole, frasi vengono composte.
Buddha disse: [i]Le parole hanno il potere di creare e di distruggere.[/i] E mai frase fu più vera. Man mano il mondo si spiegherà davanti a noi, come fogli di carta (letteralmente!). Man mano che avanzeremo, faremo crescere alberi digitando parole come ABETE, QUERCIA, ORCHIDEA, ecc., distruggeremo ostacoli come tronchi e massi (TRONCO, ROCCIA, BACHELITE, ecc), bruceremo rovi e accenderemo torce (FIAMMATA, FRIGGERE, SCOTTARE, ecc), e non mancheranno i nemici che andranno uccisi a suon di "parole" (i nemici più potenti avranno parole più complesse). E se non siete dei professionisti da tastiera, non vi preoccupate, il gioco calibra la difficoltà in base alla vostra bravura in modo del tutto automatico anche durante i combattimenti.

Si tratta, come avrete intuito, di un typing game, ovvero giochi che consistono appunto nel digitare le varie parole che appariranno su schermo per poter proseguire con la storia. Il gioco ha una sua componente RPG, man mano che digiteremo parole, innescando sempre più combo, guadagneremo punti esperienza che si trasformeranno in livelli. Con i punti abilità possiamo potenziare le varie caratteristiche della nostra volpe (come renderla più veloce), delle nostre magie, o ancora abilità che ci torneranno utili nell'esplorazione (come quella che ci mostra i forzieri sulla mappa). Non mancheranno gli extra come i cosidetti "frammenti", i quali una volta completati ci mostrano immagini della vita della scrittrice (ogni dungeon ha la sua immagine da comporre).

Tutto il mondo di Epistory e i dungeon non sono altro che fogli di carta, piegati e colorati, come fossero degli origami. È uno stile grafico molto semplice, color pastello e allo stesso tempo apprezzabilissimo. Ad accompagnarci nel viaggio ci sono anche delle buone musiche. 

Purtroppo ci sono un paio di difetti da rimarcare, in primis il sistema di controllo. Il gioco propone come tasti direzionali E-F-I-J (questo per poter avere entrambe le mani sulla tastiera e pronte a digitare le parole), ma nulla ci vieterà di usare il ben più famoso WASD o le frecce direzionali che reputo decisamente più comodi. Purtroppo anche usando quello più affine a noi, più volte la volpe non si muoveva nella direzione voluta da me, vi è quindi qualche difficoltà nel farla girare, cosa che diventa piuttosto frustrante in alcune parti del gioco dove bisognerà scivolare sul ghiaccio. 
Altra critica è che il gioco è breve, purtroppo in 5 ore, con molta calma e raccogliendo tutti i frammenti ho finito il gioco.E una volta finito c'è poco da fare, se non la modalità Arena che è una semplice versione delle ondate delle sfide finali dei dungeon.

Concludendo, Epistory è un titolo che tutto sommato merita. Piacevole, breve, atipico e coinvolgente. Ma la cosa più bella di questo gioco, è che è stato tradotto nella lingua italiana. Il che è non è una cosa da poco. Forse 15 Euro possono essere troppi considerata la sua durata, ma se lo trovate in saldo o in un bundle, beh, vi suggerisco di prenderlo. Una piccola perla indie.

Voto: 7+

38342477.review:
The art, narrative, and atmosphere in Epistory are absolutely amazing; Epistory is easily one of the most memorable games in these aspects that I've experienced from any genre, and I've played a lot of games over the years. The music and sound effects flowed well to keep the intended atmosphere intact.

The difficulty scaling of the typing was excellent. Most typing games are a bit too easy for me; I loved that I could play and still have some challenge, while a friend (with a slower typing speed) played through the game and was challenged as well, but not with a difficulty level so high to make it unmanagable.

The actual gameplay mechanics mixing typing with RPG elements was a wonderful mix, and kept things interesting and added a level of strategy I very much appreciated.

The quantity of content could be a bit higher, but I admit I say that because I would have loved to have been able to keep playing: I thoroughly enjoyed playing through Epistory. The story did progress and end in a logical and timely fashion.

The only thing that I might consider a negative was the puzzle difficulty. I love puzzles in games, and would normally prefer puzzles require a bit more logical breakdown (I'm a big fan of puzzles -The Talos Principle was amazing!). Epistory is, however, a typing game, and I'm torn on the subject because I think that increasing puzzle focus and difficulty could easily have the effect of breaking the immersion and the typing focus. (Not something I would remotely desire!)

中国，是以华夏文明为源泉、中华文化为基础，并以汉族为主体民族的多民族国家，通用汉语、汉字，汉族与少数民族被统称为“中华民族”，又自称为炎黄子孙、龙的传人。
中国是世界四大文明古国之一，有着悠久的历史，距今约5000年前，以中原地区为中心开始出现聚落组织进而形成国家，后历经多次民族交融和朝代更迭，直至形成多民族国家的大一统局面。20世纪初辛亥革命后，君主政体退出历史舞台，共和政体建立。1949年中华人民共和国成立后，在中国大陆建立了人民代表大会制度的政体。
中国疆域辽阔、民族众多，先秦时期的华夏族在中原地区繁衍生息，到了汉代通过文化交融使汉族正式成型，奠定了中国主体民族的基础。后又通过与周边民族的交融，逐步形成统一多民族国家的局面，而人口也不断攀升，宋代中国人口突破一亿，清朝时期人口突破四亿，到2005年中国人口已突破十三亿。
中国文化渊远流长、博大精深、绚烂多彩，是东亚文化圈的文化宗主国，在世界文化体系内占有重要地位，由于各地的地理位置、自然条件的差异，人文、经济方面也各有特点。传统文化艺术形式有诗词、戏曲、书法、国画等，而春节、元宵、清明、端午、中秋、重阳等则是中国重要的传统节日。

38222618.review:
All I can say is WOW! This is the first "typing" game that I have ever played. Didn't know what to expect, and was blown away. The presentation of this game is outstanding. The story is told with a book motif from words (100% voice over) being typed directly on the world to new areas being opened up on pages of a book and poping up like the pop-up books. The art style is a paper origami style. The presentation of the game is top shelf.

For the game, you play as a girl riding a fox trying to understand the world around her. The entire game is played with the keyboard, of course. As you explore, you may find items in your path. Press the space bar - if words appear above the obstacle type the word to destroy it. Combat is handled in the same way. Monsters will hone in on your character. Some will move faster. Some will have simple words. Others longer words. Most will have banks of words and all words will need to be typed before the monster is destroyed. Each successfully typed word will award you with experience points and a timer. Chain together successes to rake in the experience points.

As you progress you will gain access to four types of magic: fire, ice, electricity, and wind. Each one of these does something different. Fire magic will burn the next word in the bug's word bank. Ice magic freezes enemies. Using the spark magic will zap words from adjacent bugs' word bank. And wind magic will blow monsters back.

If you are not much of a typist there is what is called adaptive learning. The game will change the difficulty based on several factors. From what I read, there is a scale from -80 to 100 that is given as you play. Typing words without error will increase the score. Dying will decrease the score. The entire score is then multiplied by your WPM value to give an overall difficulty. In this manner, if you are not a fast touch typist, you can still enjoy the game.

Epistory isn’t without a few issues. Right out of the box, the movement controls are awkward. You can use the E and F keys on your left hand and the J and I keys on your right hand. But, for me this was not intuitive. You can also use W, A, S, and D for movement. However, then your hand is out of place when you want to type. There is a mod you can download that allows you to use the E, S, D, F keys in place of the W, A, S, D keys for movement. This is a great solution and one that should have been thought of by the developers. Second, this is a typing game. When there are a lot of insects on the screen sometimes all the words get jumbled up and it can be difficult to determine which are the most critical words to type. One touch by a monster and you are dead. Thankfully, deaths don’t cost much. The last item is more of a nitpick, but I am not sure how the words per minute are calculated on the stats page. I have gotten over 40 WPM but not much more. I also found a couple of words are not possible to type if you have certain magic enables. One I remember is FIZZ. Since typing FIRE changes to fire magic, if you type F-I the game registers this as the FI for FIRE and won’t let you complete FIZZ. So, you can only type FIZZ if you have fire magic enabled. Not something you are thinking about in the middle of a battle.

The issues are definitely not a show stopper. More of an annoyance I hope the developer addresses in any future games of this type they may create. This is an extremely well developed game. The story is interesting with 100% voice over. But it is the presentation that steals the show. The graphics are amazing and the presentation and world-building are phenomenal. I didn’t know what to expect with a typing game, but Epistory is an excellent game.

-Great puzzles, especially in the City level
-The arena fights never feel repetitive
-Typing isn't just how you fight- it's also how you navigate the menu, solve puzzles, and open treasure chests

Cons:
-The story mode feels a bit padded- cutting a few levels would improve the game
-You have to get through a lot of gameplay to get to the Desert Dream sequence- that kind of storytelling should have been happening much earlier
-The controls are really tricky, which is particularly frustrating when you need to move quickly during a puzzle

38174933.review:
This game intrigued me with its typing elements, but what surprised me the most was how much fun I actually had playing this game. I loved unveiling the world through exploration.

The combat is surprisingly intense. Sure, typing is easy enough, but the game adds different elements to combat – quite literally! There are fire, water, lightning (spark), and wind elements. If a word has those elements, you have to type the respective magic and defeat the words that way. 

I’d like to say I’m fairly decent and accurate at typing, yet some of the battles were really challenging to overcome. The enemies/words get tougher the farther into a fight you go (honestly, the dev must love the word pupivorous and antiestablishmentarianism  because I got those ones a lot). There are ways you can get around harder words, such as using a lightning element word on an easier word to chain a lightning attack to harder words. It’s interesting what kind of combinations you can do in battle! 

The artwork is absolutely beautiful and I loved the landscape. The music was also very beautiful. My one complaint is that after a music track was done, it was complete silence until you triggered another area/scene with music. I would have loved either a loop in music or more background music while I played! 

The game is also sadly not very long. I found myself wanting more and was surprised I completed the entire game in one day (I completed the entire story in 6.3 hours).

Overall, this game surprised me in how much I came to love it. Definitely try out the demo!

38145615.review:
Didn't I already type enough in this game? Do I really need to type more for a review? >_<

So Epistory is quite an interesting game. I think the last time I played games about typing was when I was a kid and they were very basic educational games. But this game drew my attention anyway.

Epistory adds in some mechanics to make the adventure more interesting even if the gameplay mechanic might not seem exciting. There's an interesting narration going along as you explore the world, giving you some information about the character, and it is painting an image of the areas you go into. Note that the ending of the game seemed pretty obvious early on, at least for me, and wasn't exactly surprising. Funnily enough, though, if you [spoiler]read the descriptions of the Steam trading cards for the game after you complete it, they paint an interesting relation between the areas you explored and the ending of the story.[/spoiler]

You get to walk around and slowly explore as the world opens up in an origami art style, unfolding from paper tiles. There is a main hub world and a handful of dungeon-like areas you enter throughout the game. When you explore, you encounter obstacles in your path and enemies that will fight you. In order to destroy obstacles or enemies, you must enter the "Typing Mode" and literally type the words above the obstacle or enemy.

At first, that starts out pretty simply. But as you go through the dungeons, you start to earn elements that you can use, like Fire or Ice. Then, the game starts giving you enemies that can only be destroyed by a particular element, so you have to switch modes during combat quickly. Even further, you might encounter battles where using a particular element is better than the rest, because they each have a special power. For instance, Ice can temporarily stop enemies from moving, and might be useful in earlier fights where many enemies spawn. In that situation, you might be able to write the first word per enemy, rotating in a circle around the screen. That would slow each enemy one by one, and you could keep repeating that rotation to slow them again and continue damaging them. Sometimes, that might not work and you might need to use Fire or another element, depending upon enemy speed, the size of words, the quantity of enemies, and so on.

Besides the above gameplay, the dungeons and some parts of the hub world contain puzzles, but most of them are not extremely difficult. The majority of them simply involve moving to specific items really quickly, or following paths in a specific way in order to toggle multiple switches altogether.

The last comment I have is on the difficulty of the game. I feel like it's actually awkward to review, considering the difficulty will vary per user's typing skills in ways. Note that the game has an "Adaptive Mode" where the game will learn based on your performance whether to increase or decrease difficulty. I used this mode for the entirety of the game because I am a pretty good typist, and the game definitely increased difficulty over time. Even so, I was usually alright in most places and only lost fights if I had to use a particular element that I wasn't noticing would be beneficial.

However, there is also a way to disable the "Adaptive Mode" and choose basic difficulties of Easy, etc. I am not sure how these work as you progress throughout the game, so other players might be more helpful. Or there is even a demo for the game, for you to try it out if you want.

Needless to say, I enjoyed the game more than I expected, because the art, music, narration, and even the usage of the elements for combat formed something of a unique output for Epistory, which is unlike other typing-based games that I have seen in the past.

38131672.review:
O MELHOR JOGO DE DIGITAÇÃO QUE JÁ JOGUEI!!!!!

Epistory - Typing Chronicles é um jogo de adventure mundo aberto educativo de digitação. Você controla uma raposa que possui 4 tipos de ataque, adiquiridos no decorrer do jogo: fogo, gelo, eletricidade e ventania. O comando de ataque da raposa é apenas as palavras que aparecem acima do inimigo, que devem ser digitadas. Para trocar o tipo de ataque, basta digitar o nome do tipo de ataque. Exemplo: para ataques de fogo, digite "fogo". Para ataques de gelo, digite "gelo"....e por aí vai.

O jogo em si é fantástico, bastante viciante, lembrando em diversos momentos a franquia Zelda. Os gráficos do jogo são muito bons. Toda a arte do jogo foi construída imitando origamis, desde os personagens até inclusive o cenário, que vai sendo liberado aos poucos, e vai sendo gerado como se estivessem feitos novos origamis a partir de novas folhas de papel. Essa arte condiz totalmente com a proposta do jogo, tanto pelo fato de ser um jogo educativo quanto pelo final do jogo, sem dar spoilers.

Mas melhor do que ser um excelente jogo, é o fato dele ser um jogo de digitação. Ao mesmo tempo em que você se diverte, você treina suas habilidades no teclado, sendo assim um jogo obrigatório para aqueles que desejam aperfeiçoar sua digitação ou para aqueles que precisam de uma boa velocidade na vida profissional. Há diversos outros jogos de digitação no mercado. Sempre existiram. Mas não me lembro de ter visto um jogo tão excelente e que chega a ser comparável a muitos jogos de qualidade por aí, considerando também os que não são de digitação.

Altamente recomendado: 10/10

话说我平时上班就要经常打字发邮件，下班之后玩个游戏依旧要打字0.0

《纸境奇缘：文字大冒险（Epistory-Typing Chronicles）》是一款打字游戏，让我回忆起起了很久以前玩的《死亡打字员》还有金山旗下的软件“警察抓小偷”（记得小学时候上计算机课，和同学玩局域网联机玩的不亦乐乎）。
作品算上EA阶段登陆Steam已经有两年，起初并没有在中国玩家中引起太大反响。但这款游戏在今年6月5日加入了中文支持。这次中文支持将输入英文单词改成了输入拼音，正是这个小小的修改让国内玩家的游戏体验一下子上升了一个档次。
之前国内玩家在游戏时，可能会在读取并理解英文信息与输入文本中产生一些停顿，这种迟滞感在快速而高密度的打字中十分影响情绪，而看中文打拼音就不一样了，用打字击杀敌人的快感瞬间变得酣畅淋漓。
作为独立游戏来说，开发团队的技术与资金都有限，画面上并没有太下功夫，但他们特意把游戏中的低多边形风格说成是“折纸风”，很巧妙的把画面不足的硬伤规避。
好评主要感谢开发团队对中文本地化的支持。

很不错的一款游戏，花了九个小时通关，
画面是剪纸风格，地图会随着主角的探索逐渐扩大，
无论是森林，地下，天空，神庙······的风景都很美丽，很喜欢。

游戏的中文汉化非常友好，魔法和名词有对应关系，很好理解和连通。
不过偶尔字库也会发生错误，这里建议大家返回主菜单后继续或者退出游戏重新进入就好。
怪物的体积和词语量是成正比的，虽然小怪物的词语很短，但它们有着更快的移动速度，
顺带一提游戏里怪物种类确实太少了一些。

全程就是跑图和打字，剧情很简单，旁白全程有字体在地面显示，
一边打怪还能一边看看地上的旁白，这一点很好评。

到了后期一个巢穴下来手会有点酸，好在并没有连续的巢穴需要清理。

虽然打字很累很枯燥，但是真的一直在坚持玩，一直还想要继续玩，
看着自己一点一点，一步一步地把森林净化，把矿坑点亮，让冰雪中的山脉不再孤独 ······
才发觉自己早已经不知不觉融入到了游戏环境里。
游戏的结尾在剧情上来说有些突兀，但主旨上反倒是挺符合游戏的主题的。

匆匆写到了结尾，心里依旧有些不舍，
有些东西留不住，但值得我们去守护，
有些东西看不见，却陪伴在我们身边，
主角也好，那只狐狸也好，
森林也好，风暴也好，海浪也好，
都是那么的美丽，那么的孤独。

一款好的游戏和一本好书无异，看了风景，学了知识，有了感悟，
我推荐这款游戏。

（凌晨5点多了，手残就别买了，洗洗睡吧。）

38099632.review:
In short Epistory is a novel take on the age-old genre of typing games, here combined with RPG elements and exploration. It does come with several flaws and limitations, but the core gameplay is rather solid. If you are proficient in touch typing and enjoy it, you might want to take a look at this game. While I do recommend it, I don't think it is worth full price.

In long the game certainly has [b]style[/b] and consistency. I mostly liked the visuals and even on the lowest settings the game looked decent. Early on you will encounter a flood cutscene where to me the papercraft aesthetic really came together. Also, from the very first moment you are greeted by beautiful lush ambient soundscapes. Unfortunately their volume is tied to the game sounds, which means if you want combat feedback you'll have to suffer through oppressively loud winds howling, water rushing, circadas chirping, etc. A little better mixing or separate controls would have gone a long way.

The experience is also somewhat tarnished by the unusual [b]controls[/b]. It's a typing game, so obviously you want to keep your fingers on home row. But since this is not an auto-scroller (like Typing of the Dead) inbetween you still have to navigate your character. They came up with a novel control scheme using both hands and RFJI. It took me hours to get used to and while it does work, it never felt intuitive. To their credit, I don't know of a better solution. And during exploration it's not a big deal, but the problem is compounded by the inclusion of tightly-timed movement puzzles (checkpoint races). At one point I switched over to WASD because I just couldn't handle it and was so frustrated. There are also issues where the geometry looks like you could pass, but the character still gets hung up on something.

Thankfully the core [b]combat[/b] gamplay is pretty solid in comparison. Monsters approach you and you have to ward them off by typing the words above their heads. This turned out to be surprisingly fun and with some of the optional fights also pretty damn challenging. I really liked the range from calm open-world exploration to a panicked flurry of typing during epic fights. There is supposed to be "adaptive difficulty" but whenever I had to retry fights, they were equally difficult. I thoroughly enjoyed the combo system, encouraging stringing together kills for more XP. The upgrade system was good, with the caveat that I maxed out my level before unlocking the final abilities, so the game kept prompting me to upgrade while none were available. The first three were great, but the last elemental ability was also a bit of a let down as you already had knockback and it was just more of it. Speaking of knockback, this is related to the only truly frustrating aspect of combat: The text only appears once the monsters are well into the screen (presumably so it fits centered above them). But if you then hit the monsters with knockback, you can still see them, but the words disappear and are not accepted by the game anymore. I can see the monster, I know the word, my focus is there right now - why the hell doesn't the game allow me to kill them? This kept happening every once in a while and was very frustrating to deal with, tripping up my flow.

There is a rambling narrator commenting on everything (Bastion-style) which is fine. There is a very thin over-arching meta [b]story[/b], but it's pretty weak and ended about as clichéd as one could possibly imagine. I would have liked it more if the story was confined to the world and had some goal or purpose within, because right now the in-game story of the girl riding a fox doesn't go anywhere.

I took my time and explored everything. In about 8 hours I had thoroughly exhausted the main game. It was a good experience and I can see [b]replayability[/b], since all the words are chosen randomly from a dictionary anyway. The endless arena mode feels aimless and boring to me and honestly, after 8 hours across 3 sittings I had enough of typing random words for now.

I've never had [b]technical[/b] problems with the game and it ran well on my terrible system. It does offer tons of different languages and keyboard layouts, which is great for a typing game. It took me a while to clue into how it works, but you can navigate all the menus by simply typing the words, which struck me as very cool and nifty to make sure you never have to lift your fingers from the keyboard.

The concept of the game is neat and the implementation is mostly competent. There are some brilliant ideas and design choices here and there, but also some striking flaws in other places. I'm glad this game exists and it provided an enjoyable short experience entirely different from most games on the market. Still, it feels like a brushed-up novelty one-trick-pony and personally I wouldn't pay full price for it. Whether it is improved puzzles or a captivating story - it needs some other quality besides typing combat to justify the price in my opinion. If you like typing and are already somewhat proficient, do pick it up on sale though.

I saw this game on sale yesterday afternoon, and after a 13 hour binge, I decided I loved it and completed it and most of its achievements. It's the first time I feel compelled to 100% a game.

Pros:
- Fox! :epilove:
- Absolutely beautiful artwork, music, and fantastic narration
- The puzzles are surprisingly and pleasantly intricate.
- The game doesn't shuttle you from point A to B to C for the story's sake. Explore!
- Includes a nice arena mode for you to keep practicing.

Cons:
- My forearms and fingers are still sore! :episweat:
- I wish there were more to devour. I would love to see a larger open world beyond the main story.
- Some of the achievements can be a little wonky.

I don't know if I could justify the regular price based on the length of gameplay in Epistory, but then again, most people would split up the length of gameplay. But, if you get a chance to pick it up on sale, absolutely give it a try!
