38095320.review:
[h1]Epistory - Typing Chronicles：冥想的艺术[/h1]

无意中浏览首页的时候发现了这一款打折游戏，它的trailer确确实实地吸引到了我，因此就毫不犹豫地买下来了。最后玩下来也没有令我失望，甚至有一种捡到宝的感觉。

玩家操控的是一位骑在狐狸上的小女孩，从一片岛屿开始四处探索，并用学会的技能与敌人 [strike]单词[/strike] 战斗。通过一场场战斗，女孩最后探求着自我，终于从梦境中醒来......

[spoiler]其实就是一个女性作家冥想写作的故事[/spoiler]

虽然游戏的碎片化叙事让人感觉有些难懂 [strike]根本就不是故事[/strike]，但是它的画面展现和玩法的新意完全让人忽视了这些缺点。折纸的画面表现令人惊喜。这种平面化的手法在近年来的一些游戏中频繁地出现过，可是在epistory中的出现却不令人厌烦，本身对于梦境的表现形式就是多种多样的，可以是反欧几里得空间、或者是平面二维空间、甚至是扭曲破碎的高维空间等等 [spoiler]停一下这不是物理[/spoiler]，更主要的是，打字游戏的设定也让人不感到无聊。破坏路障、开路、场景互动也要打字，击杀敌人需要打字，甚至是切换技能都要打字。这些都让玩家与游戏的互动更加深层次，游戏的解谜与收集方面还是稍微有些弱，战斗的难度倒是相当大。后期动辄会出现十几个字母长度的单词，不合理地利用技能 [strike]bug[/strike] 只有死路一条。

总体来说，游戏虽然还存在着一些问题，但依然是一款游戏性较强、画面精致的娱乐游戏。推荐在打折下入手。

[h1]游戏评价[/h1]

综合评价：7.7/10
[list]
    [*]游戏画面（9/10，20%）：折纸的表现非常完美，画面本身也非常精美，场景变化很大，不同地域的色彩对比很鲜明，游玩过程中不会让玩家感到无聊。但是还是存在着一些令人尴尬的问题，比如穿模、无法加载部分障碍物等。[spoiler]比如本来以为浮在水上的蜥蜴，展开地图之后才发现原来是在沙漠里。[/spoiler]

    [*]游戏音效（7/10，20%）：游戏对不同技能的打击音效展现的很好。背景音乐没有喧宾夺主，但是也没有给人深刻的印象。

    [*]游戏内容（6/10，30%）：游戏对于故事的表达还是很弱的，碎片化的叙事让玩家难以理解。本身游戏还是开放式地图，玩家的探索没有指向性，因此很容易出现玩家先打通了后面的章节的情况。[strike]而且好多英语专业名词真的很难懂[/strike] 同时游戏的流程也很短，如果不是为了全成就，主线的内容只需要4小时左右就可以轻松搞定。 [spoiler]全成就真的不很友好，请你相信我[/spoiler]

    [*]游戏操作及演出（9/10，30%）：打字游戏已经是很古老的了，但是在这里却依然焕发着生机。全部只靠键盘来操作也让 [strike]盲打[/strike] 玩家能更专注在游戏内容而非操作上。
[/list]

个人的一些游玩建议：

1. 请活用你的技能，不然后期清理虫巢绝对是一大噩梦。火（fire）可以加速同一个敌人的第二个单词的燃烧速度，冰（ice）可以冻结住敌人的行动，电（spark）可以概率消除一定范围内其他敌人的一个单词，风（wind）可以击退一定范围的敌人。

2. 技能的升级优先度考虑。建议优先考虑攻击回复点数、攻击击退、攻击技能的升级和地图显示宝箱。跑图技能个人感觉没什么用处，传送技能也很鸡肋。寻路技能虽然没什么用，但是它是按照游戏默认顺序进行指路判断的，也相当于一个游戏进行的方向提示。如果想按着叙述顺序进行游戏的话可以考虑一下这个技能。

3. 开发者提到会根据玩家的反应来进行动态难度的调整，这里就提一下我上面说的bug：清理一个虫巢的时候，一开始切换技能不是很熟练，所以死了几次；最后打的时候，还是反应不过来，看着几个单词巨长的虫子爬过来都快绝望了。结果，虫子爬进了圈里，死亡判定也出现了，我却没死......然后我把虫子都打死了，却也过不了关，于是退出来重进。接下来，我就发现我获得了无敌的buff，再也没有死过（

38094794.review: If you have any doubts about your typing skills.....you won't after you play this game.

38094743.review:
[h1]My Fingers Are Numb![/h1]

I think I played too much [i]Oregon Trail[/i] and [i]Think Quick![/i] when I was in elementary school because I don't remember ever being shown a typing game. EVER! And I wish I had because it would have come in handy!

[i]Epistory[/i] is a visually appealing typing game by Belgium team [i]Fishing Cactus[/i] (I love that name, by the way, and--spoiler--there is one in the game) that tests your typing abilities rather than your strafey-shooty skillz. The landscape unfolds in an origami-ish way, pages and lines of texts making up the landscape as a lost little girl seaches for her memories. Also you kill things by typing.

Imagine my shock when I discovered that this was a genre! Also, that I really suck at it! The game drew me in and I was rivoted, fingers rigid and clawlike over my keyboard for several hours past bedtime, not just so I could finish the story, but to prove to those pesky bugs I know how to type. I do! Dangit! Why do those Belgians think "imperceptibility" is a word I should practice? And why can't I spell "meow" without screwing up? Grr! One more try, I'll clear this nest!

Anyway, I beat it. And loved it. You should too.

38086113.review:
九小时一周目通关
游戏的可玩性还是蛮强的，不同的能力和切换赋予了这款游戏非同寻常的趣味，也增添了Boss战的紧张感
我个人是喜欢跑图探索性质类别的游戏的，这款游戏做的就蛮不错。不同的风光给予了我不一样的感受，，在不同章节的触发的话语中，我们也看到了一个生动的世界向我们展开，最后的结局也是很有意思
谈到这里...想问问那个矿洞的地图是谁做的，给我站出来...打Boss战的时候是真的紧张...打竞技场都没有的一种感受
竞技场也是蛮有意思的设定，四个竞技场大概对应四种能力，现在还是弱鸡一只，只能在榜单里膜拜各种大神
之后有空可能会二周目一次，毕竟我还没找到狂怒的渔夫。如果没有变化的话就直接不接着打了，希望会有一些新的东西233
评价：有张有弛，跑图可以很休闲，Boss战一般很紧张，整个游戏的节奏把握的很棒

吐槽：当然缺点也还是有的，当经验值满格以后，游戏升级的乐趣就被抹杀了，在那个瞬间感觉游戏无聊了很多；以及有些场景偏于单调化（不是指沙漠副本），这里点名批评一个角落的Boss战，地面是焦黑的岩浆，感觉是硬生生植入的一般...和周围的环境并不相适宜
此外，按shift疾跑时经常出现bug让主角往一侧跑，需要按wasd让主角华丽的转个身才能解除...或许换成其他按键会更适合些
最后，切换不同能力时的命令问题，我一开始是选的中文打字，英文字母切换，没有出现问题...今天上线时它给我改了，中文打字，中文切换，结果打字比如很常见的一个词“蜂鸣器”，打了一个feng就切换能力了...感觉这点不是太好

Ohne Zehnfingersystem wohl kaum zu bewältigen, da man für die Bossgegner Wortketten in schneller Folge reintippseln muss, um ihnen den Garaus zu machen. Darum auch die vom Game vorgeschlagenen Bewegungstasten E, F, J, I. Man kann zwar optional auch auf das übliche WASD umschalten, aber dann ist die Ausgangsposition zum Schreiben nicht optimal. Obwohl ungewohnt, ist der Einstieg dann doch leichter als erwartet und Epistory schlägt uns in seinen Bann - hoher Suchtfaktor! 38048016.review:
[h1]Se você tem tendinite, não compre![/h1]
Esse final de semana decidi iniciar minha campanha em Epistory - Typing Chronicles, sem conhecer muito sobre o jogo, pois comprei o jogo em um bundle. Fui apresentado a um jogo belíssimo, feito na Unit. Nele, você é um origami de princesa montado em um origami de raposa, e caminha por um universo totalmente feito de papel, onde o cenário se desdobra nesse mesmo estilo.
O surpreendente, além da arte, é que todo o processo realizado durante o jogo é uma adaptação do curso de L.E.R., então você basicamente digita palavras. Se uma criatura inimiga avança em sua direção, você deve atacá-la antes que se aproxime de você, e para fazer isso você deve digitar as palavras-chave da criatura. O absurdo em tudo isso é que você se adapta muito rapidamente a esse sistema, e se vicia completamente. Terminei o jogo em nove horas dividida em dois dias. Problemas sociais a parte, você consegue completar a campanha com 6 horas, e vai gastar mais metade desse tempo para fazer algumas conquistas possíveis apenas na Arena, um espaço de combate onde você tem de digitar o mais rápido possível as palavras para destruir uma quantidade crescente de inimigos. É um jogo muito divertido, com uma mecânica que eu nunca tinha visto em lugar algum, apenas encontrei semelhante em Scribenauts. 
Se você tem tendinite ou problemas semelhantes de inflamação, evite esse jogo. Primeiro, porque ele vai te viciar e você vai acabar machucando a sua mão querendo continuar a história. Segundo, caso você seja alguém que se importa com conquistas, vai ficar puto porque algumas parecem absurdas demais pra quem tá com a mão doendo (escrever 1% do número de palavras da Saga das Crônicas do Gelo e Fogo é um exemplo).
Se você não tem problemas relacionados ao já citado anteriormente, manda bala. É um jogo fantástico, bonito, e com uma história muito bonita também, que você consegue acompanhar se prestar atenção em alguns detalhes. Que jogão! Parabéns pra quem patrocinou esse jogo no Kickstarter, e também para os criadores.

38045699.review:
Very beautiful adventure typing game with origami visuals in a world built of paper. 

Epistory - Typing Chronicles is probably the best typing game that I have ever played. You can even mistype letters and not get something negative as in other similar games. 

The world is fun to explore with some little puzzles here and there. The further you go, the more challenging it gets. You will need a lot of typing. You will collect some power along the way. Like fire, ice, spark and wind. Some monster will be immune to other types of powers, so you will need to switch back and forth in the middle of the battle. I really liked this.

The game is about ~7-8 hours long for the story (if you like to search everything) and when you are done - you can test your skills in the arena.

38045485.review:
I love typing and purposefully bought some typing games to christen my new mechanical keyboard. 
This game was perfect for doing that. It was an enjoyable experience, although I found myself getting
quite far in the game and maxing my XP meter very early due to high combos. The art style is beautiful
and the story itself is decent. Really fun to incorporate typing in such an RPG-puzzle solving way. There were
some fights that I had to try multiple times but all in all it was really enjoyable. 

I managed to beat the game all the way through in one sitting... let me tell ya, your fingers will be very tired.

I recommend this to anyone who enjoys typing games!

38044778.review:
WOW ... die erste knappe Stunde dieser Perle war mal eine Erfahrung ... ich bin noch immer ein wenig geflasht von der Art des Gameplays. Im Prinzip spielt man ein Action-Adventure aus der Vogelperspektive. Der BESONDERE Spielansatz ist dabei, dass man jegliche Tätigkeit im Spiel durch das Eintippen auf der Tastatur erledigt.

Gegner haben beispielsweise unterschiedliche "Worte" über sich die man dann über die Tastatur eintippt und diese somit besiegt. Ein Busch versperrt den Weg? Kein Problem - wenn man "Feuer" hat kann man mit dessen Hilfe und durch Eingabe des Wortes über dem Busch diesen verbrennen. Das klingt zunächst komisch aber das Spielprinzip ist mega gut umgesetzt und mal ganz vom spielerischen abgesehen ein in meinen Augen pädagogisch extrem wertvolles Spiel in Bezug auf das Erlernen einer besseren Rechtschreibung oder auch 10-Finger-Schreiben bzw. "blindes Schreiben".

Die gesamte Grafik des Spiels ist im Origami-Stil gehalten - wunderschön anzusehen und die musikalische Untermalung tut ihr Übriges - wirklich ein umwerfend schönes Gesamtbild.

Im Prinzip möchte ich dieses Spiel hier JEDEM wärmstens ans Herz legen. Meiner Meinung nach könnte man dieses Spiel sogar in der Schule als Unterrichtsmaterial einfügen wenn man Kindern besseren Umgang mit der Tastatur beibringen möchte. Absolute Empfehlung!!


Pro:
- zauberhafte Origami-Grafik
- toller Soundtrack
- sehr angenehme englische Sprecherin
- tolle Story, welche man wirklich erst über das ganze Spiel hin komplett versteht
- deutscher Bildschirmtext
- Texteingabe auf diverse Tastaturlayouts änderbar (auch die in Deutschland übliche QWERTZ-Eingabe)
- sehr viel Raum für Erkundung
- einzigartiges Kampfsystem
- von der ersten Minute an nimmt das Spiel einen in den Bann
- Skillsystem

Contra:
- könnte für Leute mit "schlechten" Schreibskills an der Tastatur anfangs schwierig sein
(blindes Schreiben oder auch 10-Finger-Schreiben macht den Spielflow sehr viel angenehmer)

38017440.review: [i]Epistory[/i] presents an entertainingly unusual take on an adventure game, being based wholly around keyboard controls and typing as a combat mechanic. Players control a fox, traveling through a diverse range of environments, stylised with storybook-like graphics, which expand as you progress though the game and its light but entertaining story. Combat here is achieved through typing words that appear above enemies that you encounter, complemented by (again keyboard-controlled) spells, which serves to create some impressively-frantic and chalenging encounters, scaled to match your skills as a typist - perhaps even with the incidental benefit of improving your typing skills!

37998005.review:
I didn't seek this game out directly, it came bundled with something else I was interested in. I'm glad I decided to play it on a whim. Had I not, I probably would have (mistakenly) written it off as some kind of Mavis Beacon "learn to type" thing from the name. 

It's actually a quite lovely little game. The art style, music, and method of storytelling all create a lot of atmosphere. It's not designed for learning to type, but typing is one of the core game mechanics. And unlike some other typing-based games I've played before, it feels like an interesting challenge as you get deeper into the game rather than just an exercise in increasing frustration.

37992634.review:
一款非常棒的打字冒险游戏！
画面和音乐唯美而清新，所有的人物 怪物 物体和场景都纸做成的，非常符合游戏的名字《纸境奇缘》。
自带简体中文汉化，汉化后所有需要打字的都是汉字词汇，不用担心因为不熟悉英文单词而影响打字速度。

37946087.review:
这款游戏真的是不可多得的好游戏。
最开始吸引我的是非常美的画风，以及可以说是对小时候玩的打字游戏的怀旧。而且既然有不错的汉化，就买来一玩。
直到玩了一两章之后，我才发现，这个翻译已经不能仅仅用不错来形容了，不仅剧情方面的翻译信达雅，甚至连机关上的单词都有过考究。比如一对门将的单词，全部都是颠倒过来词义相同的词（兄弟 弟兄，讲演 演讲 等）。
难度方面也根本不像是一开始以为的会很简单。有的boss战可以说是非常考验反应力和盲打能力了。
最让我意外的是剧情。我以为这个游戏不会有什么非常牛逼的剧情，直到我通关了，看到了结局，再回想起我一路经历过的所有东西，可以说是非常动容了。这个游戏的剧情，过程中透露着十足的冷酷，但是结局，却格外的温柔。
以上这些因素加起来，我想我会不遗余力的跟每一个我遇见的爱玩游戏的人推荐这款游戏，我相信他们不会失望。

然后再说一些问题。
这个游戏的bug稍多，我不知道是不是中文版的缘故。比如在一场boss战里出现了怪物头上显示“NO_WORD"字样，无法攻击，死亡重新来过也无效，只能重启游戏。
还有就是中文多音字问题，有些多音字的拼音是有错误的，会导致如果只看着汉字打，就会打错。
以及在第四章风元素那一关有一个【恩】字，标音只有一个字母N，但无论按什么键都不会触发这个，我最后换成英文才过去的。
还经历过boss战极限杀掉一只怪，结果怪尸体没消失我也没死，整个关卡卡住只能重来的情况。
除却bug之外，我觉得还有一个问题就是四个魔法的强度上不太平衡。到了后期基本上我是靠spark打天下的，其他的魔法强度都不足以再混战中使用，或者说spark太好用了，压缩了其他魔法的空间。

不过总的来说瑕不掩瑜，我真的非常非常非常喜欢这款游戏。

37907018.review:
[i]Story, RPG, typing game where you follow a girl on a fox.
It was my first experience with this type of game but I was really great surprised.[/i]

[h1]Overview[/h1]
This game is challenging typing game in some sort of way for example: you need to switch between your powers - "multitasking" - fast and correct writing is important because if you failed you will die.
You can also play this game in many languages: English, French, German, Spanish, Polish, Portuguese-Brazil, Russian, Czech, Japanes and Simplified Chinese. That's another plus right there.
Also soundtrack is amazing. For a visual site I can't say anything bad because this game is wonderful. Great puzzles.

[h1]Upgrading system[/h1]
By killing monsters and destroing nearby momuments etc. you get points to upgrade your girl.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
You can get all of the achievements by playing this game - 7 hours total +- (some achievements are like: type a certain amount of words and kill certain amounts of enemies which is not bad).

[h1]Overall[/h1]
This game is isn't for a "slow people" or for people who still have to look down at their keyboard to type each word. If you enjoy typing Epistory - Typing Chronicles is game for you. Go for it!

37901374.review:
[h1][b]Epistory – Desenvolver L.E.R. nunca foi tão prazeroso[/b][/h1]

	Aqueles que nasceram no século passado certamente lembram dos incontáveis cursos de datilografia e o angustiante tédio que eles proporcionavam. Foi apenas após anos de evolução e incansáveis estudos (ok, talvez nem tanto) que, pelas mãos do estúdio francês Fishing Cactus, o mundo foi prestigiado com Epistory – Um espetacular jogo capaz de melhorar a habilidade datilógrafa de qualquer um.
	Sim, a ideia de um jogo com finalidade educativa, formalmente conhecido como “Serious Games”, não é algo inédito, e mesmo jogos de escrever não são novos, há até mesmo um nome para o gênero: Typing Games. Porém, Epistory destaca-se imediatamente dos demais. Logo de início o gráfico em low-poly enaltece um charme indiscutível, o qual é complementado por uma ambientação brilhante que gira ao redor de uma única ideia: Todo o seu universo é construído em papel. Explorando o mapa, você encontrará árvores feitas de páginas de livros, perceberá que é um amontoado de folhas que suspende o seu mundo, e mesmo a raposa de três caudas, inseparável parceira de nossa protagonista, relembra um origami. Toda a idealização do game design contribui para que o jogador vivencie um mundo fantástico feito de papel. Mesmo em ações simples como o revelar de uma nova área enfatiza isto, pois os objetos do cenário desdobram-se a partir de páginas de livros. E os inimigos deste jogo? Todas criaturas “insectoides” (porque a maioria dos insetos “come” livros, entende? *sinal necessário com a mão para denotar trocadilho*). Eu poderia citar inúmeros outros exemplos, mas muito da magia de Epistory está na descoberta em si. Há um sentimento único ao observar os detalhes, as metáforas e as analogias que a Fishing Cactus sutilmente deixou para o(a) jogador(a).
	Como se a deslumbrante arte do jogo não fosse o suficiente para distingui-lo dos demais, o modo com que os desenvolvedores abordaram a escrita em Epistory, por mais simples que seja, tornou a experiência da datilografia algo muito mais dinâmica, pois escrever não é apenas o modo com o qual você revelará o mundo – A escrita é sua única e principal arma. Em determinados pontos do mapa, você será confrontado por hordas de criaturas, e o único modo de derrotá-las é escrevendo as palavras que aparecem acima de suas cabeças. Por mais limitado que isto soe, cada batalha traz novas metas que você mesmo tentará superar: Conseguirá digitar mais rápido? Conseguirá não errar nenhuma palavra? Conseguirá escrever “pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis” (sim, há chances desta linda palavra aparecer – duas vezes, no meu caso)? São metas pessoais que podem lhe conceder achievements, mas caso não seja o suficiente, você pode deixar ligada a opção “adaptive difficulty”, forçando cada batalha a tomar o máximo de você. E não estou exagerando – Prezo-me pela velocidade com que escrevo, sou um escritor, afinal. Contudo, após a metade do jogo, tive de desativar a dificuldade adaptativa pois meus tendões estavam atingindo seu limite. Não é necessariamente a quantidade de palavras que a dificuldade muda. Quão mais rápido você digita, mais rápido os inimigos tornam-se, e mais rápido você precisa ser. Modo ou outro, mesmo com a pata avariada, a experiência foi proveitosa, pois pude tomar o tempo para acostumar-me com a grafia em inglês. E ainda que você não saiba outro idioma, não há problema, o jogo conta com total suporte – tanto de dicionário quanto interface e história – em nosso idioma (e outros mais!).
	Porém, Epistory também conta com alguns problemas, um deles é o fato de que a movimentação recomendada não é o clássico WASD, mas EFJI, com a justificativa de que os dedos ficam posicionados de maneira a facilitar a digitação. E realmente facilita, você é capaz até mesmo de se acostumar com este layout “exótico”, mas é fácil esquecer a direção de cada tecla (faça o teste – posicione os indicadores na letra F e J e os dedos médios nas letras E e I). Mas não assuste-se, você pode usar o WASD sem problema algum, e ainda há um MOD na Steam Workshop que transfere a movimentação para o formato ESDF – Que é basicamente o mesmo layout que todo jogador está acostumando, só que uma coluna para a direita. Bem, ao menos este é um problema que é possível remediar, mas ainda se há que me incomodou muito e não há o que fazer sobre isto é a câmera do jogo e seu mapa, pois esta primeira está posicionada na diagonal e o segundo na horizontal. Sendo assim, se você se movimentar para o leste no mapa, estará locomovendo-se, na realidade, para o nordeste. Sem uma interface de mini-map para servir de base, você ver-se-á muitas vezes a abrir o menu para selecionar o mapa e tentar entender que caminho terá de tomar para encontrar seu objetivo, e é algo que gera uma grande frustração durante as poucas horas de playthrough necessárias (em média 5 ~ 8 horas para terminar o jogo, depende do quão rápido você digita). Mas apesar desta gafe, o jogo mostra-se muito consistente com o restante de sua mecânica, e dificilmente haverá grandes barreiras em sua jogabilidade.
	Modo ou outro, tudo isto acaba por ser um mero detalhe quando colocado ao lado dos vários aspectos únicos de Epistory, entre eles uma agradável e embalante trilha sonora, a qual alcança seu auge durante os créditos com a fabulosa música “Desert Dream” da dupla americana Larkin Poe. Sem dúvida, Epistory teria tudo para ser um dos melhores jogos que joguei até hoje se sua história tivesse sido trabalha de maneira diferente. A princípio, pensei que o foco seria a história da garota e sua raposa, mas logo percebi que o rumo era outro, estava eu vendo uma história mais pessoal, uma vida um tanto ordinária. Muito bem contada, muito bem escrita, mas até o final do jogo não desenvolvi muito apego pela protagonista. Há muitos momentos marcantes, analogias bem elaboradas, o uso da mecânica com o contar da história, mas acaba sendo – na maior parte do tempo – apenas uma forma sem muito conteúdo. O momento em que a narrativa finalmente brilha é apenas no final, onde a Fishing Cactus uniu de maneira inteligente a ambientação, a mecânica, e a história em um mesmo elemento, revelando um final que apenas comecei a deduzir apenas próximo da última fase do jogo. De fato, foi inusitado, mas poderia ter sido algo trabalhado desde o início, embalando o jogador em uma narrativa muito mais profunda e envolvente, mas a realidade é que a história descansa em fogo baixo tempo demais.
	Por fim, apesar dos pesares, Epistory é um jogo que certamente ganhou um espaço em meu coração. Não apenas pelas suas características únicas, mas o jogo é a prova viva de que “Serious Games” podem, sim, ser interessantes, basta apenas uma equipe criativa disposta a transformar algo monótono em uma experiência única. Pode não ser o melhor jogo de todos os tempos, mas é o melhor e único curso de datilografia que você precisará.


[h1][b]TL;DR:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Arte: 10/10
[*]Música: 9/10
[*]Jogabilidade: 8/10
[*]História: 6/10
[*]Originalidade: 10/10
[/list]

[h1]Overall: 8.6/10[/h1]

Com um design criativo e inteligente, Epistory vence o desafio de transformar a monotonia do treino da digitação em um entretenimento agradável. Em um universo de papel e palavras, o jogo transpõe uma ambientação marcante ao redor da literatura, reforçando a todo o momento o cenário construído para o propósito do jogo: Ajudar o jogador a digitar melhor. Apesar de uma história rasa, Epistory é uma pérola em seu meio, sendo um dos melhores Serious Games desenvolvidos até hoje, capaz de cumprir seu objetivo com maestria e complementar a experiência com um jogo desafiador mesmo para os mais proficientes datilógrafos.
Alongue seus punhos e prepare seu médico, pois Epistory está prestes a te embarcar em uma aventura sem volta para o fabuloso mundo da L.E.R..


[i]P.S. – Estou falando sério, alongue seus punhos antes de jogar.[/i]

This game was not really what I had originally expected, but flows true to the "typing teacher" type games. I love that there is a world map to explore with gates and boss fights. The main reason I grabbed this game is that I love foxes and you ride on one, so it was kind of funny when I found that it was also very enjoyable. I had a few problems trying to line up some of the words when4-6 were coming at you at a time, but with a few "practice runs" I was able to master some of the fights. 

I really loved the art style as it feels like you are roaming around the storybook, and the Bastion-like narritive is always a welcome addition to this genre (not speaking as a typing tutor, but action-adventure). I really do recommend it and there are a number of user mods you can snag for it. Any age is fine, as long as they know how to use a keyboard.

37845721.review: 在还没出中文的时候买的，虽然感觉不错可却是因为到后期需要打出这么多从没见过的单词难度太大而吃灰了，昨天刚看到老菊的新视频，没想到居然推出了如此高质量的中文翻译，美滋滋美滋滋。独特而又符合大众审美的美术设计，还算优秀的背景音乐，非常文艺范的剧情，最重要的是这种主要操作全是打字的游戏机制设计，这些融合在一起不但没有让人感觉奇怪反而非常般配，不得不说真是让人意想不到，绝对好评啊！

37811534.review: This is an enjoyable typing game combining typing practice and a storyline.  The controls to move around take a little bit of time to get used to being so accustomed to games using WASD but I will admit that the keys are well chosen and help ensure your fingers are in position to be able to type out the words you need to type to either kill the monsters or remove the barriers in your way.  It whiles away the hours pleasantly and is a reasonable way to practice your typing skills, although I am sure my teacher of many years ago would shake her hair in dispair feeling the only tool you can use is a standard type writer.  I am uncertain as to whether it will help me perfect my typing and reduce the need to either delete errors or look down, but at least with an computer it is easier to correct mistakes than on the old fashioned typewriters.  I do find that the fox dies a little quickly but all you  lose is a little progress on the map & it helps focus your mind on the task at hand.

37799518.review:
เกมเน้นไปที่การสำรวจโลกกว้างพอ ๆ กับการเป็นเกมพิมพ์สัมผัส คุณควรพิมพ์สัมผัสได้ก่อนที่จะเล่นเกมนี้ แต่ไม่จำเป็นต้องพิมพ์ได้เร็วอะไร เพราะเกมไม่ได้ยากอะไรครับ

เราจะได้เล่นเป็นสาวน้อยนั่งบนจิ้งจอกออกสำรวจโลกกว้างที่มี theme เป็นกระดาษพับ ซึ่งทำออกมาดูดี สีสันสดใสมากมาย ซึ่งโลกที่เราสำรวจจะค่อย ๆ ถูกสร้าง(พับขึ้นมา) เมื่อเราสำรวจไปเรื่อย ๆ (ประมาณเกม Bastion) ระหว่างการสำรวจเราจะต้องใช้การพิมพ์สู้กับศัตรู โดยจะมีตัวอักษรปรากฏขึ้นมาบนหัวศัตรูให้เราพิมพ์เพื่อกำจัดมัน (เข้า/ออกโหมดต่อสู้โดยการเคาะ spacebar)

ในการสำรวจจะมี puzzle เล็ก ๆ น้อย ๆ ไม่ยากในแต่ละด่าน ให้เราแก้ปริศนาเพื่อผ่านไป ซึ่งเมื่อเราสำรวจดันเจี้ยนต่าง ๆ แล้วเราจะมีพลังเพิ่มขึ้น โดยเกมจะมีพลังไฟ น้ำแข็ง สายฟ้า และลมให้เราใช้ต่อสู้กับศัตรู ซึ่งจะค่อย ๆ unlock มาทีละอย่างเมื่อเราเคลียร์ดันเจี้ยนที่เราสำรวจ ความพิเศษของพลังพวกนี้คือ มันจะเพิ่ม "มิติ" ในการพิมพ์ของคุณให้ลึกขึ้น เพราะพลังแต่ละอย่างจะมี effect พิเศษที่จะบังคับให้คุณต้อง "คิด" เพิ่มขึ้นด้วย

ยกตัวอย่างพลังไฟ เมื่อใช้แล้วเวลาพิมพ์คำเพื่อโจมตีศัตรู คำต่อไปของศัตรูตัวนั้นจะถูกไฟเผาและหายไปเอง โดยที่เราไม่ต้องพิมพ์ แต่ต้องใช้เวลาซักพักนึง ดังนั้นหากคุณใช้พลังไฟต่อสู้ คุณจะต้องเลือกเปลี่ยนศัตรูที่จะโจมตีไปเรื่อย ๆ เพื่อรอเวลาให้ไฟเผาคำต่อไป แต่ในกรณีพลังสายฟ้า ที่จะมี effect เมื่อโจมตีศัตรูแล้วจะมีสายฟ้าเด้งไปทำลายคำบนศัตรูตัวอื่นที่อยู่ใกล้ ๆ หากคุณเลือกใช้พลังนี้ คุณจะต้องทำกลับกันกับพลังไฟ ต้องเน้นฆ่าศัตรูทีละตัวให้ตายไปเลย เพราะถ้าเปลี่ยนเป้าหมาย สายฟ้าที่เด้งไปอาจไปทำลายคำที่คุณเล็งจะพิมพ์พอดี ทำให้คุณพิมพ์ผิดและเสียจังหวะไปเลย

จุดเด่นของเกมนอกจากกราฟฟิคที่ถือว่าเทพมากสำหรับเกมแนวนี้แล้วก็จะเป็นการที่คนทำเกมทำสมดุลออกมาได้ดีมาก ๆ คุณไม่ต้องพิมพ์เร็วอะไรก็เล่นเกมนี้ได้อย่างสนุก ศัตรูที่กรูออกมาก็เยอะดี ซึ่งเกม typing หลาย ๆ เกมนั้นมักจะมีปัญหาเกี่ยวกับสมดุลนี่แหละครับที่บางทีระดับความยากเพิ่มขึ้นไวมาก ๆ จากที่พิมพ์ได้สบาย ๆ ผ่านไป 2 นาทีนี่เงิบแดรกอะไรแบบนั้น ซึ่งในเกมนี้มันก็มีด่านยาก ๆ ให้คนพิมพ์ไวไปเล่นนะครับ แต่เป็น optional ไม่ต้องเล่นก็ได้ (เป็น Nest รังศัตรูในเกม) 

ข้อเสียของเกมมี 2 อย่างหลัก ๆ คือ 
1. ระบบแผนที่ในเกม ที่พอกดดูแล้ว มันจะ fix ตำแหน่งที่แสดงผลโดยมีตัวคุณอยู่ตรงกลาง คุณจะลากดูทั่วทั้ง map ไม่ได้ ซึ่งพอคุณสำรวจโลกจนแผนที่มันใหญ่มาก ๆ แล้ว มันจะหาดูแผนที่ว่ามีตรงไหนที่เรายังไม่ได้สำรวจบ้างได้ลำบากมาก ๆ
2. ระบบการกดปุ่มเพื่อเดินในเกม ที่จะมี key ให้กดสองชุด คือ w a s d ในการเดินแนวตั้งและขวาง และ f e j i ในการเดินแนวทแยง ซึ่ง w a s d ไม่มีปัญหาอะไร คุ้นเคยกันดีอยู่แล้ว แต่ f e j i นี่จะทำให้คุณหงุดหงิดมาก ๆ เวลาไปเจอ puzzle ในดันเจี้ยนที่ต้องการให้คุณเดินในแนวทแยงแบบห้ามกดผิดและต้องไวด้วย เพราะมันเป็นคีย์ที่ไม่คุ้นเคยทำให้กดผิด ๆ ถูก ๆ นั่นเอง

Quite an interesting twist on typing games.  The story is sweet, if a little cliched, but the real star of the show is the combination of beautiful art and surprisingly tactical gameplay.

The learning curve is just about right, with a nice balance of adding systems while still allowing typing to remain the primary skill.

37733903.review: Game is fun and teaches as you go. Typing speed will certainly increase for a beginner, and it;s a fun way to refresh for adults.

37732770.review:
This is a typing game, one that will take you on a beautiful journey with the words you type.

To begin with, the game is a very casual typing game that isn't very difficult. Along your journey through beautiful landscapes you either type away obsticals, or reveal secrets and open locks. You, for the most part, have all the time in the world to do this. The only difficult parts are when trying to keep off enemies with the speed of your fingers, and smart use of your powers.

The words usually correspond to what you are typing about, although enemy words tend to be more random. For example, lighting fires uses words like "burn" and "smolder." Breaking wood uses different types of wood, and growing flowers use different types of flowers.

I suggest this game if you enjoy a casual experience that, should, help your typing skills, as you travel through majestic scenary.

Ich habe mir dieses Spiel gestern gekauft und bin mit dem Aufdecken der Karte relativ weit.

Während meiner Spielzeit ist mir nichts negatives aufgefallen. Außer vllt. dass man sich "die Finger wund tippt" xD

Ich kann das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der sich nicht davor scheut, ziemlich schnell ziemlich viele Wörter zu tippen.

37691901.review:
Epistory is a lovely game, with nice artwork and pop up style story telling. Its an RPG lite, using typing as its core system for exploring, fighting, barrel bashing and puzzle solving. If you take to this mechanic, you're in for a treat, it encourages you to explore each nook and cranny with some sweet abilities literally at your fingertips.

On your journey you will gain elemental powers, which make the bigger battles more challenging as you progress. I never found this punishing, a retry or two with the right element powers aligned will see you through. However, once you gain all elemental powers, the end of the game is not far around the corner, it came rather abruptly in my game and I was hoping for another chapter or two to fully put my powers to the test. But alas, you're greeted with the credits and the option to go back and mop up the collectibles and flesh out any areas of the map you missed, which I may well do.

Epistory is a thumbs up from me and I'd gladly play a sequel if one were to pop up..

Seul regret : l'absence d'un mode qui permettrait à des enfants de s'initier au clavier. Même le mode le plus facile restait trop rapide pour ma fille qui n'a pas du tout l'habitude du clavier, alors que l'aventure l'attirait beaucoup.

37315457.review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles took me completely by surprise. After all, its premise sounds ridiculous. When I heard for the first time that there is an RPG game where you battle monsters and interact with your surroundings solely by typing seemingly random words on a keyboard, I could not help but get a chuckle on the idea. And yet this game proved me wrong - maybe it is due to its masterful execution of such concept, maybe even more because of the fact that the words are not selected that randomly at all; but I will leave all these and many other wonderful discoveries to you. Long story short: the game has an absolutely beautiful art style, its picturesque paper world unfolding around you piece by piece as you discover new access points; its music can be mesmerizing with the narrator's soothing voice never pulling you out of the moment; and last but not least, the game develops with ingenuity what seems initially to be a rather strange and simple core concept. Oh, and it also teaches you to type more proficiently as a byproduct.

TO SUM UP: This game is, in its own peculiar way, a hidden gem. If you want to try something new and learn a useful skill while doing it, try picking up this colourful, lovely-looking, well-written, expertly voice-acted one-of-a-kind experience when it is on sale.

You clear enemies and obstacles by typing prompted words a la Typing of the Dead, although Epistory's system is rather forgiving (you aren't penalized for incorrect keystrokes). Some light puzzling that relies on elemental effects adds a little variety to the game's breezy runtime. As an added bonus, you'll learn the names of more minerals than you'd ever care to know (apologies to any geologists reading this).

37225824.review:
This game was beautiful and played well, but it had some flaws.

What it did right:
-Beautifuly designed areas with amazing art
-An interesting story
-Unrequired dungeons that are more difficult
-Extra trial pads, where you are challenged the most
-Something that sounds like a horrible idea, having the gameplay typing, but is done really well
-Well thought out an excecuted puzzles
-A hefty sum of achievements to earn

What it did wrong:
-The game was way to short. It took me 6 hours to get all the nests cleared, all the puzzle peices and beat the game
-There was a distinct advantage to using just the fire power, rather than any other power. The other ones felt useless in battle unless very very specific circumstances are met, or it is outright required
-The ending (At least to me) was not very satisfying
-The asking price of $15 is a lot for a short game. I would do it from $7-$10; I only got it because of the sale
-It isn't challenging for the most part in normal gameplay on adaptive difficulty, but the optional ones are unrelenting, I wished the difficulty was spread out
-If you get hit just once in a nest, you have to start it over from the begining. This, by itself, is a somewhat decent idea, but there are so many waves in each nest that you have to drudge through 10 waves that take a solid 6 minutes just to get back to the word and maybe beat it. It would work better with checkpoints.

Alltogether, I'd reccomend this game if you can get it on discount. The full asking price is too much for what it is, but on sale it is a great use of your money.

37172746.review:
Co zrobić, żeby przyciągnąc uwagę Tyka do gry? Umieścić w niej lisa? Do tego związać go nieodłącznie z główną postacią i tym samym cieszyć jego oczy aż trzema rudymi kitami? Nie! Znaczy to na pewno sprawi, że wspomniany Tyk może zainteresować się takim tytułem. To jednak nie rudzielec sprawił, że Epistory znalazło się w trzecim GraTyku. Znaczy, wiem, że nie dajecie wiary moim słowom...
W gruncie rzeczy do kupienia gry na jakiejś promocji, gdzie wychodziła naprawdę tanio, skusiły mnie dwie rzeczy i jedną z nich rzeczywiście był kolorowy świat z kanciastym lisem a o drugiej opowiem. (Wiem, że wzdychacie z ulgą, że nie będzie to kolejny pieśń pochwalna dla jakichś futrzaków.)
Epistory jest grą, w której cały świat odkrywa się podczas jego przemierzania, a jest on - przynajmniej w początkach, do których dotarłem - w istocie barwny i na swój sposób urzekający przez ciekawy styl. Do chodzenia wykorzystujemy klawiaturę, a dokładniej nieśmiertelne już wasd. (Was! D. Jakby rzekł zwolennik lewicy, nie mogący znieść myśli, że mógłby skierować się w prawo.SSSS jakby rzekł stereotypowy mieszkaniec Paryża. Wad zgodnie z koncepcją radziecką, czy w końcu esdf, czyli Tyk, który notorycznie położy palce na niewłaściwych klawiszach i dziwi się czemu ciągnie go w prawo.) Rozważania o nazewnictwie mają jeden, dość konkretny cel.Ukryć, że w zasadzie chodzenie jest takie jak w każdej innej grze i nie warto poświęcać mu nawet kilku chwil. W końcu gra miała być taka nietypowa, warta uwagi, a ten ględzi coś o sterowaniu.
Jednak to sterowanie jest tym, co w tej grze jest urzekającego. Poza wspomnianym już chodzeniem wszystko odbywa się przez pisanie. Dosłownie wszystko, gdyż nawet - po przejściu już kilku etapów - odkryłem, że da się za pomocą wpisywania nazwy umiejętności rozdawać do nich punkty zdobywane w czasie gry.
Walka to wpisywania słów, które są tym dłuższe im wyższa jest ranga przeciwnika. Najsłabsi jednak wrogowie wymagają wpisania ledwie jednej litery. Im dalej tym natłok wyrazów do wstukania staje się nieco przytłaczający, lecz tutaj z pomocą przychodzą żywioły, którym dysponuje lisi jeździec. Udało mi się odblokować ogień i lód i wiecie co? Przełączanie się pomiędzy nimi również polega na wpisaniu odpowiednich słów. Ogień sprawia, że niektóre słowa mogą "wpisać się" same przez ich wypalenie, lód natomiast zamraża przeciwników i nie pozwala się im zbliżyć. Bowiem wrogowie nie mogą dojść do lisiego jeźdźca chyba dlatego że wtedy zrzucą dziewczynkę i zaczną bawić się z rudzielcem. Umiera się od najmniejszego kontaktu, a do tego podczas pisania - co oczywiste - nie można się poruszać. Trzeba więc pisać szybko!
Od razu jednak warto zaznaczyć, że słowa ta nie mają nic wspólnego z komendami jak w starych RPG, gdzie żeby postać się przywitała trzeba było napisać Hi. Tutaj słowa są tylko luźno związane z tym co dzieje się na ekranie. Dla przykładu pajęczyny niszczy się słowami, które związane są z robactwem, a ogniska rozpala się tymi, które mają jakiś związek z żarem, ciepłem i płomieniami.
W istocie nietypowo i nowatorsko, choć przyznać trzeba, ze gra nie jest idealna. Optymalizacja wydaje mi się nie do końca idealna. Fabuła przekazywana przez pojawiające się na ziemi napisy nie zawsze jest łatwa do rozczytania, a co ważniejsze nie porywa. Z drugiej strony to nie ona stanowi o pięknie tej, niewielkiej przecież, gry a ciekawa koncepcja, w której skład wchodzi nietypowy pomysł na sterowanie. I choć nie wciąga na dłużej, nie jest tytułem, który potrafi zabrać z życia długie wieczory to jest grą przyjemną, do której miło wrócić by choć trochę popchnąć fabułę do przodu. Choć zdecydowanie nie warta 14 euro, jakie kosztuje na steamie. Za to ma dostępną wersję demonstracyjną, dzięki czemu każdy może sprawdzić jak to jest rozgniatać bezmyślne hordy szarżujące na lisiego jeźdźca za pomocą słów. To prawie jakby było się potężnym magiem wypowiadającym inkantacje kolejnych zaklęć

37126023.review:
紙で表現された欠落した小説の世界を旅する少女と狐の物語、というタイピングRPG。
なんちゃってRPGが多いタイピング界において、アイテムが隠された探索できるフィールド、経験値を貯めてスキルを解放するシステム、さらにダンジョン内にはちょっとした（タイピング無関係な）謎解きがあったりとRPG気分どころかちゃんとRPGしている。
また、ただ単にタイピングが速ければいいというゲームではなく、敵の属性や優先順位など、しっかり考えて戦う必要があるのも好印象だ。
基本的にホームポジションから手を移動することなくプレイできるのでプレイフィールも良好（ただ移動は慣れるまで辛いかも）
失われた世界を少しずつ取り戻していくのがビジュアル的にも楽しく、ただのタイピングゲームに飽きているor興味がない人にも、タイピング慣れしていない人にもおすすめ。

ただ、日本語入力が非常にやっかいで、し→SHI、つ→TSU、っち→TCHIなど、ようするに昔のタイピングゲームで見られた実用性に欠ける入力を求めてくる。
しかも本作は海外のタインピングゲームで、恐らく日本語だけであろう同じ文字の異なる入力に全対応なんていう仕様をわざわざ追加してくれるとは思えない。
また、単語の選定もいまいち「うーん？」ってなるような常用外の語句が多く、一部は間違っていたりもする。
というわけで、ここはあえて英語でプレイするのをおすすめしたい。
タイピング慣れしていないと難易度が激上がりするだろうが変な癖をつけるよりはマシだろうし、最低限日本語入力には慣れてるなら英語入力の練習になる。
タイピングは英語でストーリーとメニューは日本語ということも可能だし、慣れない言語だとキーボードの配置を否応なく指で覚えられるので強制ギプス的な役割も果たすだろう。
ちなみにMODに対応しており、めちゃくちゃ簡単な入力（AAAA…連打とか）を選べたりもするので、まあどうしても無理だったらそれでもいいんじゃないかな。全く面白くないから勧めはしないけど。

游戏难度并不低，单词专业生僻而且贼长，面对不同颜色的单词还要切换不同风火水雷的属性来攻击，可以说是非常考验手速了，怪一多就蒙圈，让我在冰与火的世界里只剩下徘徊。不同属性的攻击具有不同的附加伤害，还要考虑一定的战术，强烈建议在校中小学生计算机课的金山打字通更新一下，培养“keyboard man”从娃娃抓起。
从这个游戏又学会了好多单词和词根词缀，让我发现我打英文的错误率是多么的高，为了拿连续1000字母不出错的成就真是*都要累出来了。

37059459.review:
Quizá el final a uno se le llega a pasar por la cabeza al ir desbloqueando las fotografías pero mientras juegas te absorbe tanto que se hace todo un reto. Lo jugué en inglés y el juego es tipográfico, consiste en: matar a los monstruos escribiendo la palabra que aparece en su cabeza. Además, vas consiguiendo diferentes tipos de poderes con diferentes habilidades cada uno de ellos. 
[list]
[*]Visualmente es precioso.
[*]Es un juego libre, vas a tu rollo, aunque las zonas están bloqueadas según los poderes que hayas adquirido. 
[*]El mapa se va desbloqueando a medida que lo vas descubriendo.

[*]La banda sonora es preciosa y muy relajante, al igual que la voz de la protagonista.
[*]La historia se va desvelando al avanzar por el juego, literalmente en el suelo se escribe la historia.
[/list]

36955027.review:
Мене завжди приваблювали ігри з можливістю друку. 
Ще починаючи із тренувальних ігор типу BabyType, завдяки якому і почав друкувати швидше.

Epistory стала невеличким відкриттям для мене.

Її оригінальність важко переоцінити: спочатку навіть не вірилося, що ігролад пригодницької гри настільки тісно можна переплести із друком слів. Це не Type of the Dead, де потрібно просто дивитися на екран і встигати набирати випадкові слова, що з’являються на зомбі, кажанах і інших почварах. Це гра, де все взаємодіє з усім. 

Разом із героїнею гри ви будете подорожувати пласким світом на міфічній багатохвостій лисиці, щоби звільнити світ від навали невідомих жахливих створінь і розкривати історію цього світу. І для вбивства цих істот потрібно буде друкувати… багато! А, друкуючи, ви не тільки б’єтеся, але й використовуєте різноманітні чари і вирішуєте головоломки! 

Вразило ж мене те, що слова тут підібрані тематично. Якщо ви використовуєте чари вогню, то слова над ворогами будуть пов’язані із вогнем: запалюй, гори, палай, загоряйся, попіл…

Не думайте, що гра одразу вивалює на вас оце все і каже: «Самі розбирайтеся».

Навчальний процес чудово переплітається із сюжетною лінією і не розділяє ці дві складові. Вам просто дають нову здібність і підштовхують у правильному напрямку: робіть ось так. Для цього мапа світу розбита на заблоковані тематичні області, які ви будете поступово відкривати із отриманням нових здібностей. А для деяких потрібно відкрити все.

В Epistory присутня й рольова складова: ви можете розвивати свою лисицю, поліпшуючи її характеристики, відкриваючи нові здібності, які дають можливість дістатися таємних місць.

Музичний стиль, візуальних стиль та чудове поєднання пригодницької гри із пазлами і тренажером друку — все це затриммує у грі надовго. І починаєш розуміти, що як би майстерно ти не друкував, а іноді цього буває замало (особливо якщо відвідати спеціальні арени для перевірки себе).

І, аби не спойлерити, скажу, що кінцівка гри вразила. Неочікувано. 
Спробуйте й ви.

36828582.review:
I like typing and I like games, but typing games always feel somewhat forced on their gameplay. Not this one, though. Epistory puts you a beautifully crafted world with a very unique art style, atmospheric music and an entertaining story. Even though the controls feel somewhat awkward, overall it was a lot of fun to run through the world. The combat is alright, too, though it feels like a certain type of magic is far more useful than the others. Also, playing it on higher difficulties – I suspect that is the cause, though I'm not entirely sure – rewards you with much more points than on lower difficulties, which results in unusable skill points (so you have to switch manually to the map, everytime you open the in-game menu) and enables you to unlock parts of the game it doesn't expect you to be there: I unlocked chapter 4 before chapter 3, which was kinda confusing. 

Overall, it's a great game and you should play it, if not just to increase your typing abilities or your active vocabulary.

36826016.review:
If you want to try something different, buy this game.

I'm a little ways into the story, I've unlocked three of the four powers. The story is a bit vague, and I'm intrigued to see where they are going with it, but I don't play this game for the story. There are plenty of games with amazing stories, but I have yet to encounter a game like Epistory before.

Firstly, the graphics are lovely, and the origami twist on them constantly reminds me I'm playing something different than your typical rpg/jrpg. The music and sound effects compliment the game, graphics, story and action quite well. The best part is the action, you defeat enemies, destroy barriers, etc, by typing out the name. It's amazing how much the battles can draw you in; there is nothing quite as frustrating as losing a battle right at the end to a boss because you were off by one letter!!!!

Additionally I should mention that there is also an Arena mode, along with the storyline mode, Arena mode is an endless battle, with waves of enemies where the goal is to rack up the highest score possible. It also has a high score board, so you can keep track of your highest score, and how you compare. 

Definitely worth the cost, especially if you can get it on sale!

36822970.review: It is impossible not to be enchanted by Epistory - Typing Chronicles. The plot is not particularly elaborate, but it unravels elegantly until the end, and if you never played a game of the genre, you should consider the fact that usually the plot in this kind of games is non-existant (or, at least, the ones I tried did not have one). The art style is stunning and very original, but I believe that further descriptions would be unnecessary, for it may just spoil the surprise of seeing, well, everything. The soundtrack is quite pleasant. The gameplay is not very difficult to understand, but may require you some time to master (especially if you are not used to typing in English). I quite enjoyed it.

36655569.review:
Genre: Typing?!? With RPG elements

The Good:
+ A game that successfully combines an action adventure game with rpg elements and typing! Words appear over enemies and you must type the words as fast as you can to kill the enemies before they reach you. You are also given magical abilities; lightning, fire, ice and wind each with its own unique properties, i.e fire destroys the next word, ice freezes enemies, wind pushes enemies back and lighting can destroy words on other enemies. 

+ Killing enemies rewards you with experience allowing you to upgrade different magical abilities and attributes. 

+ A decent narrative that adds to the experience 

+ Unique Art style 

The Bad:
- Some achievements are glitchy 

Conclusion:
The entire game is controlled by keyboard, I highly doubt steam controller will be viable for this game. This is a fun casual game that was a huge surprise for me. For those looking for a fun game and want to improve your typing speed, this is a great game.

36634350.review:
(This is from my blog - Kayas Arcade as a part of my 52 games in 52 weeks challenge)
https://www.facebook.com/Kayasarcade/

Week 29
29/52
Epistory - Typing Chronicles
Platform: PC
Time: ~5 hours
Genre: Typing adventure

Epistory is a fantastic beautiful little game. The art style was the thing that got my interest at first, and the different play style made me buy it. 

In Epistory YOU are writing the story - literally -, while removing trunks, planting flowers and defeating enemies. The pages unfold while you explore the universe you are writing. 

I really love how the art and story cooperate to make this great game - and for the first time I felt like a reel keyboard warrior ;)

Its most of all a typing game - and the game are giving you great hints and tips to how to type faster. I have always been a fast typer, but I must admit. It was quite hard to type fast in English, and not danish - So for me it was a really great and fun exercise. 

The constant focus on spelling every word right, unfortunately made it difficult to listen and enjoy the story at times. 

Overall - A really beautiful game, and I actually felt I learned a thing or two!

36630111.review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is a short, but beautiful hand-crafted action-adventure.
Its looks remind me of games like Tearaway, due to the huge amount of love, detail and effort put in design and animation it gives you the feeling that the world is alive.

The gameplay is a one-of-a kind, at least for me, as your only weapon are words. 
By typing the words shown on the screen you progressively learn new abilities and open the world up.
It can be monotonous at times, but that's why I think an average playtime of 4-6 hours is perfect for Epistory - Typing Chronicles.
Something I'd like to compliment this game for is its difficulty, which felt -for me- perfectly optimized, because it scales with your Words per minute (as far as I know). That means, if you are a slow typer, the game will adjust to it, and vice versa.

The story is at its strongest during the last third of the game, as things get cleared up. Therefore, the beginning can feel boring, because you have no abilities unlocked yet and trust me - they make the gameplay a lot more fun. 
I think the voice actor of the narrator did a great job at making this story interesting. 

I'd like to recommend this game to everybody who's up for a story about growing up and facing difficulties in life.
And although the combat sequences can get pretty fast and chaotic, this game is mostly about storytelling and exploration, 
so Epistory - Typing Chronicles is more of a slow-paced videogame. 

And shoutouts for the lovely song at the end <3

Śliczna gra prezentowana jako wycinanka, mająca na celu naukę szybkiego pisania na klawiaturze. Jest znacznie bardziej złożona, niż na to wygląda - posiada drzewko umiejętności oraz cztery różne żywioły, między którymi trzeba się przełączać w locie. Potworki o białym tekście można zranić dowolnym żywiołem, ale te kolorowe są podatne tylko na ten konkretny, więc czasem jest bardzo intensywnie ;-) Aby przełączyć się między żywiołami trzeba wpisać też jego nazwę - ogień, piorun, lód, wiatr - oczywiście bezbłędnie, co dokłada wyzwania.
A właśnie, język polski! To było dla mnie zaskoczenie. Gra obsługuje polskie słowa łącznie z polskimi znakami, więc jest tym bardziej przydatna dla graczy z naszego kraju (zwłaszcza tych młodszych). An incredible game about growth and finding yourself.

You explore a diverse and beautiful world that literally unfolds before your eyes. Much of the gameplay involves solving puzzles and fighting off hordes of monsters while getting lost in the art style and haunting music. You'll collect new abilities and unlock new areas with tons of exploration and a fair amount of optional collectibles.

The story is revealed to you through calming narration from both the protagonist and a narrator, giving you small snippets of what truly is happening in the main character's life. I wouldn't say the story is irrelevant, but it has little effect on most of the gameplay. Still a decent story that warrants a second playthrough to really catch on to what it's trying to tell you.

I'd like to think my typing skill is somewhat proficient (~80WPM) so much of the game was fairly easy, although some of the later sections really test your ability to spit out long words and manage which skills to use. There are no filler sections and no boring environments; it's simply enjoyable and pleasant from start to finish.

36606122.review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is a rare example of a typing game, which is structured not as an educational tool. While it doesn't give the same weird satisfaction as killing zombies with words in Typing of the Dead games, it provides a pretty fun adventure with Zelda-esque elements, except where all interactions, including killing enemies, is done via typing words. It has puzzles, it has exploration, it has typing and it's all presented in a really nice looking way as well. Story also exists, but it's bland and is usually more of a background noise, full of "symbolism".

What doesn't work in the game is the fact that the action bits get frustrating and tedious after a while. Every "boss" is an arena, where you need to quickly type words, switching between magic powers (also by typing) to kill enemies until they reach you and touch you, since a single touch means death and a restart of the entire "boss" fight.  There's just way too much of this and not a lot of creativity, despite the game starting with some nice concepts and clear potential to have a bit more puzzle stuff. Also, enemies outside these "boss" fights can spawn inside you if you're unlucky enough to stand in a wrong place, so that's also not very well done. Still, it's a really good game that's totally worth checking out.

36568501.review:
I got this game in a humble bundle, and figured it looked like it would be at the very least somewhat entertaining, perhaps in a passive way. At the very least, to play it and see what the mystery was, I thought. But surely it was just another typing game for kids, those have been done over the years. It certainly looked pretty, but that was about all my first impression was.

I was wrong. 

This game seemed pretty basic and straightforward for what I was expecting for about, oh, THREE MINUTES. It rapidly shot right past my own fairly decent vocabulary, which was highly impressive; I teamed up with a friend to send them words I didn't recognize, like sardonyx, speleothem, ettringite, etc, and they'd find and tell me the definition, which was great fun for both of us. (The ability to change screens at *any* point in the game and have everything pause, be it battle, voice over, or cutscene, by the way, is EXTREMELY handy.) I was already enjoying the advanced vocabulary, and then the first boss threw calciovolborthite at me X'D That was insane. And the game continued to surprise me with unique mechanics. I have to say, I did NOT expect an elemental aspect where you have to match them to even affect the enemies. I've never seen a typing game get so intense as the last nest battle I just fought, and I can't wait to see how much more the game throws at me. I've been raving about this game to a couple of my friends constantly as it impresses me more and more, from overall mechanics to the small details that can make or break a game. This was a surprise gem in my bundle and I feel incredibly lucky to have gotten it. If I'd somehow known in advance how amazing this would turn out to be, and had had to pay full price, or at least get it on steam sale? Worth it. Totally worth it. I love every bit of this game, and I'm not even done yet, I just felt compelled after that fight to pause and write this review. 

Devs? Great work. Just.... just WOW.

36558609.review:
I found Epistory: Typing Chronicles for a very low price, and I'm glad I did because I absolutely love this game. If adventure, puzzle and strategic games are your thing, but you're looking for something with a little twist: you've found it.

[h1]Mechanics and gameplay[/h1]
I'm a big fan of adventure and puzzle games, which this game does combine, and I feel like the typing mechanic is excecuted well in this game. It's what makes this game special, which does make me sad that not many other games use this as a mechanic. I'm also in love with the design: I love the way it folds out as a pop-up storybook and has the main character look like a piece of origami: it makes the game dreamy in a way and I did find myself looking in awe as the next area was revealed. Though some may argue it's relatively simple in design, I love the simplicity of the world. It's not too busy, but never too quiet. The dungeons were excecuted nicely as well, and I loved the way the powers had to be aquired and how they are used: they all have their strengths and weaknesses.
The only mechanic I wasn't a big fan of is the map: I thought it was poorly excecuted and I feel like most of the times, it wasn't much of a help at all. I couldn't find a shortcut to get to the map, so to see it I had to press Tab and then switch to it, but when I closed the map to look at where I was I'd have to do the same thing again, which was annoying when I got into an area where I wasn't sure if there would be enemies. The zoom function of the map is decent, but when zoomed in the map cannot be moved to other areas. This made navigating a little more difficult sometimes.

[h1]Story and exploration[/h1]
Plotwise, the game is pretty straightforward, though I did have to do some searching as to where the next reveal was located from time to time (as well as for the chests and safes), but it was never too hard. The fact most of the storyline is revealed in bits and pieces is something I really liked too, it kept me curious for every new area and new sentence written on the map. The voice acting is done very well too, it can really make or break a game and I'd definitely say this made the game a whole lot better. It is of good quality and really dragged me into the story as it unfolds.
In terms of enemies and boss battles, though I have been a little annoyed with bugs spawning pretty much in front of my feet (thus killing me), the enemies are very much managable, which also goes for the nests: not too difficult but not too easy either. The nests later on in the game really gave me a challenge that was fun to do, and it felt very rewarding when I finally beat them. Though the game doesn't give you much of a reward when it comes to clearing the nests (you get points to distribute though), I feel like the whole challenge of the fight is what got me excited for them. I've never enjoyed boss battles as much as in this game, especially near the end. 
When it comes to the length of the game, I felt like it has much more potential and thus I wish it would have had even more areas to discover and explore, as the game takes around 7-8 hours to finish when you take a little time to backtrack for things like me (if you wouldn't, I think 4-5 would be enough to play through the whole thing) and I was a little dissappointed it was over at some point. It's not a very long game in that sense, and though I feel like the gameplay you do get in it is very rewarding, the shortness left me a bit dissappointed. However, this makes it an ideal casual game to replay every once in a while, in my opinion.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
A rarely used but well-executed gameplay mechanic, good storyline, very good voice acting, great map and dungeon design, cool and creative mechanics and challenging bossfights, though a slightly dissappointing map mechanic. If you love adventure, puzzles and strategy and know your way around the keyboard, I would definitely recommend this game; although I'm not sure I would pay €15 for the game myself (I paid way less) due to the total time taken to complete the storyline. Overal, a very nice and casual game to take your mind off things, though still challenging enough to not get boring.

36497507.review:
Do you LIKE typing games? Do you LIKE foxes! Do you like a story which on the surface (the epi-story) seems rather straightforward but within is an unfolding reality of the true story? Do you like minigames (the arena) where you are able to follow your progress and become better and better at typing? Maybe even beating the steamhighscore (or be demotivated by the fact that they are hard to beat)
Well then there is an possibility of you liking it ;) but no pinky-promises

In my optic [b]NOT WORTH THE 14 BUCKS[/b] though! (all cheeves in less than 14 hours, champaign less than 7 hours) unless you would keep coming back to keep your typing skills sharp...

[h1]BUT before buying this game, you need to know:[/h1]
	- This game is not meant for the really slow typing people, the game is way too hard for it
	- To be good at this game, you need to be able to blind-write on your keyboard, but patience and practice can get you far!
	- It is heavily relied on exploration, so lots of running and finding hidden stuff.
	- If you are really into clearing all achievements as quickly as possible, well just know that the last achievements are HIGHLY repetive and boring done the quickest way! [spoiler](lots of aaaaaa, just saying)[/spoiler]

[h1]A firefoxy story to be unfolded[/h1]
This game can be enjoyed on many levels, either you just like typing, you foxy lady with powers of the elements, you like being a bit strategic about your gameplay (whom to target and with what?!), or maybe you like exploration about this literally unfolding world beyond your path.
Get the subtle hints! listen og read carefully! remember remember! 
The story, the music, the narrator, the graphics and game mechanics are pretty high end....

[h1]Here is the snake(y) and bug(gy) tale[/h1]
- The game can get quite repetitive especially if you are not emerged in the story and/or exploration.
- Too few different kinds of enemies (just bugs, worms and snake thingies).
- NO PAUSE BUTTON! I was so often curious about a new word that I had never seen before or was unsure of, but when I cannot pause then I do not have time to look it up. So I very often had a feeling of a wasted opportunity (also it makes it harder to learn the new words if you do not understand them, d´oh)

36482874.review:
Wow! Wow. I am very impressed. I'll be honest, this game sat in my library for a little while because I've played typing games in the past, and they always felt like a chore. Nothing made me want to keep playing, just tedious typing and annoying emphasis on proper finger placement. 

This game has shattered all my annoyances with typing games by creating something I actually want to play. 

[h1]The aesthetic:[/h1] Papercraft aesthetics are pretty overdone nowadays, but this game does the paper-craft / origami-like construction in a way that is actually plausible (for example, you can often see the folds to imagine how it's constructed), and fits the game mechanics and premise (you are typing, and the story's words appear on the paper ground around you). 

[h1]The mechanics:[/h1] You move the character using E, F, J, and I, instead of WASD, to help emphasize proper hand placement for typing to kill the monsters. At first I groaned, thinking "ugh, more emphasis on hand placement!", but you quickly get used to it and appreciate it. Typing to kill the monsters is actually entertaining, there are different types of monsters such as big, slow ones that use lots of small words (like "cat", "fog", and "big"), and small flying bugs that can be killed with just one letter ("H", "Q", "Z", etc). There are also larger "boss" bugs that take one or two very long tricky words, in-between monsters that take four or five letter words, and lots in between. The variety makes it enjoyable. 

There are also powers that you unlock, such as fire and ice, that allow you to burn monsters (and skip the next word as they are burning) or freeze monsters in place (and allow more time for typing). You will also use the typing powers to destroy obstacles in your environment, or make flowers grow. I really liked how the words relate to the object, for example, rocks use words like "gypsum" and "stalagmite", brambles to burn use words like "ignite" and "tinder", and flowers to grow use flower words like "heather" and "poppy". 

Probably the most entertaining is opening treasure chests, which either use treasure words (such as "money" and "award") or a fun alternation of two letters (such as "W", "O", "W", "O", "W" for a while). 

[h1]Subtitles:[/h1] Every word is subtitled by placing it directly on the landscape around you ("printed" on the paper as it is said) and the words remain on the ground forever (unless changed later, for example - your path may be blocked, and a commentary may appear about it, but later if you unblock the path, it will be replaced by something like "They broke new ground together"). 

[h1]Languages and Keyboard Setups:[/h1] Many alternate languages are present in the game to choose from using the options. This changes the displayed subtitles, words that appear over the bugs to type, and the spoken words. Additonally, different keyboard types are supported for the various languages. QWERTY is the default, but it also supports alternates for other languages such as QWERTZ, as well as alternative keyboard setups such as Dvorak, Colemak, and Workman. Interestingly, the game even distinguishes between spellings of British English and American English.

[h1]Other accessibility notes:[/h1] The game's difficulty will adjust depending on your typing speed. The developer has noted in the forums that it may take "several fails" initally for the speed to adjust for varying typing speeds and ability - for example, the game should adjust for a "hunt and peck" speed. The developer has also expressed that they want to ensure the game is accessible, and is willing to adjust the game settings to accomodate you - get in touch with them if you are interested. :)

[h1]Age Ranges:[/h1] I believe this game would be appropriate for younger children who can already read and are learning bigger words (the game reads all words aloud to you, and many of the words are synonyms of each other which could help improve their vocabulary). However, even adults will enjoy the game's aesthetic and the challenge. Because it adjusts to your typing speed, it will be a challenge to just about anyone, equal to or slightly above their ability. While I do think young children would enjoy the game (I'm no expert, but maybe as young as 7?), it definitely does not feel "dumbed down" or like a "children's" game.

Highly recommend this game!!

36436479.review:
So. I got this game as part of a Humble Bundle and had considered picking it up before the bundle. And what I got was a very nice little surprise.

What this game is:
A fun way to sharpen your typing skills
A fox riding simulator (a major plus in my book)
A relaxing way to kill a few hours in the main story
An engrosing and well-designed method of telling the story of the life of a woman in a way that isn't really the most traditional
A beautiful work of art. The graphical style, while not the most advanced was incredibly charming and I never grew tired of seeing the world literally unfold in front of me.

What this game isn't:
An incredibly deep mechanical experience that you will rave about for ages. Seriously. This game is simple in concept and well-executed, but don't expect to spend hours picking apart how it all works.
An incredibly difficult game. This isn't Dark Souls. It will push you if you are a horrible typist, but if you are a half-decent typist who is familiar with the wonderful concept of the home row, it's going to be relatively easy, even though there are going to be some tense moments in some of the battles. It will amp up your WPM, but never your heart rate.
A fox hunting simulator. Another major plus.

All in all, it's a nifty little game, with simple mechanics that have been executed well, in a beautiful package with a very wonderfully told story that isn't actually the story you think you are getting when you start playing.

36422064.review:
[u]Eine Geschichte über das Leben?[/u]

[h1]Story[/h1]
Die Geschichte handelt augenscheinlich von einem Mädchen das zusammen mit ihrem Fuchs durch eine aus Papier bestehende Welt streift, und sich sämtlichten Insekten entgegensetzt. Nebenher kommentiert eine Stimme, die manchmal Erzähler und manchmal die Hauptperson zu sprechen scheint. Parallel dazu erscheint alles Gesagte, in Sätzen, auf dem Boden. Wobei ich einen anderen Font gewählt und die Schrift etwas herausstechender dargestellt hätte, denn oft verschwindet sie im Eifer des Gefechts und ist nicht gerade einfach lesbar.
Zur Geschichte aber später mehr.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Das gesamte Spiel (inklusive des Menüs) lässt sich mit der Tastatur steueren und spielen. Man hat die Wahl zwischen der klassischen AWSD Steuerung und einer EFJI Variante, diese ist aber eher was für Leute die mit 10 Fingern tippen, um diesen das Kämpfen zu vereinfachen. Ich wurde damit aber eher weniger warm.
Collectables wie Truhen mit XP oder Fragmenten als Inhalt, waren Grund genug sie einzusammeln, was selten frustierend und meistens spaßig war.
Kämpfe sind, wie der Titel des Spiels schon sagt, auf das Tippen von Wörtern beschränkt, die je nach Storyfortschritt immer länger werden können. Man hat zum zum Ende des Spiels vier Fähigkeiten zur Auswahl, aber dazu ebenfalls später mehr.

[h1]Spielwelt[/h1]
Wie oben schon erwähnt besteht die Welt aus Papier. Genauer gesagt Pergamentpapier. Durch das Sammeln von Punkten, die durch Kämpfe und aufräumen der Welt verdient werden, kann man, je nach Anzahl der Punkte, weitere Bereiche freischalten. So arbeitet man sich beispielsweise durch Wälder, Höhlen und Vulkanähnliche Gebiete. Untermalt wird das alles von einer Musik die meist gleich klingt und nie wirklich was zur Szenerie beiträgt, aber sie genauso wenig stört, wie sie auffällt.
Oft habe ich mich in der doch relativ großen Spielwelt verloren gefühlt, und wusste nicht wo ich weitermachen sollte.

[h1]Interpretationen meinerseits [u][b]ACHTUNG SPOILER[/b][/u][/h1]
Bitte überspringe diesen Part solltest du das Spiel noch nicht gespielt haben.
[spoiler]Das Ende und viele Details lassen darauf schließen dass das Spiel eine einzige Metapher(?) ist und alles im übertragenden Sinne verstanden werden sollte. Selbst die Fähigkeiten könnten vieles repräsentieren. Feuer könnte dafür stehen seinen Willen durchszusetzen und stark zu bleiben, Eis könnte dafür stehen dass man, wenn möglich, immer ruhig und cool bleiben sollte, auch wenn man im Leben mal aufs Glatteis gerät, Blitz könnte für Antrieb und/oder Intelligenz stehen und Wind dafür dass man nicht alles zu nah an sich ranlassen sollte. Manche Dinge evtl. distanziert anzugehen und sich nicht in alles reinzustürzen. Alles Dinge die man im Leben lernt?
Fragmente erzählen die Geschichte weitaus besser als die Erzählerin selbst. In eben diesen geht es um Liebe, Verluste und die Suche nach sich selbst.[/spoiler]

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[b]+[/b]Kampfsystem macht Spaß, vorallem für schnelle 10 Finger Tipper.
[b]+[/b]Vielfalt im Kampf durch verschiedene Elemente.
[b]+[/b]Aufschlussreiche Collectibles aka. Fragmente.
[b]+[/b]Wirklich alles mit Tastatur Machbar
[b]+[/b]Ich habe das Gefühl besser mit 10 Fingern tippen zu können dank dem Spiel.

[h1]Contras[/h1]
[b]-[/b]Teilweise unschlüssig wo es weitergeht.
[b]-[/b]Das Eis selbst, aber vorallem der Part in der Grotte.
[b]-[/b]Manche Rätsel können echt frustrierend werden.
[b]-[/b]Das End-Game ist oft nur das Gleiche dass sich durch kleine Details unterscheidet.
[b]-[/b]Story muss man sich selbst erschließen. Alle Kommentare der Erzählerin hätte man weglassen können.
[b]-[/b]Die letzte der 4 Fähigkeiten ist recht langweilig und war für mich eher kontraproduktiv.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Es ist trotz allen negativen Punkten ein gutes Spiel, dass leider erst zum Ende, wenn alles offenbart wurde, seinen wahren Höhepunkt erreicht. Es ist einigartig in seiner Ausführung. Ich zumindest habe noch kein solches Spiel gespielt und kann das Spiel für Leute mit viel Geduld weiterempfehlen.

36400302.review:
It's fun for most of the campaign, but only so-so as typing practice if you can already touch-type. Typing is mostly focused on random words, which is not really the same as typing sentences. For random words I can do about 60wpm. For sentences I can do about 90wpm.

The setting is interesting, somewhat like Bastion in the way the landscape unfolds, but with a distinct style.

Movement is a little awkward. I kept hitting corners. I found it easier to use WASD than the recommended EFIJ. I wish it supported IJKL movement.

I think it was a mistake to start the character with slow movement and make faster movement an upgrade, since the slowness has no effect on combat and just makes exploring more tedious.

The various button puzzles are cute and mostly easy, except for times when I struggled with getting movement right.

The 4 different spells are interesting but tended to mess up my typing.

Ice just slows enemies. It's the most straightforward. I'm still typing every word I see.

Fire destroys an additional word on the same enemy in a slow but predictable way, so it's pretty easy to just switch among available enemies while Fire takes effect.

Spark destroys additional words on other enemies in an unpredictable way. This is annoying, but often the most powerful and useful, since typing a short word can also destroy several long words. I ended up using this most of the time in the defense waves.

Wind pushes back enemies, which often pushes them offscreen, making their words unavailable until they come back. This power sucks. The unpredictability of the sudden unavailability of words messes up my typing rhythm. I think the idea was for Wind to be helpful when there are crowds of enemies, since typing one word can push back the group. But in practice, Spark is  more effective on groups and requires less typing.

Switching between spells is kind of annoying, but fortunately there are only a few waves where switching is necessary, and the sequence of enemy types is always the same, so it's easy to learn a particular sequence of attack/switch.

36388560.review:
一款清新唯美的打字游戏。

玩家饰演一位骑着小狐狸的少女，在一个有点像早期塞尔达风格的世界中利用“输入文字”冒险畅游。作为一款以“打字”作为核心要素的游戏，不得不说《纸境奇缘》的出色远超想象，唯美的画风和舒适的音乐像是游戏的附赠品，而游戏最令人印象深刻的莫过于和环境的出色互动。比如各种稀奇古怪的矿石称呼，万紫千红的花草名字以及适配各种不同魔法才能解决的谜题所对应的单词树，在经过出色的本地化之后，玩家能收获双倍的满足和代入。

游戏剧情主要讲述的是：[spoiler]故事叙述者因为一次意外的交通事故而陷入昏迷，整个旅途的故事以及世界是她内心不断对抗昏迷的具象化，而玩家所扮演的“缪斯”则是她的精神或者说是“生命力”，在指引叙述者重构记忆。游戏中的每一个副本都对应着她特定的回忆，而游戏中的每一种魔法则对应着她不同的情绪。而故事的结局则是她重归现实世界，从昏迷中苏醒过来。[/spoiler]故事短小，明显有“意识流”痕迹。

游戏中除了“打字”之外，还拥有少量的解谜要素。这些谜题设计颇为简单，不会对玩家的通关造成太大障碍。除此之外，游戏以一种非常亲民的态度配备了自适应难度来调节不同玩家群体对于难度的需求。可以说，整个作品都由内而外焕发着一种让人跃跃欲试的冲动。以实际体验来看，小圆关闭了自适应难度，一直以极其困难难度通关了主线剧情，令人尴尬的是，极其困难并没有太难，唯有将语言重新调回英文才能体验到紧张刺激。

游戏中通关主线剧情用时只需4-6小时不到，为了增添游戏内容以及让玩家体验更加爽快和刺激的“打字”，游戏还有一个“竞技场”模式。在这个模式中对玩家水平要求大为提高，而且也对玩家关于四种不同魔法的理解提出了新的考验。比如说遭人鄙夷的火系魔法在此将大放异彩，而电系风系魔法的使用则易成为双刃剑。

尽管拥有将“打字”巧妙融入到探险这个设定的绝妙创意，但是该作并非没有缺陷。其主线剧情过于留白，玩家的关注重点往往放在四周的危险以及不想失去的连击数中，而对剧情本身（也就是游戏中淡出的文字）的走向以及说明不太关心，以至于容易对本就缺乏矛盾冲突以及代入感的剧本失去应有的理解。尽管对最后一段剧情（没有对应的中文汉字而只有注音）能够明白其文字运用之巧妙，但是一头雾水的玩家仍然不知道故事梗概。换而言之，游戏的玩法与故事鱼与熊掌不可兼得，缺乏醍醐灌顶的关于剧情而又不失游戏性的设计。

[h1]小彩蛋[/h1]

最后，说一说游戏的中文本地化。游戏中有不少细节非常出色，比如“甲壳动物”并没有发音成“jia ke”让人会心一笑，精英怪物“中华人民共和国计算机信息网络管理规定”也让人眼前一亮。大部分玩家好评的关于四种魔法的单词树及地面物品互动其实应该归功于游戏原文，中文本地化将其进行了润色处理，但是仍旧有一些漏网之鱼或者说小瑕疵（多音字问题或者是翻译本身的问题），试举以下几个例子以供说明：
1.长鳍金枪鱼（游戏中标音为zhǎng，其实应该为“cháng”，长鳍金枪鱼，学名为Thunnus alalunga，其中的alalunga意为“长鳍”，词根ana源于意大利文ala fin，lunga源于拉丁语longus，这个单词的意思是“高大”，后来也演变成了英语中的“long”，所以这里应该念作“cháng”）
2.XXXX地（游戏中标音为“dì”，这里的XXXX词组通常是形容词，其后接“地”，“地”作为状语标记修饰谓语，发音应该为“de”，）
3.Azteca阿兹台克（通常翻译为“阿兹特克”），玩过文明系列的玩家应该对此不会陌生吧，遇到的时候看到“阿兹”两个字便不假思索打出“阿兹特克”从而导致游戏GG。
4.Triskaidekaphobia 恐数字13症，通常翻译为（“十三恐惧症”），游戏中要额外输入数字，算得上一个小阴招。

[spoiler]评分：6/10[/spoiler]

36383934.review:
Muy buen juego y muy original, similar al Typing of the Dead. Hacía tiempo que no jugaba un juego tan diferente a lo habitual de los juegos de hoy en dia.
- La jugabilidad es de tipo rol, ya que vas mejorando las habilidades a medida que avanzas en el juego pero con la diferencia de que lo haces tecleando, escribiendo las palabras que te aparecen encima de los insectos para poder matarlos. Para complicar aún más el tema, cuando más dificil es el bicho, más larga larga será la palabra a teclear para poder matarlo, además de que algunos necesitaran de alguno de los 4 elementos disponibles para poder matarlo. A medida que vas subiendo de nivel, vas desbloqueando nuevas zonas del mapa.
- Los gráficos son también muy originales, con formas poligonales que intenta recrear objetos creados con papiroflexia, bien resuelto el uso del engine Unity.
- La historia no es ninguna maravilla, es lineal sin practicamente misiones secundarias y hecho en falta unas horas más de jugabilidad ya que se me ha hecho corto. El final del juego será una sorpresa si nunca has visto antes el tipo de recurso argumentario que utilizan, pero a mi no me sorprendió porque es un recurso que lo he visto en series y películas, y no digo más para no spoilear.
- La banda sonora cumple, sin mayores alardes.
Como puntuación final le pondría un 8/10 y se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo, más aún si os lo pillais de algún bundle como fue mi caso.

36381031.review:
I'd gotten Epistory from a humble bundle paired with the grey goo, which is odd because these two games mirror each other in a way you wouldn't expect. The grey goo is an RTS with amazing cutscenes, surprisingly good dialogue, and a not too bad plot, but mediocre gameplay, which is odd for an RTS. In contrast, Epistory has mediocre dialogue, a very poor plotline, but amazing gameplay... for a text typing game which is very heavy on the narrative side of things. Well that just seems odd.

So uh... yeah, this's goan be weird.

Epistory is... not an epic story. They think it is, but it's well below average. Fortunately, the gameplay is surprisingly adept with great controls, good puzzles, and enough interesting twists to the control scheme that it doesn't overstay its welcome, gradually building upon previous skills over time.

I don't want to give too much away, so the basic point is that you get various upgrades to your typing that affects both combat and puzzles in the game world, and they're easy to use but interesting enough to last through the game. The last little bit of the game drags on a tiny bit, but not too badly.

The odd part about all of this is that there's near-constant narration throughout Epistory... despite that the writing quality is pretty bad. The voice acting is delivered expertly, no issues with that part, so it's not how it's said, it's what is said that is subpar. That being said though, it only gets into fully cringe-worthy levels of awful on a few occasions so it can be mostly ignored and the gameplay heavily makes up for such.

The one issue I had with the game's mechanics, was at about halfway through the game, I had to lower the difficulty to the maximum setting. Yeah, that sounds weird, I know. Epistory has an adaptive difficulty setting you can turn on which matches the game's difficulty to how fast you can type, which was pretty nice as it kept things challenging and just slightly behind my own typing speed... until other mechanics started being introduced and it started adapting to be beyond my typing speed.

Now, I do a lot of writing, so I type at about 130wpm, so it was impressive the game was able to keep up with me with automatic adjustments like that, but it got really weird when I set it to manual difficulty and put it on its hardest setting and... the game actually got notably easier. Still, I was impressed with how it was able to adapt to my typing speed surprisingly well, and it took that long before it had a hiccup in such. This probably won't affect the vast majority of users, but I have no way of knowing. Also, it never did credit me with the 60wpm achievement, which makes me wonder about how they set that up as a lot of the time I was waiting on enemies to spawn after pewpewing them so fast.

My only other criticism is that everything in the game is timed. Like EVERYTHING. Which would be fine, it gives a nice sense of urgency to keep going even when you're just out exploring to dash to the next area to find something to continue your combo meter. The downside is that Epistory loves little cutscenes constantly being played out, and it doesn't pause the timer for such, and at a few places in the game, you're forced to run past a bunch of nice stuff on the ground while being chased by invincible baddies until you unlock the ability to harm them, which is kind of annoying when you're still on that timer but have to bypass stuff and come back to it later on. It's even more annoying when the "run away" scene goes in a U shaped loop and the enemies are flying creatures so... if you run too fast, they take a shortcut around the bend and you're actively penalized for outrunning them too well.

But still, these are mostly minor gripes. A tiny black dot on an otherwise perfectly painted wall which causes the dot to stand out because it contrasts so sharply with the quality otherwise.

Even if you don't think you'd enjoy a typing game, I'd highly recommend playing Epistory anyway. ...At a sale price of about $5 or so. Unfortunately, it's SHORT. Like I pretty much full cleared it in 5 hours so it's not going to keep you busy for too awful long, but it's a very enjoyable time while it still has content to offer. Not much for replay value, though, so probably best to get on a sale, but it's very fun while it lasts.

So yeah, recommended! ...Just don't expect an epic story out of Epistory, is all.

A nivel artístico es precioso: el zorro, el escenario, los insectos/bichos y demás cosas a matar. La forma en que vas desbloqueando zonas, como si fuese un mundo troquelado y de papiroflexía: maravilloso.

Recomendado 100%. Más o menos da para 7/9 horas de juego si tratas de conseguirlo todo.

36343079.review:
正如其名，操作方式就是敲字，敲字开路敲字探索敲字攻击(就是所有可以互动的要素都会以字母的形式展示，英语为单词，中文为拼音)
是个独立游戏，资金并不充裕，但是其制作组做了充足的游戏本土化准备，游戏内自带(中 英法 德 西班牙 波兰 葡萄牙 俄 捷克 日)十种语言，而且官方非常靠谱，不断的修复优化自己的本土化补丁，以至游戏体验非常流畅。
游戏难度适中，从极易到噩梦共6个难度，而且非常人性化的带有自适应选项。目前只噩梦难度下通关一周目，噩梦难度也并没有达到预期的困难程度，基本上都是平常跑图的时候没刹住车撞到怪身上死的，也就是说如果小心一点，一命通关最高难度其实也并不困难。不过也正是因为这样，使得游戏流程很短，只有5个小时左右。
然后是操作，除去第二章大量的冰面让我感觉很难受之外其他时候都还算不错，游戏采用2.5D的锁定视角，和正方向有45度夹角，大概5分钟左右就能适应
游戏中伴随一定的解密要素，有些比较巧妙但大多比较休闲，属于增加游戏性的解密。流程中还伴随一定的探索要素，因为游戏不是完全线性流程，所以自由度较高。
游戏画面非常漂亮，尤其是地面每次展开时总会让人兴奋。
小败笔有一些。比如地图不能自由缩放，看上去很费劲。升级系统显得鸡肋，一是能升级的不多，二是通关后我觉得即使不去升级技能也不会影响我的流程，不过是稍微增大一点点难度而已，而且技能在前期就升的差不多了，基本上除了增加跑步速度推荐升级其他的都无所谓。

I really like the concept of typing words as a twitch game mechanic and Epistory uses this to great effect. I'm a touch-typist and have a higher-than-average typing speed so that obviously affects my view of this game. I found it challenging but fair using the adpative difficulty setting. If you aren't a touch typist then this game may prove too challenging until you learn the home row. For people learning to type this could be a great practice tool.

The game is very pretty to look at and has smooth animations. The story is somewhat in the background and presented using audio narration but the main focus is exploring the landscape and typing your way to victory against your insect foes. 

If you're a typist looking to use your skills in an unorthodox way or you're learning to type and want something interesting to practice your skills on then this game comes highly recommended. It's not the longest game but I found it long enough to tell its story and show off its core mechanics well.

If you do not have any typing proficiency then this may not be the best game for you to start with as it is not a game that teaches you to type itself.
