36281673.review:
Playtime: 8 hours (87% achievements; details in "Achievement details" subsection)
This was my first time playing a typing game with story progression, so I didn't know what to expect. The result: I got hooked by the gameplay and beautiful environment and couldn't wait to unlock each new area.

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is a game where you play as a girl riding a fox, exploring an expansive world. You interact with the world with typing - clearing logs, melting ice, lighting lamps, and fighting enemies... all done via keyboard. The story is told in a minimal manner, and is up to interpretation, but still had me thinking about it hours after completing the game.

[h1]Thoughts on gameplay[/h1]
I was thoroughly impressed by how well the world was built. Each section has a theme, which (loosely) ties into the main story. For example in the industrial levels, the narration alludes to the character's memories of moving to the city. 

The way that typing is integrated into the game world is seamless - for example with your ice abilities often the word prompts are water related: "ocean", "waterfall", to name a few. You type "spark", "fire" and so on to switch between your elemental abilities. Even the movement is controlled by keyboard (it takes a while to get used to but a couple of hours in, it became second nature).

I used the standard QWERTY keyboard layout, and there are many more options to choose from. You can even make/use a custom dictionary or keyboard layout with Steam Workshop. 

[h1]Achievement details[/h1]
I enjoyed the puzzles in the dungeons, and so took my time finding and solving the optional puzzles and clearing the "nests" (waves of enemies) scattered throughout the game. By the time I completed the story, I had only missed 2 chests and 1 nest, that were easy to go back to find. 

Overall, beating the story and finding all chests and clearing all nests took me around 7.5 hours. The rest of the difficult achievements require you to type a certain amount of words and kill certain amounts of enemies, going up to 10,000 enemies total. 

I personally didn't want to spend the time, but there are many guides in the community hub and workshop items that can help you without tearing your hair out. Regardless, for fellow achievement hunters I still highly recommend this game for the story.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
I highly enjoyed my time with this game, exploring its world and beating all the dungeons. Its world building, level design, integration of typing mechanics and other positive aspects made me forget it was a typing game. One gripe is the sound design, in battles the music is very repetitive. In addition, I encountered a couple bugs, for examples enemies getting stuck and making me unable to progress. Restarting the game fixed this every time for me.

I would be willing to pay full price, or close to full price, but I got it from the Humble Bundle $1 tier. What a steal!

36270175.review:
Pretty good game! 

Nothing groundbreaking, but it's different enough to be enjoyable. It's also very pretty, so it's nice to spend a few hours looking around the world.

The game's mechanics were the worst part, especially in the late game. The "magics" don't really work very well... From sending enemies off screen (interrupting your typing halfway through), to having a completely random chain lightning (which means (1) you don't know if a given enemy will be chained to and killed and (2) you don't know which enemy will be chained and thus have its current word deleted), you'll be confused a lot of time.

There's also a problem with the colors. Contrast is fine at the beginning of the game. As you play along, the game gets brighter and brighter (the world, not the story tone), and so the enemies and their letters start blending in. It's easy to let an enemy slip by completely unseen and have to restart the challenge because of that.


Another thing that bugs me a lot is the progression system. It stops halfway through the game? The maximum useful experience is 200 000. I finished the game with 370 000. That's almost half of the experience being useless.
It seems that they're aiming for the lowest common denominator, the people who will rush through the game instead of those who will explore and try to complete everything.
Why would you do that?
It would have been much better to add some upgrades or just modifiers. At least there would be a purpose to explore. It feels weird to reach the 60% of the storyline and have experience become useless. There's not much reason to explore the world at that point...


Ok, with the problems very succinctly summarized, I can recommend the game. I had fun and it didn't overstay its welcome.
There's also the option for custom dictionaries, which sounds very good. If you're either learning a language (and need familiarity) or teaching smaller children, it's a very welcome option.

一般的冒險遊戲大多以空白鍵或E鍵來和物體互動，以手把AB鍵或滑鼠左鍵來進行攻擊；本作在這兩方面卻都是以鍵入畫面上顯示之單字來進行互動與攻擊。一言以蔽之，這是款打字遊戲！

故事從一方小小的「島嶼」開始，隨著經驗值的提升，玩家能夠逐步擴展可探索的土地，直至將島嶼變成一塊大陸，私以為是相當有趣的設計。

本作雖然是打字遊戲，但要藉此遊戲提升打字速度似有些困難。理由是本作需要大量打字的場合都是在戰鬥中，而在畫面上同時有七、八個單字需要輸入的時候，很容易因為「極度緊繃」的關係而大量失誤，這是在一般文書作業中不會體會到的情緒。因此與其說這款遊戲考驗的是打字速率，不如說是考驗玩家如何保持冷靜的能力。

36234042.review:
那是小女孩第一次见到狐狸，却不是在金黄色的麦浪中，而是在金黄色的秋季。

“如果你驯服了我，我们就互相不可缺少了。对我来说，你就是世界上唯一的了；我对你来说，也是世界上唯一的了。”

“你有着金黄色的头发。那么，一旦你驯服了我，这就会十分美妙。每到金色的秋天，我就会想起你，我盼望着与你相遇。”

每个秋天，小女孩都会出现在约定的地点。那只狐狸却再也没有出现。小女孩却没有忘记那只狐狸，她喜欢穿金黄色的衣服，那是印象中狐狸的颜色。

“嘿，想什么呢！”调皮的他又将水花溅到了她的身上。他们青梅竹马，两小无猜。“别小看我！”女孩也不甘示弱。阳光被水花打碎，照亮两张年轻的面庞，欢快的笑声在林间回响。有时候，女孩觉得他就是狐狸的化身。

累了，他们爬上树梢，女孩倚在他的坚实的胸膛上。他牵了她的手，吻了她。那一刻女孩觉得他就是整个世界。

后来，他搬去了一座很远的城市。女孩一直没有忘记他，他们约定，一起考同一所大学。女孩无时无刻不在思念他。终于，等到了那一天，却没有等到那个陌生又熟悉的身影。

原来，他早已不在。一身黑衣，一把黑雨伞，一块冰冷的石头，一张褪色的面庞。雨越下越大，那是女孩的心在滴血。

她决定离开这个让她伤心的地方。她不再穿金黄色的衣服，她决定忘掉这些伤心的记忆。
一个人，一个行李箱，又一座陌生的城市。种种不适应让她茫然无措。她想用画画来缓解压力，一提笔，往事又如潮水般涌来。晚上，她开始做一个奇怪的梦，她进入了画中的世界，里面有一只金色的狐狸，这里充满了黑暗，一堆奇怪的昆虫总是让她从梦中惊醒。

终于，她的身体支撑不住，住进了医院。远离尘嚣， 她享受到了片刻的宁静。又是一天晚上，又是那个熟悉的梦，这次她选择勇敢地斗争。闯火洞，过冰谷，穿越干旱的沙漠，她终于恢复了这个纸境世界的光明。

清晨的第一缕阳光将她叫醒。床头的照片里是那熟悉的阳光的笑容。还有，金黄色的纸狐狸。原来，他们一直都在，一直陪伴着她，爱护着她。

又是新的一天。
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
这个打字游戏必须推荐下。

画风唯美，音乐柔和，片尾曲很好听。

谜题难度适中，开图有一定自由度。主线通关后还有很多地方没有探索。

支持简体中文！能打拼音，大赞！不过切换武器打的还是英文单词。

战斗难度自适应。像我这种至今未解锁打字员成就，一堆六个汉字以上的单词就能置我于死地的辣鸡也能轻松过关。

用这款游戏练习打字不会感到枯燥，一番滚键盘以后清掉一个虫巢还是很有成就感的。

还有，价格实惠，包货里的高质量游戏，物超所值。

当然，有个小BUG，使用有击退效果的技能时，怪物会卡到墙里！卡成一张贴图，导致下一波怪无法刷新！只能强行退出重新读档！遇到过两次了，希望能修复下。

36233765.review:
我不管你喜欢点有价值还是没价值，我也不管你玩游戏遇没遇到我这些问题，反正我都遇到了，反正我玩起来这些问题影响了很多。

1.强关游戏之后游戏音乐依旧还在的问题
2.多音字的问题麻烦弄清楚好么，就行这个字hang xing 在不同的词语里面拼音是不同的，所以使用拼音输入的时候基本都是看中文字，打了半天发现不对，一看是多音字的问题真的很烦。
3.拿风魔法的地图有个宝箱开中文拼音输入是拿不到的，因为拼音输入是两行，所以必须切换成英文单词输入才可以，麻烦修复一下。
4.拼音输入在看到拼音才能开始输入这个设定感觉很不合理，我都已经看到中文的意思了。但是不看到拼音就不能输入不是很理解。
5.汉化不完全，有些单词都是个X，而且有的时候明明输入对了却一直没法输入，还得换成英语才行。这个问题我遇见了两次，一次是在拿电系魔法的哪里的有个灯笼，一个是在大地图上的某一个小怪。
6.特别蛋疼的一点，当我拿到火魔法，他提示我输入huo 切换火魔法，打了半天huo怎么还是普通攻击，定睛一看下面状态栏赫然四个字母 fire, 输入fire果然切换成了火魔法。我是服气的。你字幕文本改了，下面不改的么？
7.自动匹配难度给我匹配了噩梦的难度，玩的我一头包，换成简单难度之后。。。emmmm我只能说打字速度不快的情况下建议别尝试这个游戏了，简单难度在有几个地方没有每分钟40+字的输入速度怕是玩不了这游戏。

最后讲道理，游戏是个好游戏。也很值得购买。
但是
什么时候把上面这些问题修复了我就改成好评

36226261.review:
Positive: Gorgeous unique artstyle, epic music, captivating Bastion-style storytelling without cutscenes; way more emotional than I had expected going in. Fun puzzles with many great ideas, some of which would be good in any game, other specifically enhancing the typing experience. Despite the labyrinthic level design I always found my way thanks to very clear goals.

Negative: Going in, the game does not explain its mechanics very well. Upgrading walking speed is silly as it has no impact on gameplay. The map can be confusing as it's offset from the game view by 45 degrees. Some of the hitboxes are off, affecting sliding puzzles negatively. The white typing text can be hard to read at times, especially the cloud stage, so enemies blindside you. The typing feels too easy sometimes because typos go unpunished, so you might as well just spam buttons.

Conclusion: Epistory is a typing action adventure with an epic story and very mild difficulty. Despite many nitpicks, I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys typing and adventuring. I finished the whole game in two sittings which took me between 5 and 6 hours total.

Difficile non essere catturati dallo stile grafico di Epistory, dal dipanarsi del mondo "a là Bastion" e da musiche e narrazione eteree... che purtroppo cozzano con un gameplay ripetitivo, nonostante vengano implementati i soliti quattro elementi per dare un po' di varietà alle battaglie; sono proprio queste ultime (in particolare nei "nest", dove spawnano orde a non finire di mostri) a stancare dopo le prime 3-4 ore, mentre i puzzle ambientali rimangono godibili per tutta la durata del gioco.
In conclusione, Epistory è un bel gioco indie atmosferico e poetico, che consiglio... al primo sconto importante.

36127437.review:
This is an amazing game that seems like a lighthearted adventure, but beneath a darker story that unfolds.  I haven't beaten the game, but here's what I think it does well.
-great stylized graphics
-will teach you to type even if you think you're good already
-subtle storytelling
-unique gameplay
-you can even use the menu by typing the options
-words as weapons has been used before, but not to this degree. You can switch between attack types (fire, ice, lightning) by typing them. Ice slows their approach, fire has a chance to burn away the next word on tougher enemies ect...
-great boss battles where swarms of enemies come at you
-dungeons, zelda style exploration, and challenging gameplay
cons
-if you're not good at typing, you won't get far in the game.
-so far the puzzles have been too easy to solve

I'll update when I finish the game.  Buy it when it's on sale and you won't regret it.  If you think you're an amazing typist and want a challenge, buy it now!

36110881.review:
[h1]Epistory n'est pas seulement un jeu d'écriture. C'est un jeu [i]sur[/i] l'écriture.[/h1]

Peut-être pensez-vous qu'un jeu où l'on tue des ennemis en tapant des mots doit être ennuyeux. Eh bien justement, pas du tout. En l'occurrence cette mécanique de gameplay colle parfaitement à l'univers et à l'histoire du jeu. C'est un jeu sur l'imagination, un jeu à propos de créer des univers et des histoires. C'est un jeu qui va vous donner envie d'écrire, vous montrer que c'est quelque chose de magique. 
Pour moi qui suis "écrivaine" amateure, ce jeu m'a énormément touché et a vraiment résonné avec moi ; et je suis sûre qu'il saura vous plaire même si vous n'avez jamais envisagé d'écrire de la fiction !

L'univers et les graphismes sont sublimes, de même que la musique et l'histoire. La narratrice a une voix très douce et agréable qui vous transportera dans l'univers du jeu. Finalement, les 5-6h requises pour finir l'histoire passeront très vite et je regrette de ne plus pouvoir profiter de ce jeu autrement que par le mode arène !

Bref, vous l'aurez compris, je vous recommande vivement Epistory, qui est pour moi une véritable œuvre d'art !

Epistory is a game that sets out to be magical and succeeds in doing so quite effortlessly. Sure, at its core it's only a typing game but the bits and pieces of dialogue combine to make a satisfying, if sparse storyline. It's a joy to explore the world of Epistory, especially uncovering the fragmented puzzle pieces which give you an idea of what the plot is actually about. There's even a decent amount of challenge here, you can expect to die if you slack off on typing or don't bother changing elements mid fight. Brilliant game that's absolutely worth playing. 

8.5/10

35895238.review:
[h1] 这是世界上最好的打字练习软件！！	[/h1]
如果你对于提高或是训练自己的打字能力有兴趣，那么来吧，这将是你最好的选择！
本作从收集到战斗都是靠打字的形式来完成的！作为一款RPG游戏可以说是非常的清新脱俗了！
但更加重要是的，这款游戏丰富的剧情，优美的原声，再配合精致的画面，绝对不会让你在打字的过程中感到些许的枯燥，整个游戏过程与打字训练完美的融为了一体！[b] 甚至会让你打字打到爱不释手欲罢不能！！	[/b]

[h1]游戏性：	[/h1]  这绝对是一款能让你爱不释手、欲罢不能的打字训练软件！并且游戏内置中文！！当然也可以设置为英文来背单词~
[h1]画面：	[/h1]  画面风格非常清新，非常靓丽，也非常精致，你甚至可以看得出游戏中包括主角在内的一切物体上所具有的折纸的结构，我无法在这样的画面中找到任何缺陷！
[h1]剧情：	[/h1]  从你脚下展开的，不仅仅是大地，还有一部完整的小说！
[h1]音乐：	[/h1]  虽然称不上世界级名曲，但已经足够让你融入游戏的世界中，感受这震撼人心的冒险！
[h1]操作：	[/h1]  尽管战斗收集等要素全部是靠打字来完成的，但配合空格切换状态的设定，你甚至可以在剧情战之外的时候做到边打边跑！而属性攻击也让战斗拥有了更多的策略性。

总之，这绝对称得上是一部寓教于乐的神作！！必须好评！！

This game is really fun, especially for those who loves typing. IF you are finding a platform to practise typing, I do not think it is very suitable because the game can be stressful/challenging when you are trying to kill off enemies. 

If you are looking for something to relax, and you hate challenges - this is not a game you go for.

If you love story based games - this is for you.

I recently finished the game completely with most of the achievments. Overall, I enjoyed it, but I'm glad I bought it on sale. There isn't much replay value here, and by the end the game is tedious. In one of the final fights I found myself staring at the screen waiting for more bugs to appear. 

The game says that my WPS is 40, and I don't know don't know how accurate it really is, since there are a lot of monsters whose words are only three to four letters long. The main game is not really that difficult, but the optional nests you find out in the world can be. 

You can survive most of the battles if you make good use of your elemental powers, which you gain through out the game. These add interest, and another level of challenge to battles; to switch between your powers you have to type the name of it while you're fighting. If you're being swarmed and you fumble here, you're dead. Still, you can learn the pattern of that nest and when you have to change powers. Only one nest took me more than three tries to clear. 

The graphics are beautiful, the writing has great moments, and the story overall does make you want to continue to the end. But some tedious battles and, imo, a story that starts to lose its impact by the end makes me only recommend this game if it's on sale.

35563811.review:
Epistory is a fantastic game in every way.

The art style looks great not only standing still, but also in motion. UI elements are sparse and suit the art style well. It's remarkably easy to keep track of what going on even when there are a dozen or more words on the screen, with many more on the way. The sound design and soundtrack fit the mood as well, with some subdued atmospheric tracks, and some memorable themes used in battles.

The narration isn't overbearing, it isn't what kept me playing. However, it's executed very well: the writing ranges from poetic and serene to urgent and panicked. The voice acting matches the tone of the narration, without overpowering the rest of the experience.

Last but certainly not least, the typing is amazingly fun. Epistory uses word length and number of consecutive words to create a rhythm in your typing, and the occasional massive word makes your actions feel very heavy and labored by comparison. Environmental words are themed to the type of object you're typing. Type "oak" to clear a fallen tree, type "dolomite" to clear a pile of rocks.

The four elements utilized by the player add an unexpected amount of strategy to your typing. If there are five words on screen and you have all four elements, you have twenty options in that moment. If you're a mediocre typist like me, you can compensate for raw speed with strategy, eyes darting back and forth as you alternate targets, swapping elements to maximize damage.

Good game.

35508909.review:
This is a beautiful game.  You can complete it (including optional areas other than the Arena) in about 6 hours, perhaps only 4 if you rush it.  But don't rush it, part of the experience is gradually uncovering the world around you.

Gameplay is solid; you attack by typing the words that appear above the heads of enemies, and over time you will find four different elemental attacks with different useful abilities.  Most of the time you're free to choose whichever ability you prefer the most (some give you a bit more time to type, others help with crowd control), although some enemies can only be defeated with a specific element, shown by the colour of their words.

The controls are a little bizarre.  The default keybindings are EFJI, which allow you to move "straight" relative to the isometric world and keep your hands in a good position to be touch-typing, but take a bit of getting used to.  Alternatively you can stick with WASD or arrow keys but these move you diagonally relative to the world (straight on the screen) which can make the ice puzzles a little harder than they should be (you have to hold down two buttons to move straight).  Having said this, it should be pretty easy to get used to it.

The game features adaptive difficulty, so it will get harder (more enemies and faster movement) if you're typing well and get easier if you keep dying.  And you will die a few times -- some of the nests can get quite tricky until you figure out a good strategy for using each element.  But ultimately it provides a nice challenge and I think it can be enjoyed by anyone with at least somewhat decent typing.  (It's ok if you have to look at the keyboard most of the time, but slow hunt&peck probably won't cut it.)  And it's very satisfying when you finally beat one of the particularly tricky nests.

The story unfolds slowly as you explore, and there's a nice payoff at the end (which I won't spoil).  And the game has multiple save slots, so you can let your family or friends play alternately with you if you want, or just start again to re-experience the story for yourself.  You can also play endless Arena games (either once you've completed the story or any time during it, to get a little more practice in).

It's not really something designed to improve your typing speed, but if you keep at it you probably will improve anyway.  Typing for your life has that kind of effect. :)

I'm not very far into [i]Epistory[/i] yet (obviously), but I just had to leave a rave review from the beginning, based on the graphics and concept alone. This is a beautiful game and the concept of a story-driven typing game--including upgrades and magic--is wonderful. 35473585.review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is great, let's get that right out of the way -- if you think you'd like this game, you will. It's gorgeous, it runs butter-smooth (at least on my end,) it's fun and challenging and I thoroughly enjoyed the sense of discoery I felt throughout my playime.

But, I'm getting ahead of myself here.

The story of Epistory centers on a girl who rides upon the back of a fox, as she travels through a world fragmented and attempts to piece together what has befallen both herself, and the place she calls home. If that sounds very sterotypically RPG-ish, then I do a disservice to the storytelling -- all is told in lines of prose, bits and pieces coming together as the world literally unfolds around you, and the whole thing is fully voiced. The narration may grate on you, but I personally enjoyed discovering the story this game had to tell. It gave the journey through this world a sense of purpose, and it was very hard to put down as a result.

Epistory is... a little hard to define, as far as the genre goes. I originally described it to a friend as "Okami meets Bastion", and while I still stand by that, it is a bit of a weird way to describe a game in which every action is initiated by typing it out. The game's most interesting mechanic is that actions are spelled out for you -- literally! You have to type a word to perform an action -- Poplar to remove a dead tree, or perhaps Rose to bloom some flowers. Sirocco to blow the winds, Glaciate to freeze the waters, Cremate to burn away some brambles... if you do not enjoy typing, you will not enjoy this game -- but don't knock it until you try it. It's ridiculously fun to solve puzzles (there are many puzzles) and alter the world with the words you type, and combat is challenging and fun all at once.

If this game doesn't up your typing speed I will be surprised, because there were moments when I was quite literally typing for my life. It was great. Each of your abilities has a different effect whne typed, and some enemies can only be harmed by a certain ability -- which is helpfully indicated by the color of the words above their head. (Colorblind players, I apologize in advance. If I may make one suggestion to the devs, it is perhaps putting a small symbol of the required element somewhere near the word or on the body of an insect to acommodate the people who want to play but cannot do so due to difficulties with the color-coding. Alternatively, an alt-color mode for colorblind people could help remedy the problem!) Death is instantaneous if something touches you, but I never had too much problem with that, and there is no real loss if it happens. Just try again!

If there is any one complaint I have about Epistory, it's that the controls came straight out of hell. It's not a deal-breaker, but WASD for diagonal movement and EFJI for moving in straight lines makes for painful sliding ice puzzles. But it's not a bother once you get used to it, and I spent most of the time just holding a pair of W/A/S/D to hit a straight lined instead. It is a pitfall of games with an isometric view, but it is a small one when the game is this good. Plus, there are mods for changing the controls -- and if it's a bonus, this game supports every kind of keyboard setup I have ever seen. Rejoice, Dvorak, Colemak, Bepo, and all the rest of the configurations out there -- you have been accomodated, too!

In all, Epistory is a gorgeous treat of a game with beautiful papercraft-esque graphics and really solid sound design, with engaging gameplay that features everything from inventive combat to puzzle-solving to exploring for hidden treasures and collection items, with an interesting world and captivating story and enough fun and challenge to keep you playing for hours -- and I personally feel that the price is bang-on for how much I got out of this game. It's worth retail, and I don't say that often! It's a real gem of a title, and I cannot recommend it highly enough. Epistory was a wonderful experience, and I hope someone else comes to enjoy it through this review as well.

Thank you for reading!

35468399.review:
通关完回来写测评，一款超棒的打字游戏！

因为特别喜欢打字的感觉，在看到Epistory的画面的时候就毫不犹豫地入了，它果然没有辜负我的期望。

+操作+
第一次尝试EFJI式的移动方式，不过由于地图的特殊性和打字需要，这种方式其实意外的很舒服。游戏中的操作只有走路和打字两种，所以还是比较简单的，就是有时候不知道跑哪去解锁新的区域……打字先尝试了英文模式想练练词汇和打英文的速度，在发现英文单词没有翻译而且好多不认识的时候默默调回中文orz_||| 中文是拼音和文字都给出的，基本就是看着字盲打了，怪物多的时候手指翻飞你就能体会到打字的快感！！！美中不足的是词语的出现时机因为同时给出拼音和文字，所以有时候出现得特别晚让人猝不及防，[spoiler] 还有坑爹的分隔符'第一次碰到的时候我真是不知所措莫名奇妙然后死了……[/spoiler]

+难度+
解谜的难度还是比较简单的，就滑冰（类似一笔画）稍微费点脑子。打字的难度有点高，我最高达到过55词/分钟的速度也在普通难度的一些boss战里死过。有时候虫子的属性特定还得切换魔法就比较麻烦。
[spoiler]最长的词也不过就是“承天广运圣德神功肇纪立极仁孝睿武端毅钦安弘文定业高皇帝”这种嘛~[/spoiler]

+画面+
折纸风格非常合我心意，每个小副本都各有特色。游戏中收集的画则是水彩风格的，是另一种体验。这个宣传视频里就能看出来，就不多说啦！

+音乐+
各个小副本有不同的符合情境的bgm自不必多说，值得一提的是背景音的自然元素，鸟叫、刮风、流水、跑过草地的声音，也有令人时不时吓一跳的蛇行、振翅、昆虫移动的声音。个人最喜欢破碎之岛那种脑子进水的声音hhh。迷失沙漠里越往深处走越燃的音乐和通关后温和的唱曲也令人印象深刻。

+剧情+
说实话像我这种玩游戏不带脑子的人其实并没有搞清楚全部的剧情……不过随着走路出现在环境中的旁白文字，还有字体不一样的破碎的对话都让我很感兴趣。玩的时候没有收集齐剧情画作的碎片，通关的时候却全部轮流放出来了，这才得以了解个大概。剧情可能并不丰满，但是是那种陪伴你到最后的感觉。[spoiler]基本是个很日常的故事吧？女主小时候收养过狐狸，随着年龄增长，经历了许多事，内心不断成长。最后女主从病床上醒来的那一幕不禁让人会心一笑，长舒一口气。[/spoiler]



通关完了之后基本手痒的时候来一盘竞技场，或者传送到破碎之岛让脑子进水感受宁静哈哈哈哈哈

35385895.review:
Pretty cool game and very unique.  I happen to be a fast typer so the game was even more enjoyable for me because it was allowing me to use that strength to my benefit.  At first I wondered how difficult it could be just typing to kill enemies and such but they do some interesting things with speed of creatures as well as the difficulty of some of the words.

The controls are a little bit tough because they introduce you to using E, F, I, and J as this keeps your hands in a typing stance, but it takes a little getting used to.  Also, sometimes I find myself locking my character in typing mode when hitting space so be aware of whether or not you are in typing mode already before hitting space.

The world is beautiful and I love the overlay of the narration both vocally and visually within the gameworld.  The graphics are really unique and the way the world opens up as you go is really cool.  I also like the abilities that you are able to attain as you progress.

I just also played my first arena which was very cool but also a little tiring.  I thought I had actually done very well as I played the arena for what felt like 10 minutes, however my score only got me into about 2300th place!  I imagine the others have higher skills but still it must take a lot to place well in those arenas.

Overall, the game is very fun and I am just over an hour in. I really enjoy a new feel to a game and this gives you that. I imagine you would not like this game if you are not a good typist but this will help you become better so it is still worth playing. I am not sure if you can change the difficulty or not.

Defintiely worth trying out at such a slow cost as the story and wonder of it all is pretty amazing!

35355298.review:
[b]語彙力のないのが書きたいこと書いただけなのでおｋな方だけ[/b]
∟このレビューの投稿者は実績コンプする程度はプレイしています

[h1]まず俺個人としての評価は[/h1]
∟折り紙を基調とした美しいグラフィックにアドベンチャーとしての世界観とストーリーがただのタイピングゲーとは違うんだぞ！とプレイヤーを楽しませてくる良いゲーム！
　日本語訳完備なので英語ﾑﾘｰでも難なくプレイできるとこもGood!

[h1]ゲームシステム[/h1]
∟まぁタイピングクロニクルっていうだけあってタイピングがメインなわけだけど、アドベンチャー要素とうまくかみ合わせてる部分もあってかなり特殊な感じになってると感じたかな。
　アドベンチャーだから広いステージを探索したりするわけだけど障害物の倒木とかをどかす際に[u]『柳(YANAGI)』[/u]など、正しくタイピングできたら障害物が消えたり、宝箱を開ける際には[u]『ルビー(RUBI-)』『ダイヤ(DAIYA)』[/u]とかそのオブジェクトに関連のある言葉がタイピング要素として出て、俺個人としては　ｵｵ雰囲気ﾋﾟｯﾀﾘ　と感心したよ。
　中にはパズルや時限式の仕掛けとかあってアドベンチャーとタイピングをうまく融合しててすごくステージ探索を楽しめることができた。

　探索だけじゃなく敵との戦闘もある。四方八方からｿﾞﾛｿﾞﾛと大量の敵にタイピングで攻撃するよくありそうなタイピング戦闘だけど、敵ごとに硬かったり、すごい速さで突っ込んでくるのがいたり属性攻撃じゃないと倒せない奴がいたりと、ストーリー進行とともに徐々に開放される属性を切り替えながら殲滅速度を上げて進めることになると思う。

　『KAEN』と打ち込むと、火炎攻撃になり連続するワードを燃やしてくれて、
　『KOORI』と打ち込むと、氷結攻撃になり敵を凍らせて動きを止めて時間を稼いでくれて、
　って感じで属性ごとに追加効果もあって使い分けて敵の殲滅速度を上げていく感じかな？
　中には特定属性しか通用しない敵がいて、属性の切り替えをバンバンすることになる、属性に切り替えるたびにワードを打ち込むからこれがまた大変で難易度を上げてる要因になってるかな？
　エンドレスなバトルでスコアを競うアリーナモードもあってタイピング練習にはかなり効くゲームとおもう

[h1]ストーリー性[/h1]
∟きっちりと語られてるわけじゃなくて少ない言葉でプレイヤーの想像にゆだねた雰囲気重視な感じ、なぜ主人公が狐に乗っているのか、ここがいったいどこなのかは道中のテキストやエンディングを見て各々で感じ取って欲しい

[h1]プレイしてて思ったこと[/h1]
∟良いとこは十分にあるゲームなんだけどやっぱ不満もある。
　日本語のタイピングって「ふ」の打ち込みに　「HU」「FU」と二通りあると思うんだけど、このゲームどうにも後者の「FU」でしか認識されない。他にも「つ」や「ち」も「TSU」「CHI」と余分に打たされる、慣れれば問題ないと言えばそれまでなんだけど...
　やっぱ打ちにくいったらありゃしない・・・投稿者は「じ」は「ZI」と体が覚えてるのだが「JI」と打たなければ反応しないからゲームオーバー量産の要因になっている。この柔軟性の欠如がかなりストレス。（まぁおかげさまで普段やらない打ち込み方も上達したけど）
　バトル中によく感じるのがくっそ長いワードを持つ敵は画面中央に少し近づいてからじゃないと打つべきワードが見えないし、打ち込みを始めることができない。おかげさまで打ち込める時にはもう敵が間近に迫っているというかなり理不尽を味わう目に会う。
　日本語訳も怪しいとこがあって「それ」って日本語表示ではなっているのに打ち込むべきローマ字は「KORE」...ｵｲｵｲって感じでこまかーいとこでストレス要素がある

[h1]まとめると[/h1]
∟アドベンチャー部分の完成度はとても高くて十分に楽しめるし、グラフィックも見ててすごい綺麗だからそれでも楽しめる。でも日本語訳が怪しい、間違ってるとかの理由でタイピングの部分に少し苦しめられたかな？っていう感じ、
　オススメかって言われるとアドベンチャー部分は楽しいけどタイピング部分がｳｰﾝって人は無理しないことを奨める。本当に良いゲームなんだけど...ねぇ...

几乎不评测游戏，但一款打字游戏，能做到这么棒的体验，忍不住得来推荐一下了！
清新的美术风格，整个世界是用纸折出来的，有的还是用写满字的书页。
玩起来就像作家一样，沉浸在文字和纸张之中，真让我赏心悦目了。
解谜难度并不大，却很挑战打字速度，默认是会根据你的打字速度动态调整难度的，玩起来非常紧张刺激。
中文版打的是拼音，让我能用最熟练的输入方式来迎接挑战，本地化做得算是非常用心了。
打折以后才33，很值！

35239995.review:
从游戏类型上看算是比较冷门的游戏了（我在买游戏的时候都不知道这是个打字游戏）。但是作为一个打字游戏，感觉可以打9分吧。总体有几点想说的：
1、	画风很棒。折纸为主题背景，主人公骑着狐狸的小女孩展开自己的解密冒险的旅程。地图随着游戏的推进逐渐以折纸的形式展开，画风清新唯美。
2、	更多的元素。以打字游戏为基础，加入了解密和收集类的游戏元素，用4种不同的打字类型[spoiler]（火、冰、电、风）[/spoiler]来完成不同的要求，在普通的打字上加强了游戏的挑战性，丰富了可玩性。
3、	游戏的难度合理。不同元素的打字效果和只对单词的要求让游戏的难度下降了很多，而在竞技场中难度的提高又符合了挑战性格的人的要求。
4、	语言。有官方中文版，也能在中文的环境下用外文的单词挑战。
考虑到游戏的价格，我觉得9分吧，比较推荐。

35236001.review:
8/10
买完后一次性通关，勉强做到全碎片收集
总的来说是一个非常优秀的作品，内容丰富，而且战斗紧张[spoiler] 打字速度慢 [/spoiler]
困难模式下如果不熟练一个普通的玩家[spoiler] 打字员 [/spoiler]可能会在一些小地方碰到困难。
故事的内容是一个打字员睡着以后杀天杀地杀空气的故事。
就算故事模式完成了还有wuli竞技场等着诸位。[spoiler] 目前30000分，已经无法继续。 [/spoiler]
相对于价格来说物有所值，对打字游戏有兴趣的绝对可以入手。
但是有几个槽点必须要吐：
1、有文字bug。最典型的就是烟火的烟字是个XX。还有恩这个词无法输入，强迫症快死了。还有一个莫名其妙的英文，最后的结尾是个XX，这两个XX根本无法输入。
2、游戏的路程引导不是特别友好。虽然有预感技能，但是找路仍然有点累呼。经常跟着预感的线走走到一个死路上然后又指引到另一个目的地去，完全理解不能。
3、怪一多了就容易密密麻麻，然后看都看不清文字，我大概有一半以上的次数是因为这个原因挂的。
4、冰、火、电、风，这些技能能不能改成中文。[spoiler] 虽然教程里面号称已经改成中文了。 [/spoiler]英语不是不能打，但是打起来就是别扭，尤其是spark每次按起来很不爽。

35228630.review:
神作。
我从来没想过自己会在steam上沉迷打字欲罢不能，这款游戏证明了游戏并不一定需要走位预判组合技，只要用上所有字母按钮就能进一步增进战斗的节奏感和打击感。游戏的难度在于越到后期就越会出现一些生僻词汇导致卡顿，相信玩这款游戏会对玩家的打字水平有一定的促进作用。
休闲的迷宫解谜，小清新画风和略带忧郁的剧情都让人能够有一定的代入感，游戏的收集元素和地图展开方式都比较简明易懂，不会给玩家造成太大的麻烦保证了流程的顺畅。
战斗部分，疯狂敲击键盘的感觉不能再爽。特别是机械键盘用户，星际玩家和语言学习者请务必尝试一下这款游戏。虽然目前还没有尝试过第二第三语言，但是从中文版的难度上来看不是母语的话恐怕难度会很高。这款游戏不仅提供了简中，我甚至还在其中订正了几个自己一直念错的词，可以说非常良心了。
作为一款真正意义上的文字冒险游戏，我想这款游戏将会是一个先河，希望工作室能够开发出更多有创意的打字游戏，比如说融合进历史元素或者理科的内容的话会更有意思，特别是多人模式可开发的潜力会很大，今后会持续关注他们的动态。

通关后感想：
在故事模式里面，没有让我感受到难度和压力的关卡，不知道是我单身太久还是游戏设置的太过简单，我觉得在boss战的最后阶段应该加入一些”苟利国家生死以“或者达拉崩巴之类的高难度长句，而不只是”中华人民共和国网络安全管理条例“。而竞技场的速度和密度的确提供了相当的难度。
同时还一些问题存在，首先是都人被攻击后会被推出攻击范围，导致你有时要等它再走进来，这个在故事模式里问题非常明显，其实只要在视野里的都应该可以被攻击，这样可以节约一些时间。有一次一个敌人被卡在屏幕边缘，导致我不得不强退。
其次是由于中文的同音字出现概率非常高，在场上出现太多类似单词的时候就会导致一些坑人的bug，你无法继续输入现在的单词也无法切换到另一个，出现的话基本上就跪了。
最后一个问题是拼音的分隔符居然得到了保留，同时也可能由于前述问题的影响，火冰风电并没有用拼音而是英语表示，这都无形中增加了一些难度，但还是可以接受。
创意工坊里面已经开始陆续出现了一些词库，非常期待有大神能做一些暴力一点的mod，你懂的。

Tough game to review, this.

Gameplay wise - let's say its letter-typing battle system is interesting, but it's probably not for everyone. The game adjusts its difficulty on its own, so it reacts to the player's skills. But it does get boring in a couple of hours. Discovering the world is beautiful, but mostly thanks to the narrative. Graphically the game is interesting and unique, but I can confirm from other reviews that I don't feel the developers used their book-folding origami style to its full potential.

Story wise - perfect. Deep, emotional, original. Something that touches our deepest parts where we were being hurt during our childhood.

Together - the gameplay and the story make for a really good game which presents enough of a challenge, but doesn't require too much of your time or attention. You probably won't play it more than once, but I say it's worth it.

35197863.review:
Do you remember those type of programs like Keyboard Master, Typing Master and so on? How they told you how to place your hands on keyboard, how to type etc.? As a kid I used the first one and oh boy, was it pain to use - nothing serious, single lost dot was considered an error... And constantly typing stuff like "sad", "asd" and so on was BORING...

Here is the trick - this game is all about typing (bah, even default control keys are e/f and i/j for movement) but with good, nicely written story, some tricks to help you with enemies and somewhat tactical battles. With adaptive difficulty, the game is always challenging and with many different languages to choose from.

Even words you type are themed - to remove trunks along the way you will have to type words regarding, well, trunks, branches, obstacles; to remove rocks - everything regarding earth, pebbles and so on, using "elemental" magic - words regarding this element (fire / water (ice) / shock (electricity) / wind). Sure, there are some words that are hard but again - it's all depend on difficulty.

For me it's great, after using it for English I will probably check it for Polish which will be probably way more painful to play, but also more challenging. Should be also good for learning new words in specific language.

我原先对自己的打字速度是觉得还可以的，但这游戏，每次都得拿出最高的手速噼里啪啦的敲键盘，超高强度暴敲六七分钟…有些关卡甚至得打三次，深深的自我怀疑。

游戏的谜题难度并不是很高，无非是按合适的顺序踩方块，按合适的顺序开机关，动点脑子，跑跑路就差不多，尤其还有详细的地图帮助你。

而游戏本身的剧情感觉比较难懂，集齐了画廊后我才能对剧情猜测一点，大概是一个小女孩成长的故事，每个副本都对应一段人生经历，收集齐碎片后就能完全展示出一张画，每张画的女孩都比之前增长了一个人生阶段。

我不知道别人玩这游戏什么感觉，我感觉这游戏是比较压抑的，副本的名字都让人轻松不起来，火焰洞窟、被遗忘之森、溺水厅堂…
当最后我打完所有的副本，想把狐狸和小女孩放在一个好一点的地方，然后关掉游戏的时候。居然整个游戏都找不到什么好地方，因为走几步可能就会遇到毒虫，没有什么安全舒适的地方，这是我觉得最难受的时候。小女孩和狐狸付出了这么多努力，走遍了世界，结果最后也没有让他们好好生活的地方么？

[olist]
[*]前期的点数优先加给提高分数的技能，然后是地图技能，尽早加满，能查看宝箱的位置，然后适当加狐狸平时的行走速度
[*]属性技能加点，前期我推荐加冰系，我前期点了两点感觉非常好用，冰冻能阻止怪继续向前进，每当有怪出现就给他上一个冰冻，只要是移动的怪就上冰冻，由近至远，由先到后，可以说是控制神技。直到中后期我点满了冰系，主力还是用冰系，依然控的住场。而火系我直到最后获得风系之前，点数溢出了我才给他点满，因为前期烧单词慢还不如手打，后期点满快了点但是也没啥用，即使是针对一些长词怪，我宁愿用电系从旁边的小怪导电打长词怪，所以火系真是意义不大。

35006314.review:
There are so many games out there that fit into one formula or another, one is tempted to assign numbers to them and say, "For a Number 9, that's not bad." This game utterly defies such cynical pigeonholing...it is its own category. And I say that affectionately and a bit sad that it is over.

Unless you can divide your attention and type like a whirlwind, you will struggle with this game. That's not a criticism, that's just a fact. The game starts easily enough, but each new level builds on all that came before, and all too soon you'll find yourself trying to switch modes during a melee.

That aside, the lyrical and fresh qualities of this game are engaging and I can't recommend it enough for originality, playabiliity, empathy, and challenge. When it ended I felt good about my skill, but I also felt good about the whole premise of the game and its sympathetic protagonists.

34943042.review:
This game is amazing on many fronts. It is stunningly beautiful, the story is interesting and written elegantly, the puzzles are challenging and the typing game mechanic is unique, compelling and refreshing. Switching between elements adds an extra layer of strategic planning to the game mechanic and the leveling system provides you with a lot of freedom of choice. It is very, very rewarding. 

This is probably one of the best PC games I've played... ever. The dungeons remind me of old school, top down Zelda games. This is creativity and design at its finest. The only complaint I have is that character movement is clunky and isn't all that intuitive. But it makes sense given the game is designed so that you keep your hands in qwerty position 95% of the time (besides in menu). Eventually, you get used to it but it is still very tank-like, rigid, grid movement and just doesn't feel all that natural.

Buy this game. It is well worth the money.

P.S. +1 for Linux support.

34586684.review:
[h1]Epistory – Typing Chronicles[/h1]
...is a keyboard practice adventure. Explore a world that unfolds before you as you recall memories of the past while practicing your typewriting skills.

[h1]⚠ [u]Description[/u][/h1]
The core goal of the game is to practice your keyboarding skills, having you type words without mistakes as fast as you can. Combat segments usually consists of waves of critters advancing to your position from all sides, each with random words above them you must type to strike, some requiring multiple words to defeat them. The more words you chain in a short time, the more experience you get from the encounter, leveling up to unlock perk points you spend on passive skills.

You expand the world by reaching Reveal locations, each requiring an increasing amount of experience to show more of the world, creating new paths or connecting islands to the main continent. There are also dungeons you can explore to collect fragments for experience, solving puzzles, and learning new powers (using fire burns enemies whose word you type, ice will freeze them, etc.), some creatures and interactive world elements can only be affected by certain powers.

[h1]☺ [u]Pros[/u][/h1]
It is an absolutely gorgeous game. Everything is themed around literature, from the story segments that are narrated to you as you progress through the game, to the exploration where pages of text flip open to create the land, trees and rocks. Every world object is built from origami-like art or paper mâché, same goes for the critters you encounter. This fits perfectly into the mechanics that, after all, consists of typing words.

The story is a mystery for you to discover. You’re a girl riding a fox as you recall your memory from exploring the world. You enter an area where fond or eerie segments of the story are told, either by a narrator, or from recalled voices of events from the past. You will spend the whole game not getting closure on what is happening until the end of the game where the credits conclude and reveal exactly what this whimsical adventure was about.

[h1]☹ [u]Cons[/u][/h1]
You can’t learn proper keyboarding technique from this, as it only gives you your finger placement once in the early game and never gets back to it. You also jump right into typing entire words, rather than gradually memorizing your keyboard a few additional keys at the time, or using any proven keyboarding learning methods from typewriting edusofts.

Narration and story won’t make sense as you play through the story mode, and may even come out as an obnoxious attempt at being artsy, you actually need to complete the game for you to make out a coherent pattern. But you’re unlikely to replay the story mode a second time to finally understand the narration, as once you’ve reached the level required to complete it, re-doing the story mode will feel too easy so you’ll limit yourself to Arena challenges if you wish to continue perfecting your keyboarding.

[h1][b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - [i]"It's up to you."[/i][/h1]

I liked [i]Epistory – Typing Chronicles[/i] and am happy I played it. If you don’t want to practice keyboarding skills or don’t already know a proper keyboarding technique, this may not be for you. But if you do and are looking to practice, it is undoubtedly the most beautiful keyboarding practice game there’s ever been on the market before, and that’s where this gets my recommendation.

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

34382913.review:
I'd like to start by saying that I bought this game simply because there's a person riding on the back of a giant fox.

I was a little dissapointed to learn that it was a typing game (I of course realized this before buying and stuck it on my wishlist to buy during a sale in case I wouldn't like it), and didn't really know what to expect as far as story was concerned.. I didn't want to delve into something that was too repetative or boring. Typing games are fun and all, but usually I just end up frustrated that my 45 WPM isn't good enough, and usually it's just typing with no real direction behind it.

That being said, I literally have no regrets in purchasing this game. 

The graphics are unique and the story unfolds (literally, unfolds) into a deeply and eloquently written mystery. As you play through the levels, you slowly realize that this mystery is about you, as the main character... you are slowly piecing together memories of where you came from and how you ended up where you are now. While that story arch has certainly been over-used in games/movies/books, etc, the ending was delightfully fulfilling, regardless. I can't say that it tugged fully on my heartstrings, but it came awfully close.

One of my favorite things about the game is the narration. As you explore the map and unlock new areas, the unlocked scripts are narrated for you. This not only sets the mood in many instances, but it helps piece together the story of your adventures throughout the map (and your own memories). It felt a little like a fun novelty in the beginning, but by the end of the game I found myself eagerly searching small corners of the map in hopes of finding something I had missed. This feature also helps drive the game without feeling like you are being lead around by the nose (if you ever feel lost, try to follow where you think the next set of text lines will be!).

The graphics are good without being overwhelming. I actually really loved the simple origami style, in which most everything looks like folded paper. There are some areas which felt hard to navigate because certain grasses are not walkable but look like they should be (there are a few "backgound", decorational items like this as well); but overall it did not really negatively affect the gameplay. It was also fun to see the fox's gait change on surfaces such as ice, where instead of walking, he slips around. The controls were easy to understand and use, and I found no issues with any of them (I played on my laptop keyboard and mouse).

I was also fond of how the levels were set up, in that if you did things slightly backwards, it wasn't a big deal. Some areas you can only unlock after unlocking something else (you need to complete this level in order to gain an ability that lets you into the next level, etc), but for the most part it felt fairly free-roam. You can move around the map as you please, discovering new areas and/or defeating nests for experience points, which you can then spend as you'd like. This allows you to build up your character skills in whichever manner you'd prefer (you'll have enough skill points to buy out everything at the end of the game, but choosing how you want to build in the beginning may change difficulty between players). You aren't forced, at any point, to select certain abilities in order to get past a level. This made gameplay feel more natural and less lead, which I enjoyed thoroughly.

Overall, I found the game very relaxing and really wondered why they didn't put games like this into schools to encourage us to WANT to learn to type (and then remembered that I went to school oh-so long ago).

On top of most of the game being a relaxing dive into a great story, it did have some great "boss" battles, which actually had me on the edge of my seat. Some were easier than others, but most really required a great amount of focus and calm (which is difficult when your adrenaline is pumping!). The more you work yourself up, the more blunders you make while typing, the more times you are apt to fail. The trick really is to stay as calm and focused as you can to get through - and boy is it relieving when you finally do!

I think the only thing that I can really say negatively about the game is that one nest in particular is ABSOLUTELY RAGE INDUCING. I rage quit the game a few times, to say the least (and scared my boyfriend with my incessant, top of my lungs swearing). I stumbled upon the particular nest about mid-way through the game, failed a million times, and then decided that I probably needed one of the abilities I had not yet unlocked in order to defeat it. I was wrong. The new abilities really didn't do anything for me, and I finally managed to defeat it using my first two of ice and fire, primarily. Whoever decided that the word "Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis" should be included can go suck it. I can't even read that thing in my head, let alone try to furiously type it while surrounded by a swarm of other convulutedly named insects. It was this nest in particular that played on my fears that 45 WPM would never be good enough to get me through a typing game (but I made it, so TAKE THAT!).

Overall, I highly recommend it, even though I will likely never play through a 2nd time, if only for that one nest (it seriously ruined the entire mood of the game for me and I never want to feel that level of rage again). I bought it on sale and feel like it was worth the money (40% off, I believe). Couldn't tell you if full-price would be worth it.. I suppose it would depend greatly on your taste in games. But if you like reading, typing, and a fairly laid back play style (with some short, adrenaline rush battles), this game is for you!

34296998.review:
After some positive comments and reviews on Steam praising the game, I decided to try this game. I will try to be brief, this is an overrated game, plain and simple. Let's delve into Epistory.

The idea is to combine exploration, typing and a good story, at least that's the impression you get in the first hour of the game. The problem lies that all the promise shown in those first stages quickly evaporates. The typing mechanic is just a gimmick, as such you will find typing the same words over and over and over again for hours. The developers try to spice things up with a series of powerups which don't solve the core problem, you will get bored quickly typing the same words. The core mechanic of the game is simply boring. But that's not the only flaw of the game, the exploration is simple and not rewarding at all, I mean what is the point of looking for chests when the only reward you will get is an image? That's the reward they offer you for exploring the map, EXP points and a portion of an image. After a while you just don't care about those chests. The only thing left is the story, at first it seems like an interesting proposition, soon you will dismay in front of such a bland and dull tale. Besides, it has a very bad ending which doesn't offer the player value for his/her time.

If you are asking yourself why this game has so many good reviews, your guess is as good as mine, I suppose some people really liked the art style but apart from that the rest is average at best. There are better options on Steam.

34265589.review:
TL;DR: 
If you are wanting an okay typing game, buy Epistory
If you are wanting a game that transcends the genre, look elsewhere.

I enjoyed my time with this game, although I do not think that it deserves the lofty praise that Steam's review structure affords it. There is more good than bad, though the good is more middling than excellent, and the bad is perhaps more personally felt than indicitive of the games appeal. The art direction is its strongpoint, the exploration, collectability, and discovery is enough to create a half-decent hook, and the music is pretty well done. However, while typing is its focus, the gameplay doesn't capture the rythmic movements of typing itself, and while promising a more involved story-driven game, it does not deliver.

First, the typing. It is a strange complaint, I know, but I do believe the control scheme could have been better implemented. When typing a sentence, you rely on the space-bar to string together words. In Epistory, the space-bar initiates typing but it also ceases it. This creates a disconnect with how you type normally and how you type within the world the game has created. This nitpick of mine is just that - a nitpick. But it is the difference of the gameplay feeling natural and familiar rather than stuttered and almost-familiar. For a long while I could not understand why I struggled with reaching my natural typing speed in-game (45WPM vs. 35WPM) and why stringing combos together was more difficult than it should be. If this input had instead been the Enter key, with each new word needing the space-bar to begin, I think it would have resulted in a more free flowing and enjoyable game.

Why Epistory initially appealed to me was through its unique gameplay, art style, and the promise of a narrative that would engage. It is not an engaging story. The narrators vague ruminations were never able to burrow itself deep enough within me to care about what the game was trying to say. I started the game actively trying to piece together what had happened and why, though I quickly gave up on this. Epistory does a poor job of holding the players attention, telling the story in loose, generalised statements rather than with something poetic. We are told early on that something has happened, with the main character struggling to remember what, but the hints offered after are just variations on this first mystery. The environment gives clues but nothing relevatory, no inspired ending - in fact, no story to speak of, just a plot point that sadly does nothing except give the false impression of motivation. I'm all for sparse, emotive storytelling, but Epistory does this in the most forgettable way.

Halfway through I gave up on the story as I did not care, instead enjoying it for what it is - an okay exploration-based typing game. But for a typing game, this seems to be enough to garner what seems to be universal praise. Had the story and the gameplay meshed in a more satisfying way instead of an easy-to-ignore telling of a half-baked premise, it would have been easier to recommend. Instead, the game doesn't offer much more than typing words in an aesthetically pleasing manner. It commits what I think is the cardinal sin of gaming - it becomes boring.

I do recommend it to people that want a decent typing game - it is that. But it is not as good as what the Steam reviews indicate. There is enough here to warrant a purchase if what I have said hasn't put you off, but considering what it could have been, Epistory was a disappointment to me.

34067810.review:
A relaxing, engaging adventure game where you type words to interact with the world, whether it be regrowing trees, destroying blockades, unveiling lost memories, rebuilding bridges or fending off waves of monsters will magical spells while atop a giant fox.

The layout of the world and all of its puzzles are intuitive. You may get the feeling of being lost but end up exactly where you need to be before you know it. Puzzles have a similar air to them: you're always learning them at a comfortable pace. Its never confusing and obscure. The concept can be clearly deciphered.

Much like the world, the combat and mechanics are also intuitive - not just because everything involves typing either. As you progress, they will gradually introduce you to new mechanics without completely spelling out every little detail for you - they will not baby you. However, you will still learn everything you need to know organically - through play. They strike the balance well.

Its difficulty is not punishing. It is casual and relax but still engaging/challenging. In fact, its difficulty scales with how well you play. Every decision in a battle can be a strategic one. The different spells and settings will demand that you learn its mechanics and execute appropriately, if you wish to succeed, which is done in a fair manner. 

This game's mood is not epic or grand. The journey is calm, for the most part, though for the younger crowd, those afraid of insects and those afraid of the dark, it can be unsettling at times (in a good way). Its music is dynamic; ever-changing to fit the scenario you fall into. Whether it be exploring a new landscape, making closer and closer steps toward solving a puzzle or getting swarmed by gigantic bugs and horrors. 

All the while, throughout your entire journey, your story will be narrated. Speaking of which, the voice acting is also good. It will never take you out of the moment - what it will do is pull you deeper into the world.


If you still aren't sure, do remember that they have a demo available.

34004436.review:
Going into this, I expected it to be another typing game with a formula similar to "The Typing of the Dead." But no. This game is a unique breed that is an absolute masterpiece. 

Epistory follows an unnamed female protagonist who rides around on her steed (a giant fox). As you walk around, you get narration of what is going on in the girl's head. In order to make progress (defeating enemies, removing obstacles), you must type the words shown on the screen. The game has a "free" mode (where you can walk around), but you can quickly switch to "battle" mode (typing) with the touch of the space bar. It balances adventuring and battling really well, in a fun but marginally stressful way. This game will most likely take you anywhere from 5-8 hours to complete, and features a mix of easy and challenging achievements, as well as a beautiful card set.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]

[*] The artwork is beautiful. It's colorful, and gives you the feeling that you are in a story book. As you make progress, panels pop up and expand the world around you. It really gives a great focus on the beauty of nature. The game manages to use typing not only as a way of progression and as it's core game mechanic, but it also uses it for great story telling. Even the words that are spoken by the narrator (and remain on the foreground of the world) is very artistic and fun. 

[*] The music is all very good. Each world features its own music, there is a battle theme, overworld theme, and the narrator of the story has a great voice that is easy to listen to. The music compliments the artwork to make a complete picture of relaxation. 

[*] The game features a massive over world and has 8 unique levels within it. Each level is a decent length - not too short and not too long. They all have unique themes, and the right amount of puzzle solving within each one.

[*] You harness four elements: fire, ice, lightning and wind. These allow you to make progress in each world, vary up your battle techniques and expand the world. It's a really great idea, and it keeps things feeling fun and challenging. Some enemies can only be killed with a certain element, and some puzzles require a certain element.

[*] Detailed map. Halleluja! The maps are helpful and detailed in order to help achieve the "collecting" type achievements. The map only shows what you have discovered - which allows you to focus on one area at a time. This takes out the possibilities of getting lost and to be able to make solid progression without frustration.

[*] Great auto saving and a fair difficulty. If you die, you'll just be put back a few steps from where it is that you died. You never lose any real progress. When you want to quit the game, you can come back and be right where you left off.

[*] Lots of difficulty options. The standard "universal" difficulty I feel is pretty fair, but if you are having difficulties you can turn it down to Easy or Easiest. For a challenge, they also have harder difficulties. You can level up your powers and give yourself other great advantages by spending experirence points which makes things even easier. 
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Although the story telling is very strong, there isn't much of an actual story. This is more the type of game that you have to immerse yourself in the way the story is being told, rather than wanting a great end result. There is an ending, and it does make sense to what was being told throughout... but it feels anti climactic and somewhat predictable.

[*] Movement can be a bit slippery. It recommends using some of the letters to walk around, but that's way too confusing - use the arrow keys instead. Even while using the arrow keys, sometimes it can be difficult to find the right angle. I found this most noticeable while trying to slide on ice (you have to line yourself up first, you can't change direction while sliding), and while trying to line myself up to hit a line of windmills with my wind power. The movement really seems to hate any angle that isn't one of the cardinal directions on the keyboard.  

[*] The bug nests are never removed from your map after you destroy them. This really bothered me. Chests are removed, and gates are removed.. but never bug nests. Since there is an objective to destroy them all, it can be really easy to lose track of which ones you've already destroyed when they're not taken off of the map. You'll probably want to make a mental note of the ones you've destroyed, or systematically destroy them one area at a time.

[*] The bug nest sections go on for WAY too long. I understand that it's supposed to be a "gaunlet" type of mode, but it sometimes doesn't feel challenging and instead feels tedious. Sometimes my mind would start to wear or my hands would start to get tired. Because you can only get hit once, making a mistake is fatal. If you get hit during one of these sections, you have to start the gauntlet all the way from the beginning. It is a great challenge, but there's over 20 of them in total, and so it feels a bit like over kill.

[*] For anybody who is a slow typer, I sadly can't recommend this. This game is specifically designed for people who can type quickly without ever having to look at their hands while typing. I would say that if your average WPM is anything less than 30, you won't have much luck trying to make progress in this game even on the easiest difficulty setting.
[/list]

33833396.review:
Una vera scoperta Epistory, titolo dei Fishing Cactus. 
In pratica un action/adventure/typing game ambientato in un mondo letteralmente fatto di carta che la protagonista, una ragazza a cavallo di una volpe,  dovrà esplorare in lungo ed in largo (e sopra e sotto) alla ricerca di quattro poteri magici (fuoco, ghiaccio, fulmine e vento) necessari per arrivare alla fine del gioco.
Tolti alcuni puzzle (solitamente premere bottoni) tutte le azioni si compiono scrivendo parole, in rari casi singoli caratteri o numeri: attivare interruttori, aprire bauli o semplicemente eliminare ostacoli dal proprio tragitto. E cosa più importante (ed a volte dannatamente complicata) combattere i numerosi nemici che si presenteranno a sbarrarci la strada.
Sulla trama c'è poco da dire, la voce narrante che ci accompagna non ci fornirà molte informazioni, tutto è delegato allo splendido finale.
L'accattivante stile grafico, l'ottimo sonoro ed il gameplay misto esplorazione/scrittura funzionano si integrano alla perfezione rendendo l'esperienza di gioco fluida e piacevole.
La durata è nella norma per un titolo indie di questo genere e per gli amanti della digitazione ci sono delle arene con tanto di classifiche online dove mettersi alla prova.
Un titolo da amare ma non per tutti Epistory, che richiede una certa velocità di scrittura ed una basilare conoscenza dell'inglese dato che la versione in italiano è stata annunciata ma non è ancora presente.

Hidden gem. 

Pros:
- Beautiful folded-paper-like graphics
- Compelling story
- Puzzles
- Growing (unfolding) world (so you don't get lost immediately :-p )
- Improves your typing skills
- Everything can be done by typing on the keyboard (no mouse or controller needed)
- Dying has no high penalty, you mostly spawn nearby

Cons
- Movement. It just sucks. Good thing you can't fall of edges or something like that.
- You need typing skills, but they will improve while playing.

You do everything in this game by typing. Moving around (wasd works!), destroying obstacles, killing monsters. Switch from movement mode to typing mode, and the words you need to type will appear. Sounds simple right? But what if you can't read the characters you need to type? Play, and you will find out.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, but only if you have at least some typing skills.

33712243.review:
Epistory - Typing Chronicles is a game in which you play as a girl who rides upon a giant fox. 

I loved the game's beautiful art style. The environments in the game are all quite unique, with their own coloration and atmospheres, and the attention to detail of the scenery and the architecture is quite beautiful.

I also enjoyed the soundtrack to the game, though I have heard some minor looping issues for some of the tracks, but its soundtrack is still quite lovely, and each track fits the mood of its level quite well.

I enjoyed the gameplay a lot, and I think it was a fun game to play, and I've never played a typing game that is as fun as this one. I think it does an excellent job at combining typing with adventure, and the four different magic elements are a nice touch. I also enjoy games that let you gather collectibles, and I think it was a cool addition to this game. ^.^

The few issues I have with the game are these: 

The story was kind of vague, and not thoroughly explained in any means, and I wish that certain things would've been explained. 

Some of the music tracks, as I mentioned, don't loop seamlessly.

Despite those flaws, I still very much enjoyed the game. I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys adventure games, games with unique art-styles, and games that let you explore quite a bit.^.^

[h1]Кто я?... Где я?... Как мое имя?...[/h1]
[b]Epistory - стала для меня просто невероятным приключением! Я влюбился в нее всем своим [strike]черным[/strike] сердцем.
Я пробежал полностью игру всего за 10 часов, но впечатлений получил на годы вперед! Великолепный визуальный стиль и множество не стандартных решений, не давали оторваться мне до самого конца. Хотя кульминацию игры, я разгадал еще на половине, мне это не мешало продолжать ей наслаждаться.

Крайне порадовало взаимодействие с окружающим миром. Это был мой первый опыт в играх подобного жанра, по этому был приятно удивлен, насколько хорошо такая система сочетается с общей игровой механикой. Очень приятный саунд на фоне, великолепно вливается в то что мы видим на экране. Так как мир из бумаги, все что говорит закадровый голос (довольно приятный) прописывается на окружающем интерьере, очень мудрое решение, особенно для людей не знающих языка. Локации не повторяются и каждая приносит новые геймплейны решения. Изучать мир очень интересно. К изучению, так же подбивают, закрытые зоны, доступ к которым открывают новые способности, виде маги, разделяющейся на стихии и по принципу применения. И да, в игре присутствую элементы прокачки, довольно простенькой, но она не смотреться инородно.

Сложность в игре на уровне и подбивает комбинировать, между магией, из-за чего постоянно держит в напряжении. Так же в игре нет выбора
сложности и каких-то дополнительных факторов подбивающих к повторному прохождению [strike]если вы не ачивкохантер конечно[/strike], что немножко огорчает. Но от этого история не кажется неполной, я получил те эмоции (и даже больше), которые хотел.

Рекомендую ознакомиться![/b]

33581858.review:
I only got this game for free because there was something wrong when I was buying this from Chrono.gg a while back. When it was resolved the offer was already gone, so as customer service should do, they gave me this product for free. That's it.

That said, I like this game. I almost 100% it, just two more Nests to go. You can play in under 7 hours.

Pros:
* Beautiful. Goes well with the theme of a journey of a writer, e.g. origami theme, handwritings, etc.
* Challenging, but doable. You may have to type very fast, but I think it's fun. Even if you scored 800 on the SAT, there are still some insanely long words you wouldn't understand (if they are words). There's even some strategy into it as time goes on.
* Very forgiving. There is no health bar; you die if an enemy touches you if you don't type fast enough, but you will spawn almost right where you left off, and the enemies have already took the damage that you dealt. There's even some encouraging text on the black screen, so this really prevented me from burning out.

Cons:
* Controls are hard to control. Because you view it at an 45 degree angle, much of the time you have to hold two arrow keys to go where you like. Don't even try their new letter-navigation method, it's counter-intuitive and takes too long to get used to. It's a nightmare when you have to deal with sliding-on-ice, because you have to be very careful what you press is where you want to go, otherwise you'll slide all the way in the opposite direction.
* Some glitches, but nothing that affects gameplay. e.g. Teleportation devices sometimes lacked the animation.
* Music doesn't repeat smoothly in last stage. For some reason. Doesn't seem to happen in earlier stages.

Some tips for gameplay:
* Don't worry about the points. Points are required to unlock later stages, but you should be fine. There are plenty of combo opportunities. Just type fast.
* Don't worry about the fragments. Fragments provide the life story of your character, but if you don't really care or are patient, you will get to see all of them in the credits (which kind of bugs me).

33445722.review: It is an awesome game. Great graphics, and excellent for typing. It is one of the best experiences I had with a game, and I really appreciate that is available on Linux.

33442509.review:
A genuinely charming, creative, and enjoyable game.

One of the most wonderful things about Epistory is the way in which it uses typing not just as a game mechanic, but as a thematic focus for both the story and the player's actions. Words that you type relate to the tasks you're performing, the emotional tone of the moment, and the metaphorical story playing out in the background of the main game. This is one of those rare examples of a game utilising its mechanics in a way that intertwines perfectly with the narrative experience it's trying to create.

Alongside a cleverly presented and emotionally compelling story, the mechanics are also devised in a charming way that has you rolling your fingers across the keyboard to turn cranks, punching in numbers to open safes, and hammering letters repeatedly to break open padlocks.

My only criticisms of Epistory would be that it's perhaps a little too long given how simple it is. While by no means a lengthy game (the main story taking me around 4-5 hours), the same patterns of puzzles interspersed with enemy gauntlets do become somewhat routine by the end of it, despite some clever gimmicks being thrown in to keep every dungeon fresh. Besides that, the ending also felt to me like it missed an opportunity to utilise the game's themes of writing and creativity in a way that gelled more closely with the story. I was expecting a really satisfying emotional payoff given how clever the game was at integrating its story with its mechanics, and what happened instead was slightly more predictable than what I'd hoped for. That being said, the ending is still very sweet and charming, and I may have shed a tear when the credits rolled.

Whether you're looking for a genuinely great typing tutor or a creative and enjoyable game, Epistory has you covered. It's a real breath of fresh air, and more than a little reminiscent of titles like Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons both in its emotional tone and clever treatment of game mechanics. Definitely worth a buy.

Are you terrible at typing?  Buy this.  Are you excellent at typing and want to test your skills in a fun way?  Buy this.  Do you love unique story telling?  Buy this.  Love puzzles?  Buy this.  Enjoy open world gameplay?  Buy this.  Like simple yet beautiful artwork?  Buy this.  Support independent development?  Buy it.  
I turned this game on to just check out for a minute while I was installing stuff from the summer sale.  By time I stopped playing, all 31 games had finished installing.  This wonderful game is addictive for all the right reasons.  There's a nice balance of puzzle solving, combat, exploration and RPG mechanics to really give almost anybody a reason to not put this game down.  The narration is wonderfully done, if a bit stern and stale after a while and I'd like to hear the character's voice rather than the narrator's a bit more often. 我找了十多年的打字游戏想证明自己的手速，结果百度上全是金山打字通警察抓小偷之类的，终于找到一个高质量的打字游戏。可以打中文拼音太赞了。每次都死在没文化上，室友曾豪言手速绝不输给我，最后看到了十倍的分数差，他说“我也要买！”

来点干货~~~~个人建议打无尽模式的时候选择火魔法 。可能每个人的水平不一样，适应的魔法也不一样，每个魔法各有特性，这一点游戏做的非常好的。竞技场建议前期冰魔法后期火魔法或者电魔法，保证连击不断并且减少后期能减少输入量。本人目前森林图5.6W。

以下是剧透（慎读）：剧情是讲一个小女孩重伤昏迷，在昏迷过程中做了个很长的梦，故事就此开始，通过寻找自己的回忆来从昏迷中苏醒（很像Deemo）
一共8个副本，收集到全碎片后可以得到八张完整的记忆图片。分别是：（一下为根据图片猜测）
1。小时候在与小狐狸的相遇
2.与男朋友相遇，甜甜蜜蜜
3.获得学位，即将踏入社会
4.男友意外死亡
5.独自一人背井离乡
6.自己一个人的时候思念已故的男朋友
7.（没太看懂）
8.从昏迷中苏醒，重新找回生活的希望

33121449.review:
[i] 感谢「野蔷薇」及开发者提供的游戏体验机会。[/i]

图文版 [url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Epistory_Typing_Chronicles/review/2533707] 秘境奇缘：字谜编年史 的评价 by 十年一梦 - 奶牛关	[/url]

本作是会让人眼前一亮的作品。

骑狐狸的小女孩漫步在文字的世界里，用冰火风电四系法术去破除障碍、敌人，去收集灵感碎片、去书写整个世界。

游戏最有特色的玩法莫不在于所有的互动基于打字，如果以前玩过金山打字通的警察小偷游戏，肯定会有一种莫名的情怀在里头。

[b]游戏性	[/b]

本作基于打字的互动行为新奇独特，同时加入了不少解谜机关的互动，整体游戏并不单调。游戏中设置有冰火风电四种属性的法术以及配套的能力升级，除了障碍破除需要用到不同属性外，后期怪物也会同时以多种形态出现，利用好不同法术的属性特点是顺利通关的关键。本游戏对于打字速度具有一定的挑战性，但游戏也有难度适配机制，在死亡多次后会适当降低游戏难度，让不同手速的玩家都能够体验完整的故事，而不至于因为难度影响游戏体验。游戏场景除了主世界外还有八个子地图（尚未通关，根据收集品推测）每个地图的场景互动设计上会匹配一种或多种法术属性，各具特点且拥有独立的收集品和互动方式，相当用心。


[b]画面	[/b]

折纸画风充满着诗意，看着世界以书本展开的形式扩展让爱书人激动万分。整个游戏画面非常明丽，色彩斑斓，或许一定程度上是对文字世界丰富内容的一种映射。游戏场景中除了主动触发的机关动作十分生动外，充当背景的植物、动物也非常精致。


[b]]剧情	[/b]

游戏简介中说主角是一个缺乏灵感的作家， 希望通过冥想来寻找灵感。游戏过程中，主角的思想意识会以文字形成显示于场景之中，通过主角在秘境中的不断前进，脑海中的文字也不断丰富。由于是刻画思维碎片，所以不同场景的话语不一定有很强的联系，更像是一个意识流的作品。

[b]]特别称赞	[/b]

本地化支持：本游戏对其支持的语言都进行了十分到位的本地化工作。以中文版为例，所有出现的词汇均为汉字拼音，并且场景与词汇有一定的关联性。这使得游戏体验非常良好，毕竟看到中文瞄一眼就能直接输入了，难度降低了，爽快感提升了。

成就：本作成就里有一类成就设置的很讨喜，成就名字为“1%冥想”，内容是输入文字数达到了了某本名著的1%。想想自己一不小心就启动了一本巨作的编写，成就感倍增。不过部分成就还是满有挑战性的，全成就需要相当的耐心。



[b]总之，本作可以称得上一个基本上没什么明显缺点的游戏，最适宜在厌烦了常规类型游戏的时候，游玩一番。	[/b]

This game kept me engaged from start to finish, which is rare. Something about it striking a balance between relaxing and intense. The graphical style and the fact that you type words to vanquish enemies are two leading factors in this.

33061357.review:
It's a fun little game and the art is great (except for the end). I do recommend it if it's on sale for $10 or less, but I'm surprised the reviews right now are "overwhelmingly positive". It's really fun as a shallow, distracting game, but I caution you not to pay too much attention to the narration.

The "story" just ... doesn't work. It fails terribly, in fact. I feel like the writers were attempting something somewhat deep, but it really just came across as bad emo writing. It consisted entirely--ENTIRELY--of cliched phrases and metaphors, mostly revolving around the girl whining and struggling for some reason that isn't really made clear. The girl says some completely out-of-context shit sometimes, which never connects to anything in the game. I get that it was supposed to be cliche to an extent, to remind you of familiar stories probably, but it really breaks immersion with how bad it is. It's also never explained:
--why she's riding as fox
--why everything's origami
--why there's elemental magic
--why it's a "writing a story/typing" theme
--what happened (even at the end)
The ending is kind of a random, cop-out ending, where the art suddenly gets crappy and you go "wait, seriously?" and then the painful credits roll. I think there were even a couple more dungeons I still wanted to complete, and had I known I was heading towards finishing the game, I would've waited on that one.

So, a lot of it was disappointing, but if you just want to type and run around on a fox and look at neat origami graphics somewhat mindlessly, I really recommend it. It was fun exploring the world, figuring out some puzzles (except the ice, ice sucks), and getting distracted for several hours. I'd play it again in the future.

32971222.review:
If you like typing games with a unique art style, music and somewhat of a story then this game is for you. Games such as Typing of the Dead where you only have to type the words on screen to damage enemies. In Epistory it is more intuitive as the game progresses you learn new magics such as fire and ice and have to switch between them to defeat enemies that are weak to those magics.

The game can get tough as it adjusts it's difficulty to your typing skills. However with perseverence the switching back between skills you can overcome any challenge.

To move the character you can either use the normal WASD keys, arrow keys or specifically for this game it also uses the RFIJ keys in order to keep you hand in the normal position to start typing. I wish there was a way to disable the WASD keys for movement if I'm sticking with the RFIJ keys as my fingers are flying all over the keyboard.

Love the game and looking forward to see it to its completion. Recommended if you like typing.

32940445.review:
A delightful typing/light puzzle game with a lot of heart, with some adventure and exploration.

I was swept in by the satisfying typing gameplay, and I had to keep playing because the story the narrator started to tell intriqued me. I won't go into details, so I won't spoil anything, but it's a sort of coming-of-age story. Touching in parts and there's a lot in there, to which any person can relate to. Thoroughly enjoyed the writing and story.

Puzzles in this game aren't too challenging, but some of the typing arena fights are very challenging, even though I consider myself a quick user of the keyboard. The hardest couple fights are optional though.

Music is good, sound design as well, plenty of different themes to the environments, they give a nice feel to the different areas of the game world. There is a lot to explore, and a bunch of collectibles to find, which in turn give you either upgrade points for better typing action powers etc. or fragments of paintings that relate to the game's story. The art style is something I'd describe as 'story book', and it is beautiful, works really well in 3D form. The graphics and art give the game a definitely charming look and feel.

Recommended for pretty much anyone, especially for typing game fans, and maybe for people trying to learn writing English. Playthrough time 5-8 hours depending on typing skills and completionism.

32936209.review:
画风独特的小清新打字游戏。

游戏风格和死亡打字员（The typing of the Dead）俨然是两个极端。本作画风明亮、故事正统、解密难度适中，通关以后打字手速确实有不少提升。现在加入中文了不过中文打的是拼音……

尽管游戏最大的特色就是打字，但游戏本身叙事结构、解谜要素什么的并没有因为打字而有所削减。事实上就算把打字去掉，把所有的互动方式都改成鼠标左右键点击，它同样是一款画风独特、质量上乘的独立佳作。打字只是一个特殊的互动形式罢了。

随游戏进行，骑着红狐狸的女主会获得火、冰、电、风四种元素力量，并可随时通过输入特定的单词切换当前元素。游戏中的解谜要素和不少怪物都需要指定元素的力量才能通过。游戏地图不小，一些挑战关卡还需要灵活切换多种元素力量才能比较轻松地过关。

游戏的最终结局不剧透了，在我看来这结局依然是个 Happy End。仔细体会。

32683450.review:
令人惊叹的神作！

绝佳的游戏体验！

画面：☆☆☆☆☆

音效：☆☆☆☆

剧情：☆☆☆☆

玩法：☆☆☆☆☆

难度：☆☆☆☆

评论来自野蔷薇，感谢有机会能接触到这个作品！这款游戏去年就已经登录Steam了，但我似乎一直没有怎么听说过，真是太可惜了。绝对不可错过的神作！

起初比较感兴趣是因为中国特色的“金山打字通”（不知道多少人小时候玩过这个软件）。这个起初是在电脑刚兴起的时代用来练习打字的软件里内置了一些打字小游戏，现在看来那些青蛙过河、打气球、警察抓小偷的游戏也许很low，但那时候的确是一股清流啊。特别对我来说，打字速度已经练就神速的我一直都没能搞定警察抓小偷的游戏，成了一个难以忘却的记忆。而这款游戏让我回想起了那段每天噼里啪啦敲键盘的时光。

● 评价（夸奖！）

这款游戏把打字这件在电脑使用方面极其基础的行为，发挥成为一个精品游戏的主要操作，玩法已经很新颖了。而精美的低模风搭配悠扬的BGM给人带来的体验，正如折纸这种游戏的感觉——简朴但又别致、简单却蕴藏精巧，一种“Less is more”的舒畅体验，这又让玩家在游戏过程中能够心情愉悦。

在画面中不仅融入了低模风，还与折纸融合在一起。特别在遗忘之森的密门和主地图的瀑布那里，折纸的卷曲感圆润地和低模结合，怎么看怎么喜欢~

游戏的玩法虽然规则简单，但对打字速度和准确度等要求毫不含糊，这使得游戏并不只是一个打字游戏。而搭配主人公和巨狐CP搭档寻找记忆碎片、净化世界的剧情故事，搭配区域解锁+收集画廊的附加系统，再加上迷宫设定、解谜要素，还有高强度BOSS战和技能树，甚至在主页还有休闲模式的联机竞技场玩法，几乎对于一款游戏来说已经彻底完备了。而这些要素与游戏本身的结合非常融洽，毫不突兀。

另外更让人欣喜的是，游戏的完成度非常高。目前还没有通关，目测有5小时以上的一周目，加上收集成就会更长。地图之大、要素之丰富，都让这个游戏有很高的可玩性。对于我这种喜欢打字且打字神速的人来说，都能在BOSS战中体会到紧张刺激。即使厌倦了打字，在地图里闲逛游山玩水也是好的。

对于游戏本身来说，针对打字这一点适配了那么多种语言，也是一件很值得表扬的事。特别是字词大多都与环境适配，比如在森林就会出现“桔梗”、“巨石”，在火山洞就会出现“花岗岩”、“点燃”等。能体会得到游戏制作者的用心。

总之就是“好漂亮！好好玩！好刺激！好棒o(≧v≦)o~~”

● 建议（改进）

大的问题并没有什么，游戏也已经发布一年多了不知道还会不会修补。但感觉对于一款不错的作品来说，如果能抓抓小虫子尽善尽美，锦上添花也是很好的嘛~

目前还没有通关，这部分持续更新。

1. 第一次重置游戏后，有技能可升级的长条提示一直显示没有自动消失，直到切换地图才消失的。应该是BUG了。

2. 虽然翻译的质量总体来说不错，但还是有一些小疏漏。

3. 在某一次BOSS战中居然被“忽略”打败，因为拼音给的是“hulue”而不是“hulve”。（汉化工作成员不会平时用的都是模糊拼音吧啊喂！）

4. 记得以前看过一种说法，世界性的貌似都是大写字母比小写字母难认。特别对于中国的拼音来说，拼音字母并不存在大写一说。而且据我所知的大部分人的习惯来讲，是很少在拼音中间用分隔符的。比如打“西安”大家都会直接打“xian”然后去找字，而很少人会打“xi'an”吧。在游戏中这两点在某些时候都无形中增加了难度，而且不太符合常用习惯。

5. 竞技场不是多人同时竞技觉得有点不太刺激。

6. 目前遇到的最大一个问题是，在地图团战的时候表现的最为明显：一大群怪扑来的时候能发现，打字并不是按照单词来匹配的。举例来说屏幕上同时有“电流”和“观点”的时候，打“dian”的拼音可能会同时匹配两只怪，甚至打“i”的拼音可能会匹配到另外的单词上去（即使i这个拼音是出现在别的单词的中间位置，比如屏幕上同时还有“事件”的时候）。这一点不太好，很可能会因为匹配错而需要有几秒的调整，显得也不够智能。

待补充。

总之呢，这是一款我非常喜欢的游戏。不论是画面音效，还是剧情玩法，很多细节都让人乐在其中。非常推荐。

收起

32600336.review:
I've never played a 'typing' game before, I've always been worried that typing would just slow a game down. Well, that's not the case at all, not with this game anyway. You don't have to be an elite typist to get through this game, I would say that I'm on the lower end of average in terms of typing speed and I never got myself stuck. The game does reward you for being a fast key puncher but you won't feel left out if you're a 'pick and plucker' like me.

I have only one glaring problem with the game, the controls. It wants you to control your character using the EFJI keys...DON'T DO THIS. The normal WASD movement keys work fine in this game. I really recommend using WASD for moving around the majority of the time. The only time I used EFJI is when I had to line myself up perfectly to do a puzzle (going across ice and lining up the windmills).

The art style is truely a joy to see, beautiful colors, wonderful orgami-like unfolding animations that trigger upon finding a new area. The areas of the game vary widely so there's no worry about seeing the same thing over and over again. The only problem I had is that the cut scene paintings and the paintings you find in the dungeons do not live up to the art style of the game. They feel pretty mediocre after wandering through the main body of the game.

Who knew combat through typing could be fast paced? It's not so hard that you can't keep up and just die all the time but it's not so easy that there's no challenge. There are a couple different 'stances' you can be in when in combat and each has it's uses. I didn't feel that one stance was more powerful then the rest and I found myself switching between them often. I never felt forced into using a certain technique to push forward, you could decide to camp one stance or swap between all of them freely, it's completely up to you. I do wish there were more types of enemies, maybe a different set of bugs for each biome? I got tired of facing the same ones throughout the game.

The story is somewhat vague until the end, but for me that helped me connect to the game. Instead of playing through a specific person's narrative it felt more like I was facing fears and stresses that everyone can relate to, it becomes a story that you can slot yourself into. For some people, that like linear, well defined narratives, this might be more annoying then enlightening. But if you are willing to let yourself fill in between the lines then you will enjoy this cathartic journey. There is a lot of voice over narration, but it's a good actress and it generally doesn't pop up at annoying times, like when you are in combat.

Overall, I highly recommend this game, it was a refreshing experience for me. A must have for people that are interested in seeing the boundaries of story gameplay pushed.
