22181166.review:
10/10 would type the longest words in the dictionary again.

People shouldn't give early access games negative reviews on bugs alone, so even though there's a few of them, I'll try to give you a heads up on the major ones so you don't run into the problems I did. Overall I think this is a cool game.

Pros:
[list][*]Art direction. I am a pretty big fan of this. Watching the world grow around you as you progress really motivates you to continue and the book page animation style to the tiles really fits the theme of the game. Everything has the "cut from paper, seemingly origami" aesthetic. Very cool.
[*]Sound. I think there is a subtle elegance to the sound that they chose to go with and it isn't intrusive but still gives a nice ambience. The end song was a wonderfully unique composition.
[*]Gameplay & combat. This is as complicated of a gameplay style that a typing game can get. They did really well on this front. The game has an 'experience' bar, which uses a feather currency that is acquired from typing words and opening treasure chests, abilities that you can level up, and four schools of magic that you learn along the way, which allow you to progress to new areas of the game. Everything is very well-paced, albeit if you are a fast typist you will finish the game relatively quickly and be yearning for more. ;) I finished the game in approx. 5 hours.
[*]Difficulty curve. They have an adaptive difficulty setting that can be turned off or on.
[*]The developers do seem very involved in addressing player issues/questions/reports.[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Your character doesn't stop as suddenly as you would like sometimes, and more than once I found myself sliding into an enemy and dying as a result. Think Mario or Donkey Kong in an ice level.
[/list]

Edit-After typing this review I got a personal e-mail response from one of the devs addressing some of the neutral points and cons, which was very nice of them and so I've edited out some things that maybe was a quick judgment on my part. They are doing a great job!

*Update*-Removed some bug-related things from the cons list as the devs have fixed them. Game continues to be amazing!

22174149.review:
I'm a fast typist and have always wanted a challenging typing game. I bought this game on a whim and was pleasantly surprised with a great dramatic story dialogue, a mix of simple puzzle elements (mostly a hybrid of Legend of Zelda and Undertale-esque floor puzzles), cool upgrades, hidden-item secrets and thoughtful level design. The game is presented to you in a dungeon format and features an unlockable skill tree progression of your choosing. This is neat, because you can cater to your own play style for an easier or more challenging game early on (although you'll eventually unlock all skills).

Everything in the game is done through typing - including the ability to navigate the pause menu (opened with the Tab key, how clever), movement, attacking and changing skills. Enemies crawl towards you (on easier difficulties, they move slower) and if you're hit once, you have to redo the encounter from the beginning. If desired, you can change difficulty on the fly with no penalty. For achievement hunters, note that there are no achievements related to difficulty setting. 

I used to play Typing of The Dead on my SEGA Dreamcast a lot and even picked up the new one, but it always lacked a challenge and isn't difficult to complete without dying if you're a good typist. With Epistory, the hard mode in combination with adaptive difficulty feels just right. Skills affect enemies in different ways and on harder difficulties, you need to use them effectively - being able to switch skills on the fly opens for really unique ways to tackle different situations.

As a learning tool for typing, I can see this game as being quite effective. The game itself has only cartoon monster violence and no explicit language in it's stock dictionary list (the author plans on implementing Steam Workshop support for community submitted dictionary lists, however). Multitasking is encouraged with skills, but you are only typing one word at a time - not sentences. Since the majority of the dictionary has short words, this has the benefit of reinforcing muscle memory quickly. The game would be best used for learning in combination with another typing tool or website utilizing full sentences, however. 

My only complaint is that I do not feel in-game statistics (viewable at the title screen) of words per minute are accurately assessed. This isn't a huge deal and beginning typists should familiarize themselves with knowing where the keys are before chasing such numbers. I can only surmise this inaccuracy is due to the way words will slowly crawl onto the screen, as well as the typing of short bursts, but I don't know how the game timer calculates WPM. In other words, in a real world scenario, you will be typing full sentences and not waiting for words to crawl onto the screen at a varying pace.

During boss encounters, the game throws hordes of enemies at you. This is when the game gets very fun and tests your ability to type short bursts of words in as little time possible. Once you defeat the boss, however, you cannot replay that same boss battle again without starting the game over (normal dungeon and overworld enemies will continue to respawn upon re-entry, even after completion). At the time of writing, the multiplayer mode is not present, but it's my understanding the online multiplayer aspect will feature a boss battle sort of scenario - allowing you to continue practicing in this fashion.

Epistory took me about seven and a half hours to complete with all skills, unlocking all of the overworld and doing a lot of optional stuff on the hardest difficulty with adaptive on. Further replayability lies in multiplayer and achievements, which are mostly just replaying the game again to get more kills. Still, this is the best typing game I've ever played and worth it even at full price!

22171729.review:
I bought this blindly to test out a new keyboard, so you can imagine my surprise when a "typing game" actually turns out to be an expansive RPG with a challenging and complex battle system and a touching story. In fact, the typing-game-connotations aren't doing this game any favors, since it has more in common with Bastion, Okami or Darksiders - it has a gradually expanding overworld, themed dungeons, elemental powerups that also act as gating abilities to access certain areas, secrets and collectibles, side activities like monster-nest removal, etc. The combat tests more than just your typing skills, asking you to switch between elements on the fly (by actually typing the element's name) and using the right elements on the right targets (by judging their size, the complexity of their words, and the speed they're approaching you) in the right order. It makes for some pretty nail-biting encounters, and more than a few deaths.

I was pleasantly surprised with how the story integrates into the gameplay. The game has no cinematics, and never leaves the isometric perspective, so storytelling falls to the voice-over narration and, more importantly, the level design. The girl-riding-a-fox-and-fighting-insects fantasy plot allegorically tells the biography of a woman, and every dungeon depicts a pivotal moment in her life. E.g., the "water temple" is a puzzle-filled greek ruin under constant threat of a flood, mirroring the woman's stressful college years. This is conveyed through visual design, subtle narration (occasionally in another voice, which always signifies the woman in question speaking outside of the fantasy plot), details like the enemies having academic terms as their "health bars," and that dungeon's collectibles, which together make a picture of a graduation ceremony. It's a really nice way to freshen up the classical Ocarina-of-Time level progression.

22171311.review:
This game. I'm not really sure how to describe just how much i love it. The story is just great. At this point its having small sound issues but i'm sure they'll be fixed very soon so i'm definitely not going to downgrade it on that.

Pros
-Great story
-Almost flawless controls
-Beautiful Art
-Decent progression if a little bit fast
-GREAT music. LOVE IT
-The voice actor. Most calming voice ever. This game is super relaxing until you get a monster with pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis over their head in which case its time to have a heartattack.
-Seriously i love this game all of the cons are so minor i dont even really care about them. I just am putting them there for referance.
-The music. Seriously. The music.
-The ending threw me for a loop. No spoilers but not only was i shocked but i was very pleased with it. It wrapped up the game nicely.


Cons
-For someone like me who types approximately 100 WPM it was pretty easy and a fairly fast game
-Sometimes the game will decide to kill off an enemy that had the same word as the enemy i actually wanted to attack. I dont really think that's fixable though so adjust strategy accordingly
-I felt like i was gaining experience too fast
-Sometimes it would decide i was typing a different word than i was and ding me for a mistake. making it very difficult to get one of the achievements.
-I think the rating on WPM may be a bit off. Not only have i taken frequent typing tests but my job required a minimum 80 WPM which i passed with 115 at the time about 2 months ago. This game however says i'm typing 35 WPM. So thats a little off but whatever.
-As of right now my sound issues have stopped but i did have an issue with my sound working. If this happens to any one else try moving the volume bars in the options. That's what fixed it for me. They also may have patched it by now though.


All in all the cons are so minor that i don't really care about much on them. Its mostly just small things that could easily be patched later and didn't really effect my enjoyment of the game. If i had to score it I'd have to say it was a 4/5 if only just because i wish it was longer and the experience progression was a bit slower. I was max level before i ever entered the last dungeon. That being said i did EVERYTHING on the map before entering it so that may have something to do with it.

22166590.review:
What a lovely game. What a lovely game! I'm only 1.5 hours in, but I want to type a couple of words here before I forget. 

I can already say that it is well worth the money, and unless this game ends in like 30 minutes or less from where I am I'd even venture to say they should up it a bit, because 14,99€ seems like an absolute steal.

The typing feels great and thrilling - some encounters are really hectic, and pulling off a perfect spree when it's practically hailing words and letters at you makes you feel awesome. There is also a "dynamic difficulty"-setting which is hard to measure without knowing how it works, but it seems to me like the difficulty adapted pretty well. I feel that the challenge is just right to not be frustrating but still make me sweat a bit.

The world is very pretty with the crumpled paper look, and it's really sweet how it unfolds before your eyes.

The narration is stellar, well-paced and delivered in a way that befits a world that unfolds piece by piece as you explore it. Really draws me in and makes the experience feel really special. 
The music is also great. I remember getting shivers down my spine when the music emphasized the sudden dramatic turn in the narration in the beginning. I feel like that sync between music and narration was lost a bit after the intro bit though, not as much well-timed changes that amplify the narration, but maybe I'm just a bit too focused on typing words like a raging lunatic to notice now.

One small gripe I have is that it becomes a bit tricky to follow the narration that happens during hectic fights because the audio seems to be overcome by the sound fx of magic being fired and enemies dying. Might be a setting to increase the volume of the narration, but I think the sound level is perfect out of combat, so not sure if that's a good solution for me.

As a final note, it takes a bit of getting used to the proposed control scheme(EFJI), but after a while it starts feeling natural and doesn't cause any noteworthy grief. I missclick from time to time, but no problem really, and it's getting earier all the time. If you really can't stand it they've enabled ordinary WASD-movement as well, so it shouldn't be a problem for anyone.

I absolutely, absolutely recommend this game if you even slightly enjoy typing-games. Even if you aren't a huge fan, this might be the title to win you over since the world and the narration draws you in.

22164215.review:
Comparative review: Bastion meets Typing of the Dead with a touch of Zelda.

It tells its story in a very interesting way. Literally a storybook that's being created as you move about the world. The core mechanic is switching into a "typing mode" and quickly typing out words hovering over the environment, chests, and enemies. Typing quickly extends a combo meter and when the meter is finished, it adds XP to your level bar. The XP bar gates abilities and places you can go. As you unlock new areas, new dungeons are discovered. Within these dungeons are "tools" that grant you new special abilities. The two I've encountered so far is my attacks/typing are now Fire & Ice based. By entering "typing mode" I can switch between them by typing "fire" or "ice". Fire burns enemies after the first correctly spelled word (most enemies take two words to defeat) and Ice will stop an enemy for a period of time. Since your character dies after being touched by an enemy, combat consists of using your typing skills to pick the right targets and switching between your two attacks.

My only criticism is that the movement is a little clunky. It Tries to teach you an alternative control screen at the start of the game but I found myself naturally using WASD to move. It works well enough and you can quickly put points into movement speed (and a sprint skill) but traversing the world feels very rigid.

Apparently the difficulty adjusts as you play the game. The worse you are at typing, the easier the words are. I spend my entire day typing so I'm getting some very long and difficult words thrown at me. There have been a few occasions where part of a word was not inputted since I was typing too fast. This isn't a normal occurrence, however.

Did I mention you are a young girl riding around on a fox being narrated by a the author writing a book? I probably should have mentioned that.

I really recommend this. Despite it being very Bastion, it's incredibly unique.

22163903.review:
打字游戏高级版。已通关。

整个世界都是以折纸的方式展开，除了几个简单的解谜，所有互动都是通过输入单词来进行。音乐动听，画面唯美，但有的地方太杂乱，小个的敌人很难发现，且敌人头上的单词除了大小没有其他分别。[spoiler] 眼拙死了几次还以为卡BUG。[/spoiler] 

蹭一下就死的主角一共有四项技能，火、冰、闪电、风，随着游戏进行在各个章节的小地图中获得。火可以清除荆棘、点燃敌人燃烧掉一个单词；冰，冰冻水面造路，封锁敌人的行动；闪电可以导电、攻击会产生连锁反应，随机消除零到两个非攻击对象的一个单词；风，击退攻击对象和其周围的怪。

个人觉得闪电是最有用的技能，清怪便捷，当遇到单词又臭又长的怪，你只需要攻击他旁边的弱鸡，几下就把它给蹭死了。而没有弱鸡时，可以用冰技能封锁住单词又臭又长的昆虫，再慢慢打字。风最不实用，我经常把怪吹到屏幕外，打了一半的单词又得重新打。

战斗方式是通过输入昆虫头上的单词攻击，前期会觉得有趣，但后期有一段时间连续进行战斗，并且略拖时间真的很让人乏力，另外还有一些非常恶意的设计。当那只顶着二十来个字母的长腿昆虫出现在我面前时，我脑子里只想着给制作组寄刀片。

游戏的解谜成分几乎可以忽略不计，按顺序踩符号、拉电闸开关门、踩亮地板上的砖块、从固定的方向吹动风车等等，谜题都非常简单。

按一下shift奔跑、地图显示收集物品都需要用技能点，这种设定让我有点迷。后期地图输入对应地点名可以传送，我是到通关时才发现的┑(￣Д ￣)┍


整个游戏过程给我的感受是打字一定要快快快。

菜单自带两个无限模式的BOSS战地图，还有全球排名。



喜欢打字游戏的玩家可以试试。

22161230.review:
[h1]一年后旧游重玩[/h1]
这一次，经过一番斗争，成功打开了第三章——闪电元素的大门！
暂时是刚起了个头，又出现了新的解谜风暴，当然依然并不复杂。
游戏的基本要素一年前刚玩的时候都介绍过了，也没啥好过多描述的了。
Enjoy the game!

[h1]3小时更新——[/h1]

果不其然。火元素之后，水元素到来。
在冰与火之中切换，全新打怪体验！Typing,typing,typing!
这么一来，对手速的要求就更高了，容错率大大降低。[spoiler]想想后面很可能会再出现别的元素，我已经独自在风中凌乱，一脸明媚的忧伤[/spoiler]。
解谜难度依然不高。水元素解谜的时候，就必须同时熟悉FEJI键位和WASD键位了。否则每一步都要想是哪一个键，会很耗时间（虽然解谜对时间是没有要求的，然而玩起来很不痛快）。
[strike]然后，之所以只玩了一个小时是因为——
我卡关了……
怪物头上的“no_word”看得我直接懵了，不知道输入什么，然后主角不停地挂掉，于是就这样卡关了……
有人知道该怎么做吗？[/strike]
重新进了一次游戏，没有再出现类似情况。大概是游戏中留下的一个小小的Bug吧。

————————————————

[h1]2小时玩后感——[/h1]
这款游戏的主线是小女孩和狐狸的探险。


折纸式的清新画风；
简单的解谜（只玩了前几关，暂时都很简单）；
多种技能、属性升级(一切为了更好地打字服务)；
自动存档，死亡原地重生再战（继续打字，输入英文单词）；
简短的英文句子，旁白剧情。没听清也没关系，会在地面显示刚才的话。旁白大致听了一下，有冒险，有亲情，也有爱情（可能有出入，毕竟忙于打字和收集）；
行走是用FEJI的键位（至今没分清上下左右分别是哪一个按键）。不过没关系，也可以用WASD，虽然这样操作的话走路是斜着走的。使用空格在行走模式和打怪模式中切换。按住方向键的同时按住shift可以快跑。TAB键切换到地图，技能，图片展览之类的。总之就是菜单。
一开始是普通世界，不能打怪。后来到到火焰元素世界，升级技能可以进行火属性攻击。游戏中我还经过了水元素世界（暂时没有解锁），不知道还有没有别的世界。感觉会很丰富。
打字是这款游戏的主题元素：打字收集——“魂”（？）解锁新世界，打字消灭怪物，打字击碎石头，打字排除挡住去路的荆棘（？），打字点燃火种……另外，连续命中会有“魂”的加成。[spoiler]键盘敲得好，游戏没烦恼；打字打得快，幸福少不了[/spoiler]。
英语好，或者说词汇量大对游戏是有帮助的。一方面有助于理解剧情，不用随身携带字典；另一方面，看到一个认识的单词比不认识的打起来肯定要快。
当然，词汇量不够大也没关系。熟悉键位才是最重要的。[spoiler]心明眼亮，指如疾风，势如闪电，身法、轻功属性全满，练就一身盲打功夫的你，一定能成为大触。[/spoiler]
另外，如果你玩过《bastion》的话，二者的模式其实是很相似的。只不过《bastion》以攻击的方式打怪，而《epistory》则是通过键盘击退敌人。
[h1]99/100[/h1] 我个人是很喜欢这款游戏的。[spoiler]如果游戏满分是100分，我给81分。剩下的以666的形式给出。少一分，留下进步的空间。[spoiler]

[spoiler]刚入坑时候买的吧，都是回忆。[spoiler]

22160204.review:
Un excellant jeu depuis l'ealy access, j'ai vu l'évolution de ce jeu magnique aujourd'hui on peut dire que c'est un jeu original avec un scénario et un univers mignon mais spécial. Ce jeu est pour tous ceux qui recherchent de l'originalité et se détendre dans un univers agréable, cependant ce jeu n'est pas fait pour ceux qui cherchent de l'action ou qui ont des difficultés avec l'environnement. De plus tous ceux qui ont du mal à taper sur son clavier ce jeu vous aidera à écrire vite sur son clavier puisque la difficulté est progressive.

Franchement bravo!

Entre la fin et l'early access, ce jeu est un bijou d'idée fantastique tout au long de son développement. Graphiquement mignon et poétique, une intrigue intérressante avec un univers unique dans le monde littéraire, ce jeu plaira au néophyte du genre comme au puriste. La progression de difficulté est bien équilibrée ce qui peut plaire au personne ayant des difficultés à écrire vite sur un clavier d'ordinateur. 
Une note? 8/10 car la perfection n'existe et l'univers est très ancré dans le monde littéraire pouvant déplaire au septique de ce genre et au personne ne s'adaptant pas au style du jeu. Si vous êtes intrigué ou motivé le jeu vous plaira 100%

22155579.review:
Epistory n'est pas tel qu'on pourrait imaginer un typing game, austère, chiant et didactique. C'est une superbe aventure en papier, magique et profonde, qui se déplie devant vos yeux au gré de votre progression.

Et ces combats !! Ils sont aussi frénétiques que le reste de l'aventure est zen. Calibrés au milipoil, intelligents, intéressants. Croyez moi, vous retrouvez au milieu de dizaines de monstres insectoïdes se précipitant sur vous, switchant sans cesse de magie au rythme des cliquetis frénétiques de votre pauvre clavier, c'est épique ! Et finir de taper le dernier mot du dernier monstre le coeur battant à tout rompre, étonné de vous en être sorti au finish contre des créatures ayant des mots comme"vasodilatation" et autres "fourmillements", vous donne un sentiment d'accomplissement hors norme :D

Il n'est pas parfait, quelques bugs seront encore à corriger après sa sortie, mais quelle aventure rafraichissante !
Oh, et puis sans spoiler l'histoire pourrait bien être plus profonde qu'elle n'y parait ;)

Enjoy !

22154503.review:
Really, really great.
It's a typing game in terms of its game mechanics, but really it has much more in common with games like Bastion.
The game is a little buggy in places, but nothing game-breaking. And the gameplay is really, really fun.
The story is a tad cheesy, but decent. And the voice acting is actually pretty decent, which is much more than can be said for many indie games.

But the gameplay is where this game really shines. Intuitive, addictive, and fun. I'm REALLY enjoying exploring the world. 
And, bonus, it's kid-friendly, but not childish. And it looks really great. 
Highly reccomend.

22151787.review:
Шикарная игра, но только для людей любящих и хорошо умеющих печатать вслепую (притом на английском). Пол года назад я переучился на раскладку dvorak (альтернативная раскладка для английской клавиатуры) и было приятно что эта игра поддерживает различные альтернативные раскладки. Уровень сложности автоматически подстраивается под игрока, не знаю как чувствуют себя в этой игре люди которые не очень уверенно печатают вслепую или лепят много ошибок, даже с моим умением во многих моментах было тяжело и многие арены я не раз переигрывал. Ничего нового в печатный геймлей данная игра не привносит, такое не раз видели еще со времен флеш игр, но качество проработки мира и квестов отменное - так сильно в печатную игрушку вложились впервые (тайпинг оф зе дэд - не в счет, его все таки как тир разрабатывали, а печатный модус прикрутили потом). Красивый мир, необычная графика, очень приятно открывать-разворачивать кусочки карты. прокачечка (есть бесполезные скилы, но есть и те, которые надо брать в первую очередь - отталкивание противников, усиление урона огнем, ускорение на шифте (некоторые квесты без него не пройти). Пазлы и арены - разнообразны, действительно левел дизайнеры хорошо поработали. Игра проходится на одном дыхании и мир игры достаточно большой, на 2-3 вечера. К концу игры вы полюбому прокачаетесь на максимум и откроете все скилы. Много ачивок, обещают скоро вернуть арену. Багов немного есть, но пройти игру это не мешает (да и исправят их скоро, над игрой работают, это видно) - проблемы со звуком в некоторых местах, глючный сундук в шахтах и глючные сундуки в небесном храме.

Вот только с ценой разрабы офигели. Я брал в раннем доступе, за 350 руб. и то, считаю что очень дорого (из-за любви к печати, решил что можно поддержать проект). Поэтому желающим купить, советую ждать скидки до 200-300 рублей.

(осмысленные тексты на английском я печатаю со средней скоростью 70 впм (350 зн\мин), простые слова могу набирать со скорость до 90 впм (450 зн\мин))

21833551.review:
FR - ENG

Français
Jamais d'un jeu d'aussi peu d'ampleur (premier jeu crée par l'équipe pour l'équipe, et non sur commande) je me serais attendu à un tel spectacle car c'est la seule chose à laquelle ce jeu me fait penser, 
à un magnifique compte de fée de plusieurs heures, dont la fin, alors qu'elle n'est même pas encore écrite m'atriste déjà par sa simple présence.

des graphismes simple mais magnifiques, des musiques participant à l'ambiance du jeu, une difficulté qui s'adapte selon le joueur et sa vitesse sur un clavier, que peut-on demander de plus, même à un jeu à gros budget.

Si vous cherchez un jeu qui vous permet de poutrer du kevin, passez votre chemin.
Si vous chercher un jeu qui jouera sur chacun de vos nerfs, et que vous pourrez faire jouer à tout le monde (aussi bien enfants qu'adultes), n'aller pas plus loin, installez vous, et profitez du spectacle.

English
Never had i found a game done so well for so small a team.
it's not a game with fire and blood, but beware that this game may rewind time to make you the child you were before, seated before the fire heart listening to an old tale.

a fairy tale of awesome yet simple graphics, nice ambient music, and correct difficulty for anyone (as it adapts to your typping speed), 
a good game for everyone, just kick back and enjoy the show.

21823437.review:
The game is more addictive than fun for me. Some knowledge of the basic layout of your keyboard is required if you don't want frustration to get the better of you. The difficulty will also increase as you unlock new magic. The biggest fun I had was unlocking the sections of the map. The animation for those was amazing as you see how the world opens up like a book.

There are of course a few bugs remaining like monsters with no words (but I only had that problem in the ice section of the map) and some spiders turning purple but aside from that, no mayor problems.

I recommand this game. It isn't what you would usually play but you'll find it fun (addictive) quickly enough. Just don't be fooled in thinking this is an easy game, where you only need a keyboard. Is is actually much harder this way than something you play with mouse+keyboard or a controler.

20683060.review:
«Нет ничего сильнее слова».

Epistory отличается от большинства существующих в мире игр своей механикой. Она проста и увлекательна, не заставляет особо напрягать мозг. Но, в то же время, глазам и пальцам приходится работать на износ. Да, вы не ошиблись – это игра в жанре «Typing», одним из ярких представителей которого является The Typing of The Dead: Overkill, но речь не о ней.

Очевидно, что в игре нам придётся набирать текст, а точнее, слова, используя клавиатуру. Но вы, должно быть, спросите: «А что в этом увлекательного и интересного?» Как минимум, игра заставит вас стучать по клавишам с такой скоростью, что ваши соседи будут наведываться к вам в гости и просить не так громко нажимать на кнопки. После прохождения Epistory проблем с набором текста на английском языке у вас точно не будет, никогда. Игра активно подстраивается под уровень умения игрока, позволяя овладеть навыком тайпинга с нуля.

Сюжет прост и незамысловат, в нём совсем нет ничего необычного, уделять внимания я ему не стану. Игровой процесс – основа данной игры, на которую сделан упор наряду с визуальной и аудио составляющими. Внешне игра напоминает Shelter и её оригами-стилистику. Всё выглядит так, как будто собрано из различных бумажных фигур, покрашенных красками. Особенно радует момент, когда происходит открытие новой локации: вся поверхность, изначально выглядящая как лист бумаги, буквально на глазах «собирается» в различные объекты окружения, тем самым вдыхая жизнь и придавая краски окружающему миру. Он, в свою очередь, представлен широким диапазоном заснежных лесов, пустынь, пещер, руин и абстрактных планов. Скучать не придётся: локации сменяются примерно каждые 20 минут. Саундтрек в игре ничем особым не выделяется, но в атмосферу вписывается отлично, не надоедает и не отвлекает от игры. Главная героиня резво рассекает по выдуманному раю писателя на гигантском трёххвостом лисе, тем самым помогая ему с его творческим кризисом. Есть в этом что-то милое, приятное и очаровательное, заставляющее игрока осознать, что истинное бескорыстное добро имеет именно такой облик.

Игрок, управляя Музой, взаимодействует со всеми элементами игрового мира при помощи набора слов на клавиатуре. Нужно сдвинуть камень, загораживающий дорогу, или одолеть врага – печатайте одно или несколько слов. От силы противника напрямую зависит длина и количество слов, которые вы должны написать. Стоит мерзкому насекомому достичь главной героини, и она тут же погибает. Вам предстоит исследовать большой линейный мир, находить различные артефакты, открывающие доступ в новые места, и одолевать врагов и боссов. Присутствует в игре и прокачка. С каждым новым уровнем игрок будет получать очко навыка, которое можно потратить на улучшение способностей Музы, позволяющие слегка облегчить игру. Она научится быстрее передвигаться на своём лисе и дольше удерживать комбо-очки, дающиеся каждый раз при успешном наборе слова, и это ещё не всё.

В Epistory может начать играть абсолютно любой, даже не знающий английского языка человек, ведь это никак не повлияет на игровой процесс. Те же, кто языком владеют на среднем-высоком уровне, смогут заметно подтянуть свой вокабуляр, так как слова, которые нам придётся набирать, так или иначе связаны с предметами взаимодействия. После выхода из раннего доступа в игру был добавлен русский язык.

Аттрибуты Steam’а были добавлени после релиза: достижения, карточки и доски лидеров. Игра получилось очень доброй, приятной и душевной. Она способна оставить множество положительных эмоций и воспоминаний. Если у вас есть дети или младшие братья/сёстры, можете дать им поиграть в неё, она очень красочная и увлекательная, им понравится. Заодно, научатся молниеносно печатать текст, это пригодится в жизни.

20318771.review:
[b]TIME TO EDIT THE EARLY ACCESS REVIEW FOR A COMPLETE REVIEW[/b]

I knew about Epistory before it was put in Early Access because Pedago-tic ASBL (I work there) happened to be among those who organized a game jam in Belgium, with Fishing Cactus. So, I heard about Epistory at that time and waited for the release.

Unfortunately, real life got in the way and I only bought the game during the last Winter Sales. I'm testing it now and writing a review.

Epistory is a game where you're a young girl on a giant fox, without memories, until she realizes that something bad will happen and that she will be the one that will restore the world around her.

The story is told by words displayed when you're going forward, in a poetic manner. However, you will have to remove obstacles, open chests, kill enemies or restore the nature by typing words that will be shown in writing mode - you don't see them when you're moving around.

Each word spelt will give you XP and after reaching a certain amount, you can improve an ability by typing the noun. Words are also tied in the category: for gems/rocks, it will be names of them, for everything that needs fire in the game, it will be related to that topic....

If some words seem gibberish, it's normal, as you need special powers to understand them. For example, at the end of the investigation of the meteorite's crash site, you'll be able to use fire where you need, so that you can go forward in the game.

The girl has no power in the beginning, however, she'll acquire the power of fire (burn the next word), ice (stop an enemy for a few seconds), thunder (can destroy words above other enemies) and wind (can knock back enemies). These powers are the main focus of each chapter "dungeon".

The XP acquired is also needed to unlock new areas, whether they're related to a zone to clear or a nest to clear (nests being circles with black smoke: enemies are coming in waves).

That last feature of enemy waves is also found in the arena mode, with leaderboards.

The little downside to that is that as everything is written with the keyboard, when you're defending yourself against enemies, you can't move at all as the writing mode is keeping you where you stand. Besides, as you need to type fast, you're bound to miss letters and loose time as the enemies are advancing towards you.

Also, I wish that I could bind arrows as I'm used with this config since years. Here, I have to adapt myself to a ZQSD (which I can handle). But the problem is that the primary binding is EFIJ to move around. I struggled a lot with that because I couldn't put my fingers back to these bindings after writing. EF are also just next to ZD, so, you bet that when I wanted my character to go to the right, it was going to the left, because I pressed E/F insteand of Z/D.

However, you choose your difficulty and you can also enable an adaptative difficulty during the waves. If you're struggling, each time you start, the enemies will be slower or simply not coming all in the same time but with more space in time for example.

The graphics are very impressive, like an origami or papier-maché landscape. I love the difference of ambiance: brightful in the beginning and yet, the more the girl is exploring, the more she's seeing devastated landscapes (a cave caused by a meteorite, an abandoned mine, a temple destroyed by water, shattered isles, even a forest full of spiders without forgetting a desert).

While the audio was initially broken, I managed to get it back, though I don't know if it's due to the solution posted by Fishing Cactus or not. It's marvelous and magnificient. Also, they followed advices from players to include a full audio in English to tell the story written on the path of the girl. The narrator did very well her part.

True, you still have some bugs around, after all, we're all stuck to 16 combos, which means that I'll probably have to erase my data and play the game again (but not before unlocking the achievements with enemies killed and words written). However, Fishing Cactus is reactive, so, I have faith to see soon a patch.

Epistory was a game I was recommeding back then and I'm not disappointed by the whole package. If anything, it should be in your library as it's a wonderful story, so poetic. The typing gameplay is also a good core for it.

Really, a true gem.

19763494.review:
More Impressions @ TheVideogameBacklog.com

I, for whatever reason, enjoy a good typing game. I spent a lot of hours in the flash game of Typer Shark and numerous other games like it being compelled by some unseen force that really gets a kick out of typing. Then out of nowhere came Epistory – Typing Chronicles from Fishing Cactus and it was even more fun than the rest. Could this be then end-all-be-all? I’m not sold on that, but what we do have so far is very promising.

Epistory uses an origami approach to the aesthetics of their game and it’s very cool to watch the world unfold as the story unravels and to watch your character explore and unveil the ever-expanding world unlocked with challenges. (Ok, that’s enough of that.) Either way it’s cool. I think one of the more frustrating things was finding a place you couldn’t get access to due to Epistory being in Early Access. It is understandable since it’s not done yet, but still… I want it! I’ve said it before and I’ll no doubt say it again, that if wanting more is “the problem” the player is feeling, then the developer us doing something right. (Unless your game ends on a cliffhanger and there is no sequel planned, then it’s just all sorts of wrong.)

I was also thinking that this could be a good tool to help teach my daughters to type when they get older if we’re not all jacked in neurally by then. Alas, the difficulty shows itself numerous times with what’s been given so far. I think that as a tutor, this would only breed frustration. This is more of a get better and finesse your skills than it is a teaching game. That’s not a bad thing, but I think there is an opportunity here to capitalize on if they added a slower learning mode. That way a parent might be swayed into picking this up with two or more people in mind rather than just to enjoy the story so far themselves.

As far as the story goes, there’s not too much to say about it since it’s still not finished and I’m not sure what the end game is here. Epistory is, however, less interesting than it is more compelling. That’s a difficult thought to put into words, but let me try. It’s not going to win any awards at this point from me, but I feel strongly compelled to play more and level up. Also killing bugs is always a good thing since the only good bug is a dead bug. It almost feels like the story is a background to the action on the screen. That certainly shows when text pops up during the middle of a “boss platform” where tons of crap starts to get thrown at you… yeh, I read most of that after the fight. So there could be something to the story, but I think that Epistory has me on the gameplay mechanics alone at this point. That’s kind of cool too in its own way and it also wouldn’t be the first time I’ve enjoyed a game simply by playing it without cause or concern for a story. There might also be an element of disconnect from myself and the protagonist. I don’t know her name or story, I just start playing as her and I’m killing bugs. Like I said, it is fun, but I’m not emotionally invested in her yet. Maybe as the game goes on I will attach a little more to her. I still want to help her though.

One last note, at this time they have two powers to use when typing: fire and ice. Fire will slowly burn up the next word on an enemy’s “life bar/word que” so you won’t have to type the next word in and the ice power should be self-explanatory, but it freezes the bugs in place. You’ll get more time to type if you freeze them, but you’ll have to type less if you burn them. Some enemies will force an option on you while others will give you the choice of what powers to use (for me, it’s usually what I’ve already selected, but I do appreciate the freezing.) With that said, I’m not sure if there is a point system in place for burning a word up or getting more time to type another word in. Do I lose part of my experience bonus if I don’t actually type it in? If I freeze and eventually type that second word in will I get more experience points? I’m not sure, but I like leveling up so on the side of caution I’m just freezing as many as I can so I can level up more. Should they be clearer? Maybe. Am I worrying too much about this detail… probably. Is that how I’m going to continue to play the game since I don’t know… definitely!

Score: Support This Title!

Yes, you should pick this up. If you enjoy a good typing game… well, this is a great one. There is a bit of challenge here, but that’s another reason to play this game, to get better. The story is neat, but the art style is something that I think most people should experience because it’s pretty cool looking. It’s very well done and I’ll try to stop harping about it. The game is fun and I can’t wait for more of it/the full game to come out so I can continue to play.

18958746.review:
(DISCLAIMER: I was gifted this by the developer in the hope I would provide a bit of promotion UNPAID. I have since livestreamed and have formed the following opinion on the game)

Epistory is an action/adventure game that feature nothing short of gorgeous near-artistic levels of design and a story that I'm sure has deeper meaning than it tells.

I will say that the look of Epistory blew my mind when I first started to play, it's been a long time since a game put a real genuine smile on my face and this did it...and then some.  A good deal of effort has been put into both the mechanics and asthetics and it really does show. It seems fairly calm at first and you can quite easily type away to kill off enemies coming towards you but be warned, when you hit "boss" arenas you'll be wishing you took a touch-typing course because you'll soon be bashing away at your keyboard so fast you'll see your own hands become but a blur!

I managed to complete the Early Access in one livestream playthough (approx. 1hr40mins) and I know a lot more content and story is coming and I honestly cannot wait!

When I did finish, despite the manic typing I felt so relaxed I couldn't play anything else afterward, I just sat down and chilled out, no game has made me do that, I tip my hat to you Fishing Cactus.

I absolutely reccomend you support this games' development, at £6.99 it's a steal for the amount of work that has gone into it already!

4/5 - Needs a voice narrator, and I know this is something being looked into so expect this to turn into a 5/5 later on!

This feels more like an investment for the future, not that this is a bad thing.

Unlike the well known house of the dead's take on 'typing involved gameplay', this is a very realaxing wonder through the forest, trying to find your bearings, that is until an all mannor of creepy crawlies start coming for you. 目前还在测试阶段，游戏本体未完成，我下这个测评的时候两三个场景就TBC了，不过还是很有趣，期待完成品！

18322001.review:
I intended to wait a bit before writing a review, but considering the fact that this game is only three days in its early access period I decided to post this positive prelimnary review. Instead of a lengthy write-up I'll just list the main pros and cons for the present version.

pros:
- very focused gameplay concept that doesn't stray from its path ... doesn't try to do things not part of the core idea
- very nice graphics, clean and colourful look, very pleasing
- good sound design
- the developer is very responsive on the forums

cons:
- neither features nor world and content are complete in this early version (This isn't really a downside, but when buying the present version it's still a fact. In the past on other early access titles even seemingly highly motivated developers ran away with the money / ran out of money and left without commenting or taking their game from the store. I don't see that happening here at all, but yea... ;) )
- the concept is very limited (again: I don't see this as a real downside ... , but since the game already has the RPG tag in the Steam tag system I'd still like to mention it once more: The game is very focused on its core concept and doesn't stray from that. It might be labeled as an RPG by other Steam users, but really: The number of skills doesn't reach a two-digit number, there are no items, no NPCs, no dialogues, no real choices to be made etc. etc.. If you do NOT expect these things I don't think you'll miss them, just ... don't buy this game looking for an RPG with complex character customization options.)

bottomline:
- If you like short(ish) games with fresh gameplay mechanics and clean, nice, but not overly sophisticated graphics, but don't buy feature-incomplete games: WISHLIST this
- If you like short(ish) games with fresh gameplay mechanics and clean, nice, but not overly sophisticated graphics and don't mind risking a few EUR on a feature-incomplete game which seems to be very well on track: BUY this now! It's seriously A LOT of fun!

18271663.review:
Epistory is the tale of a muse lost for words, who traverses a strange world on the back of a fox. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xu8MNvTJvzg
What a beautiful world it is, all made of paper it slowly unfolds as progress is made, screenshots don't do it justice. Closest thing I could compare it to aesthetically speaking would be "Tearaway".  Gameplay is a combination of exploration and light puzzle elements with the story unfolding through subtitles placed on the land. Enemies faced are killed through typing, each using related words that tell somewhat of a side-story. 

As it stands, can be played through in about 90-120min. Two different areas containing puzzles and hidden chests followed by arenas where you do battle against waves of enemies. Combo+Point system exists but at this stage it's quite barebones. Chests found and points awarded can be spent on upgrades for your fox, such as runspeed and magic power. Plans for the future include, adaptive difficulty/word settings, leaderboards, fleshing out combo systems and addingmore chapters to the story.

Controls were all keyboard driven, WSAD keys could be used but since it's a typing game it does try and teach correct hand placement by using EFIJ instead. No in-game options available, screen resolutions of 4k+ were supported through the unity launcher. Given the wonderful presentation and the fact it I was hooked from start to end, Epistory gets my recommendation. Just keep in mind the target audience and current length (Devs mention 25%~ complete). If funds are a bit tighter, might be worth wishlisting instead. Cheers folks.

18266427.review:
Ce jeu est une vrai poésie. Nous sommes un écrivain qui cherche l'inspiration afin d'avancer dans notre histoire. Cette histoire est celle d'une jeune fille blonde accompagnée de son fidèle ami le Renard. Nous voilà embarqué dans un monde fait de papier où les mots nous guident à travers d'énigmes, de combats mais aussi de découvertes.

Epistory est ce qu'on appel un Taping Game. Son concepte, son gameplay : écrire. Nous nous servons uniquement du clavier, que ce soit pour se déplacer, se frayer un chemin, résoudre les énigmes, se défendre contre de vilaines bébêtes, ou même naviguer dans les options (bien que ce dernier nous pouvons utiliser la sourie). 

Il faut savoir être rapide  et avoir un clavier bien éclairé (pour ceux qui tape en regardant comme moi les touches :D). Chaque mot écrit apporte de l'xp et met en place une barre de timing afin de gagner encore plus d'xp en tapant les suites de mots.  Viens alors le premier point de compétence à dépenser soigneusement.

Bref, Dans Epistory nous évoluons et combatons avec les mots, des simples aux difficiles. 

Concernant le contenu, il est un peu difficile de donner un avis étant donner que c'est une alpha et que je ne l'ai pas encore terminé. Je dirais qu'il manque quand même quelques petites choses pour combler mon appétit. J'ignore encore quoi mais je le découvrirais !
Sinon niveau musique et son, il y a quelques petits bug (non génant). C'est jolie, plutôt calme ou rythmé selon les situations.

Je conseil Epistory à tout ceux qui recherche une expérience nouvelle et qui aime quand même taper sur le clavier ^^.


Ps: il est possible que mon avis change durant le teste, et/ou que je  développe un peu plus les différents aspects et critiques du jeu.

18265496.review:
Falls jemand von euch einen kurzen Einblick ins Spiel wünschenswert fände... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R_81QWNKjaQ&feature=youtu.be

Epistory: Typing chronicles... Meine aktuelle große Spielliebe. Und das völlig unverhofft! Manche von euch mögen das Spiel gelangweilt in die Ecke schmeißen wollen, einigen von euch wird es so wie mir ergehen: Ihr werdet völlig baff und vor allem eins sein: Verzaubert!

In diesem Spiel geht es um Wörter. Um Kreativität. Um Abenteuer. Um Fantasie. Wir stecken quasi im Kopf eines Schriftstellers und steuern die Figuren, die in seiner Geschichte vorkommen. Wir sind somit seine "Eingebungen". Wenn wir uns bewegen, beginnt die Landschaft um uns herum zu leben, und durch fleißiges Tippen von Wörtern wird die Landschaft immer prächtiger. Hierbei bleibt es jedoch nicht - damit keine Langeweile aufkommt, gibt es Gegner, die ein enorm schnelles Tippen erforderlich machen und auch einiges an Schätzen zu entdecken und zu sammeln. Die Punkte, die wir durch das Tippen der Wörter bekommen, können wir zum Skillen unseres Charakters benutzen. 

Auch der Soundtrack ist absolut atmosphärisch und passt grandios ins Spiel. Menschen, die Verspieltheit, Schönheit, und kein Problem mit Wörtern haben, werden es lieben!

39501451.review:
First and foremost, this game is absolutely beautiful. From the graphics, to how everything is treated as a story by having paper shift to create the environment, to having all words appear on the environment itself. It's really all lovely. The voice actress is really great, too. There's so much emotion and meaning behind her few words, for which I greatly appreciated.

One note, though: if you don't like typing games, you wont like this game. Plain and simple.

I enjoy typing games (ex: Typing of the Dead). This game stood out by having the concept of schools of magic. An enemy may need to be killed using fire, for example, or you may want to choose to use electric/spark magic because any hits against an enemy split off and hit a few other enemies nearby. 39491247.review:
Epistory Typing Chronicles is an isometric, story driven, dungeon crawler with a truly unique combat system by developer Fishing Cactus.

Epistory tells the story of a girl and her faithful fox steed as they attempt to repair a post-apocalyptic, tumultuous, world all through the power of typing. Players traverse a massive over-world which is unlocked one piece at a time, unfolding itself in front of the player as they progress through the story. The highlight of Epistory is the spectacularly designed map and dungeons which are far beyond what you would expect from a game of this caliber.

Additionally, the art direction of the game was an unexpected plus with its ability to tie in the art direction so beautifully and intimately with the story. The fact the origami style art in the game has a deeper meaning within the context of the story goes to show the care and heart this studio put into their game and should be noted by other developers, big and small.



The prime issue with Epistory is how tiresome the "combat" of the game becomes. For those who have played typing games before you know your brain an hands can only handle so much before you become fatigued and disinterested. This same issue occurs within Typing Chronicles as the more you play the more the typing based combat feels like a chore opposed to a feature. This becomes more and more apparent as the puzzles remain varied and interesting but are broken up by the more monotonous typing challenges. While introducing different "attack types" throughout the game does help ramp the difficulty and variability of the typing challenges it simply does not add enough excitement over the course of a 5-10 hour game.

There are additional issues with balancing of the game. While playing I only upgraded my stats 2-3 times as they never quite felt necessary to complete the missions particularly early on in the game. This would lead to me losing a typing challenge, using the stockpiled points, then having a massive power spike which allowed me to breeze through the challenge. This made the game feel less like I was developing my typing skill and instead using my artificial skill points to get past challenges.

It should be noted though, how the developers made a valiant attempt to keep the game pressing forward with their experience system. Many short (5-15 hour) games struggle to match player and story progression which leads to odd balance issues at the end of the game where the player is drastically overpowered or must grind experience to be strong enough to finish the game. Typing Chronicles does not fall into this trap and should be commended for it.

The story of Typing Chronicles, while occasionally thought provoking, quickly became a collection of disjointed audio files which were too vague and ethereal to drive player investment into the story. The bulk of the story is developed in the final chapter of the game and (without spoiling too much) essentially voids everything else we had seen and heard about the story previously. The last 20% of the game excellently developed the main character, provided context, and even tied the game play into the story. This though made the first 80% of the story feel like even more of half baked mess. 

Overall Epistory Typing Chronicles is a wonderful game for those looking to sharpen or test their typing skills, and should be used in every typing class moving forward. With excellent level and puzzle design the game delights with its Zelda-esque dungeon/over-world and origami based art style. The game though is held back by its repetitive combat system, odd balancing, and disjointed and overly ethereal story/tone.

39470386.review:
Es un juego muy simple y adictivo. Te van contando una historia, y para avanzar por ella, debes ir limpiando el camino de obstáculos y enemigos. ¿Cómo? Escribiendo palabras. Inclusive en el menú puedes moverte a base de escribir adónde quieres ir (continuar la historia, ver la galería de imágenes, cambiar opciones...)

Cuando te acercas a un obstáculo o enemigo, al activar el modo escritura (espacio), aparecen palabras encima de éste. Al escribir la palabra correctamente, el objeto o el monstruo pierden esa palabra. Al destruir todas sus palabras, desaparece y te da experiencia. Al ir alcanzando cierta cantidad, obtienes puntos para ir distribuyendo entre tus habilidades, que haran tus hechizos elementales más fuertes, entre otras cosas.

Hay también un modo Arena, en el que vienen monstruos en oleadas infinitas. El objetivo es sobrevivir y acumular la mayor cantidad de puntos posibles antes de que llegue el inevitable final.

Otra cosa genial: todos los textos están traducidos a varios idiomas, entre ellos el español, aunque la narradora habla en inglés.

Es un gran juego que pone a prueba tu nivel de mecanografía.

非常不错和寓教于乐的游戏！本游戏再带超高重量的中文，画风很美丽。[spoiler]故事讲述了意味小姐姐在遭遇了某种变故后昏迷，在梦境中进入梦之桥，在探索世界的同时[strike]思考了哲学三问[/strike]一步一步发觉自己的身世，最后在玩家的帮助下重新醒来的暖心故事。 [/spoiler]

首先游戏优点是显而易见的：
+唯美的画风
+信达雅的中文翻译
+丰富的中文打字词库，有专业词汇，成语，嗨哟偶一些奇怪的词语，[spoiler]最骚的是天朝健康游戏16字诀[/spoiler]
+设计精巧的收集品（有助于我们了解小姐姐的生活）

   为孩子的打字入门教程[spoiler]虽然我还没有女朋友[/spoiler]
+不错的剧情，虽然我一开始以为这是一个KOG重新恢复自然的故事
+非常不错的BGM

听说开发商要开发另一款新打字游戏，所以有一点缺点建议改进：
-不太好的操作间绑定机制
-有些地方实在是太亮了，根本看不清拼音和汉字
-风元素解密时偶尔出现bug，需要小退才行

39538574.review:
[b]Simply Fabulous [KAMGUSTA's REVIEW][/b]

This game is great. Read on: you ride a huge three tails fox and explore an enchanted land made of paper that unfolds as you acquire points (by exploring dungeons and typing as fast as you can). 
The core of the game is quite revolutionary (albeit it reminds me of the game "typing of the death"): you interact with the environment by typing words on the keyboard, you also kills enemies the same way. Every enemy has its own set of words (shorter or longer based on its size) and also some elemental vulnerability (the classic ones: "air", "water", "fire", "electricity"). Later in the game you will have to switch your powers and use a little of strategy to kill them.
My typing skills are great (80 WPM) but I found some combats very challenging. Later I found the game self-adjust its difficulty. So I guess it tried to punish me, but really everyone can play and enjoy it. 
Graphics is very nice, everything seems to be made of paper and every zone of the world is very different (mountains, desert, forest, volcano, etc) but always rich in colours.
The world and the dungeons are full with simple but ingenuous puzzles that rely, as usual, also on your typing skills.
In some ways this game reminded me of Zelda. It is certainly a work of art.
I finished it in 7 hours with 100% completion.

[b]Only played with Keyboard
Recommended Buy Price < 10$
Score 9/10[/b]
